text: And Pharaoh called Abram , and said , What is this that thou hast done unto me ? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife ?
text2: Təzzar isassaɣra - ddu Firɣawna Abram in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ma di təge da ? Ma fəl di wər təmela as tant ̣ ut - nak a wa ?

text: Why saidst thou , She is my sister ? so I might have taken her to me to wife : now therefore behold thy wife , take her , and go thy way .
text2: Ma fel təgannaɣ - i tamad ̣ rayt - nak a wa har dər - əs naman ̣ sa ? Əmərədda tant ̣ ut - nak da əlwəy - tat idaw dər - əs tugagaɣ - i . »

text: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him : and they sent him away , and his wife , and all that he had .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna y aytedan - net ad idawan d Abram har t - əkkəsan daɣ akal - net , ənta əd tənt ̣ ut - net d a wa ila kul .

text: And Abram went up out of Egypt , he , and his wife , and all that he had , and Lot with him , into the south .
text2: A di da fəl ig ̣ mad Abram Mas ̣ ar , innəmad ten ̣ eray ən Negab , ənta əd tənt ̣ ut - net d a wa ila kul , iddew dər - əs Lot .

text: And Abram was very rich in cattle , in silver , and in gold .
text2: Abram ikna təgərgist daɣ hərwan d əzrəf d urəɣ .

text: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel , unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning , between Bethel and Hai ;
text2: In ̣ kar Abram ad itagalat gər Negab d əɣrəm ən Bet - El , har os ̣ a edag wa daɣ izzəbbat əs tizarat , gər Bet - El d Ay ,

text: Unto the place of the altar , which he had made there at the first : and there Abram called on the name of the LORD .
text2: edag wa daɣ ikras edagg ən təkutay dat a wen . Iɣbad Əməli .

text: And Lot also , which went with Abram , had flocks , and herds , and tents .
text2: Lot a dər - əs iddewan ənta da ila eharay wa ənd ̣ ərran əd wa zəwwaran im ̣ os aɣaywan aggen .

text: And the land was not able to bear them , that they might dwell together : for their substance was great , so that they could not dwell together .
text2: A wa əgan hərwan - nasan daɣ igət abas tan - eway akal , wər əfregan aharog .

text: And there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram ' s cattle and the herdmen of Lot ' s cattle : and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land .
text2: Təggaz - tu tamazaq šin n amel gər mad ̣ anan n Abram əd win Lot . As itagg ' a wen Kəl Kanan əd Kəl Fəriz əntanay da əɣsaran daɣ akal wen .

text: And Abram said unto Lot , Let there be no strife , I pray thee , between me and thee , and between my herdmen and thy herdmen ; for we be brethren .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' Abram i Lot : « Ma tu təmal tamazaq gar - i dər - ək wala gər mad ̣ anan - in əd win - nak fəlas iməd ̣ rayan a nəm ̣ os .

text: Is not the whole land before thee ? separate thyself , I pray thee , from me : if thou wilt take the left hand , then I will go to the right ; or if thou depart to the right hand , then I will go to the left .
text2: Akal ket - net illa dat - ək . Mazzay dər - i : As t ̣ ətrama nak ad - ak adannaga as tədənnaga nak ad - ak ət ̣ rəma .

text: And Lot lifted up his eyes , and beheld all the plain of Jordan , that it was well watered every where , before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah , even as the garden of the LORD , like the land of Egypt , as thou comest unto Zoar .
text2: Idkal Lot as ̣ awad - net inay as am ̣ adal kul n agarew wa n Yorden ket - net išwa , šilan aljannat , madeɣ aɣlal n agarew wa n Ənnil , har əɣrəm ən Tsohar , harwa wər ihlek Əməli Sədom əd Gamora .

text: Then Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan ; and Lot journeyed east : and they separated themselves the one from the other .
text2: Isan ̣ n ̣ afran Lot i m ̣ an - net tatawla kul wa n Yorden , iggəlat iddənnag . Esaway wa da as əmməzzayan məd ̣ rayan .

text: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan , and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain , and pitched his tent toward Sodom .
text2: Abram iɣsar daɣ akal wa n Kanan . Mišan Lot ənta iɣsar daɣ ɣələyɣəlayan ən ɣərman ən tatawla ən Yorden . Ikras ihəktan - net har Sodom .

text: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly .
text2: Kəl Sədom əm ̣ osan ark - aytedan əknanen tišit ən nasbakkadan dat udəm n Əməli .

text: And the LORD said unto Abram , after that Lot was separated from him , Lift up now thine eyes , and look from the place where thou art northward , and southward , and eastward , and westward :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Əməli y Abram , dəffər as immizzay əd Lot : « Ədkəl as ̣ awad - nak əs ̣ wəd daɣ t ̣ amasna d agala əd dənnəg d at ̣ aram ,

text: For all the land which thou seest , to thee will I give it , and to thy seed for ever .
text2: fəlas akal kul wa togge da ad - ak - k - akfa kay d əzzurriya - nnak har faw .

text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth : so that if a man can number the dust of the earth , then shall thy seed also be numbered .
text2: Ad - agaɣ əzzurriya - nnak šilat ən təblalen n am ̣ adal as kundaba awedan wa ifragan a tanat iššid ̣ ən a - tu - z - iššid ̣ ənan .

text: Arise , walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it ; for I will give it unto thee .
text2: Əbdəd awəy d akal sas agawer - net əd təzzəgrət - net fəlas tehakkay a dak - ku - z - aga . »

text: Then Abram removed his tent , and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre , which is in Hebron , and built there an altar unto the LORD .
text2: Iggəlat Abram ikras ihəktan - net daɣ eškan zagrotnen əhanen edag wa daɣ iɣsar Mamre dagma n əɣrəm wa n Xebron . Iɣsar den da . Ikras edagg ən təkutay y Əməli .

text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom , and with Birsha king of Gomorrah , Shinab king of Admah , and Shemeber king of Zeboiim , and the king of Bela , which is Zoar .
text2: iga əməgər gər əkkoz ət ̣ t ̣ əbəlan win əd s ̣ əmmos mənokalan əm ̣ osnen Bera wa n Sədom əd Birša wa n Gamora əd Šinab wa n Adma əd Šemeber wa n Tsəboyim əd wa n Bela as itawan ̣ n ̣ u tolas Tsohar .

text: All these were joined together in the vale of Siddim , which is the salt sea .
text2: Imənokalan win da əgan eɣaf iyyanda , əmmən ̣ ayan daɣ aɣlal ən Siddim wa im ̣ osan azalada Agarew n Əsaləɣ , əqqalan egan iyyanda .

text: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer , and in the thirteenth year they rebelled .
text2: Maraw elan d əššin a əgan əllan daw taɣmar ən Kədorlahomer , əffəllagan awatay wa n m ̣ araw əd karad .

text: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer , and the kings that were with him , and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim , and the Zuzims in Ham , and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim ,
text2: Daɣ awatay wa n m ̣ araw d əkkoz Kədorlahomer d ət ̣ t ̣ əbəlan win dər - əs əddewnen ərzan Kəl Rəfay daɣ əɣrəm wa n Aštərot - Karnayim , Kəl Zuz daɣ wa n Ham , Kəl Em daɣ wa n asalwa ən Kiryatayim ,

text: And the Horites in their mount Seir , unto El - paran , which is by the wilderness .
text2: əd Kəl Xor daɣ akal - nasan , idɣaɣan ən Sehir . Əssəglan daɣ - san terazay har os ̣ an aɣrəm wa n El - Faran illan dagma ən tan ̣ eray .

text: And they returned , and came to En - mishpat , which is Kadesh , and smote all the country of the Amalekites , and also the Amorites that dwelt in Hazezon - tamar .
text2: Dəffər a di əqqalan - du ewadan - du aɣrəm wa n En - Mišfat w ' as itawan ̣ n ̣ u əmərədda Kadeš . Ərzan akal kul wa n Kəl Amalek əntanay əd Kəl Amor win əɣsarnen daɣ Xatsətson - Tamar .

text: And there went out the king of Sodom , and the king of Gomorrah , and the king of Admah , and the king of Zeboiim , and the king of Bela ( the same is Zoar ; ) and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim ;
text2: Təzzar əg ̣ madan - du mənokalan əm ̣ osnen wa n Sədom , wa n Gamora , wan n Adma , wa n Tsəboyim əd wa n Bela as itawan ̣ n ̣ u Tsohar , əgan eɣaf iyyanda əmməgaran daɣ əɣlal ən Siddim əntanay

text: With Chedorlaomer the king of Elam , and with Tidal king of nations , and Amraphel king of Shinar , and Arioch king of Ellasar ; four kings with five .
text2: d ət ̣ t ̣ əbəlan : Kədorlahomer wa n Elam , Tidal wa n Goyim , Amrafel wa n Šinar d Aryok wa n Ellasar , əkkoz ət ̣ t ̣ əbəlan fəl s ̣ əmmos mənokalan .

text: And the vale of Siddim was full of slimepits ; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled , and fell there ; and they that remained fled to the mountain .
text2: Aɣlal ən Siddim id ̣ kar en ̣ wan aggotnen a daɣ d - itawaɣaz madɣar ən kolta kolta . As əd ̣ d ̣ əggagan mənokalan wa n Sədom əd wa n Gamora əlɣasan daɣ en ̣ wan win , a wahad ̣ an id ̣ d ̣ əggag s ədɣaɣan .

text: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah , and all their victuals , and went their way .
text2: Imənokalan win ərzanen ədkalan təla ən ɣərman kul , wa n Sədom əd wa n Gamora , ədkalan tolas isudar - nasan təzzar əglan .

text: And they took Lot , Abram ' s brother ' s son , who dwelt in Sodom , and his goods , and departed .
text2: Lot agg amad ̣ ray n Abram , iɣsaran Sədom , ewayan - tu ənta da əd təla - nnet , təzzar əglan .

text: And there came one that had escaped , and told Abram the Hebrew ; for he dwelt in the plain of Mamre the Amorite , brother of Eschol , and brother of Aner : and these were confederate with Abram .
text2: Os ̣ a - ddu iyyan daɣ mərrəza Abram wa n aw Ibri imal - as - tu . Azzaman win di Abram iɣsar daɣ eškan zagrotnen ən Mamre wa n Kəl Amor , im ̣ osan amad ̣ ray n Eškol , im ̣ osan tolas amad ̣ ray n Aner , imadahalan n Abram .

text: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive , he armed his trained servants , born in his own house , three hundred and eighteen , and pursued them unto Dan .
text2: As igraw Abram isalan n ətərməs ən rur - es n amad ̣ ray - nnet isammatag - du karadat t ̣ əmad n aləs əd m ̣ araw d ət ̣ t ̣ am əm ̣ osnen win d - ənnəfrannen əhunen daɣ aɣaywan - net , təzzar iggaz ədəriz n ət ̣ t ̣ əbəlan sas t ̣ amasna har Dan .

text: And he divided himself against them , he and his servants , by night , and smote them , and pursued them unto Hobah , which is on the left hand of Damascus .
text2: Izun egan - net den , fəl a - tan - ədəlan ənta əd meddan - net . Irz - en istaq - qan har Xoba aɣrəm ihan t ̣ amasna ən Damas .

text: And he brought back all the goods , and also brought again his brother Lot , and his goods , and the women also , and the people .
text2: Ibaz - du daɣ - san a w ' oɣan kul iqqal - du əd Lot tegazay - nnet ənta d a wa ila , əd təd ̣ oden d aytedan .

text: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer , and of the kings that were with him , at the valley of Shaveh , which is the king ' s dale .
text2: As d - iqqal Abram irza - du Kədorlahomer əd madahalan - net , imənokalan win dər iddew , ig ̣ mad - du əmənokal ən Sədom issəlkad - as - in daɣ əɣlal ən Šafe w ' as itawan ̣ n ̣ u aɣlal n Əmənokal .

text: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine : and he was the priest of the most high God .
text2: Malkitsedek əmənokal ən Šalem eway - du y Abram tagəlla d esmad . Malkitsedek im ̣ osan əlfəqqi ən Məššina Amatkol ,

text: And he blessed him , and said , Blessed be Abram of the most high God , possessor of heaven and earth :
text2: iga albaraka fəl Abram in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Təgrawa albaraka Abram ən Məššina Amatkol əmaxlak ən jənnawan əd m ̣ ədlan ,

text: And blessed be the most high God , which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand . And he gave him tithes of all .
text2: itəwəməlet Məššina Amatkol a igan imagzaran - nak daɣ fassan - nak . » Təzzar ikf - ay Abram təzunt ta n m ̣ arawat n a wa dd - oɣa kul .

text: And the king of Sodom said unto Abram , Give me the persons , and take the goods to thyself .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a əmənokal ən Sədom y Abram : « Suɣəl - i - du aytedan tət ̣ t ̣ faɣ - in təkarzay . »

text: And Abram said to the king of Sodom , I have lift up mine hand unto the LORD , the most high God , the possessor of heaven and earth ,
text2: Ijjəwwab - as Abram : « Əhada s Əməli Məššina Amatkol əmaxlak ən jənnawan əd m ̣ ədlan

text: That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet , and that I will not take any thing that is thine , lest thou shouldest say , I have made Abram rich :
text2: as wər z - ədkəlaɣ daɣ - ak wala tenallay za wala əzzəmi ən ɣateman fəl ma tən ̣ n ̣ eɣ : « Nak a isaggargasan Abram . »

text: Save only that which the young men have eaten , and the portion of the men which went with me , Aner , Eshcol , and Mamre ; let them take their portion .
text2: Wər z - ədkəlaɣ wala ar a wa ətšan meddan - in . Amaran meddan win d - i ədhalnen , əm ̣ osnen : Aner , Eškol , əd Mamre , əntanay ədkəlanet adagar - nasan . »

text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision , saying , Fear not , Abram : I am thy shield , and thy exceeding great reward .
text2: Ijjəwwab Abram , in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Əməli Məššina ma d - i za - takfa ? Nak wərge barar a əle əngəm ikkusət - i . » In ̣ n ̣ a tolas : « Wər di təkfeɣ əzzurriya , əmərədda iyyan daɣ eklan n aɣaywan - in , Eliyezer wa n Damas , ənta a di z - ikkusen . »

text: And , behold , the word of the LORD came unto him , saying , This shall not be thine heir ; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir .
text2: Ijjəwwab - as Məššina : « Kala wərge ənta a zz - iqqəlan amakkasu - nnak mišan wa dd - ig ̣ madan tadist - nak ənta a tu - z - iqqəlan . »

text: And he brought him forth abroad , and said , Look now toward heaven , and tell the stars , if thou be able to number them : and he said unto him , So shall thy seed be .
text2: Ikkas - t - idu dat - ahan , in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Əs ̣ wəd daɣ jənnawan əs ̣ s ̣ ən təfraga əšid ̣ ən n et ̣ ran . Əntanay z ' a dər z - agdu əzzurriya - nnak . »

text: And he believed in the LORD ; and he counted it to him for righteousness .
text2: Izzəgzan Abram y Əməli , iqbal Məššina tišit ta ig ' alɣadil fəl əzəgzan wa sər - əs iga .

text: And he said unto him , I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees , to give thee this land to inherit it .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Əməli y Abram : « Nak Əməli wa kay du - ikkasan daɣ əɣrəm n Ur wa n Kəl Kasday fəl a - kay - akfa akal a tileq - q . »

text: And he said , Lord GOD , whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it ?
text2: Ijjəwwab Abram in ̣ n ̣ a : « Əməli Məššina məni a wa as z - əs ̣ s ̣ ənaɣ as ad - iggəz təla - nin ? »

text: And he said unto him , Take me an heifer of three years old , and a she goat of three years old , and a ram of three years old , and a turtledove , and a young pigeon .
text2: Ijjəwwab - as : « Awəy - du taɣit ən karad elan , taɣat ən karad elan , akar ən karad elan , tadabert n əs ̣ uf d adaber ənd ̣ ərran n əɣrəm . »

text: And he took unto him all these , and divided them in the midst , and laid each piece one against another : but the birds divided he not .
text2: Təzzər eway - as - tan - du , a - tan - izamazzay daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as əs təzzəgrət - nasan isinəməs ̣ wid igannatan - nasan mišan ig ̣ ədad wər tan ifres . əg ̣ g ̣ aran nollaman šiməɣsa - nasan isattaq - qan Abram .

text: And when the sun was going down , a deep sleep fell upon Abram ; and , lo , an horror of great darkness fell upon him .
text2: As tud ̣ a t ̣ əfuk it ̣ t ̣ ərmas Abram s iket an et ̣ əs , təggaz - tu t ̣ asa tagget əgrawnat - tu šiyyay zawwarnen .

text: And he said unto Abram , Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs , and shall serve them ; and they shall afflict them four hundred years ;
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Əməli : « Əs ̣ s ̣ ən as əzzurriya - nnak ad - annaftaɣ daɣ akal iyyan , iggəz təla ad itawas ̣ aknu ark - an ̣ ay har əkkozat t ̣ əmad n awatay .

text: And also that nation , whom they shall serve , will I judge : and afterward shall they come out with great substance .
text2: Mišan nak ad - əšrəɣa temattay ta tan təgat eklan əg ̣ mədan - du akal wa , ədbalan təgərgist tagget .

text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace ; thou shalt be buried in a good old age .
text2: Kay a kay iba daɣ alxer a din - tətəwəmizəla dəffər tušaray daɣ təssidaya .

text: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again : for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full .
text2: Kundaba ɣur hayawan - nak win n əkkoz ad du - z - iqqəl əzzurriya - nnak da fəlas den da ad za - tawəd tallabast n arak - mazalan ən Kəl Amor , təzzar təwəddəban .

text: And it came to pass , that , when the sun went down , and it was dark , behold a smoking furnace , and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces .
text2: As tud ̣ a t ̣ əfuk əknanat šiyyay igi , təzzar okaynat təm ̣ akaten d abalagleg ən tamsay ig ̣ ammad - tan əhu , ətallaman gər dəgran win əzunnen ən s ̣ an .

text: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram , saying , Unto thy seed have I given this land , from the river of Egypt unto the great river , the river Euphrates :
text2: Əzəl wen da ad iga Əməli arkawal ən tassaq - net d Abram in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Əkfeɣ akal a y əzzurriya - nnak ad - d - obazan ɣur agarew wa n Mas ̣ ar har wa zəwwaran igan es ̣ əm Fərat .

text: The Kenites , and the Kenizzites , and the Kadmonites ,
text2: Akal wa im ̣ os in Kəl Keyn , Kəl Kəniz , əd Kəl Kadəmon ,

text: And the Hittites , and the Perizzites , and the Rephaims ,
text2: əd Kəl Xet əd Kəl Fəriz əd Kəl Rəfay

text: And the Amorites , and the Canaanites , and the Girgashites , and the Jebusites .
text2: əd Kəl Amor əd Kəl Kanan , əd Kəl Girgaš əd Kəl Yabus .

text: And Sarai said unto Abram , Behold now , the LORD hath restrained me from bearing : I pray thee , go in unto my maid ; it may be that I may obtain children by her . And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai .
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ a Saray y Abram : « Azzama Əməli igdal - i ad - arəwa wədi aglu nəmən ̣ su əd təklitt - in mijas a sər - əs əgrəwa barar . » Ird ' Abram əstan ̣ at ən Saray .

text: And Sarai Abram ' s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian , after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan , and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife .
text2: Tədkal Saray taklit - net Hajara ta n wəllət Mas ̣ ar , təkf - et y Abram aləs - net , ig - et daɣ ahan , dəffər as iga m ̣ araw elan iɣsar daɣ akal wa n Kanan .

text: And he went in unto Hagar , and she conceived : and when she saw that she had conceived , her mistress was despised in her eyes .
text2: Inaman ̣ sa dər - əs təga tadist . As təs ̣ s ̣ an as təga tadist abas təssəfrar m ̣ ass - as .

text: And Sarai said unto Abram , My wrong be upon thee : I have given my maid into thy bosom ; and when she saw that she had conceived , I was despised in her eyes : the LORD judge between me and thee .
text2: Təzzar tən ̣ n ̣ a Saray y Abram : « Kay a fəl z - iqqəl iba ən tidət wa di itawaggan ! Nak im ̣ an - in as əgeɣ taklitt - in gər fassan - nak , əmərədda ad təga tadist am ̣ aran abas di - təssəfrar . Išrəɣetana Əməli nak dər - ək ! »

text: But Abram said unto Sarai , Behold , thy maid is in thy hand ; do to her as it pleaseth thee . And when Sarai dealt hardly with her , she fled from her face .
text2: Ijjəwwab Abram i Saray in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Taklit - nam ifassan - nam a gər təlla , ag - as a w ' as tən ̣ n ̣ eɣ olaɣ . » Təzzar təg - as Saray tarnət ̣ t ̣ uft , təd ̣ d ̣ əggag Hajara təgguk - kat .

text: And the angel of the LORD found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness , by the fountain in the way to Shur .
text2: Os ̣ - et du Angalos n Əməli , təlla dagm ' ən šat ̣ n am ̣ an iyyat daɣ tan ̣ eray , ta təhat tarrayt n əɣrəm ən Šur .

text: And he said , Hagar , Sarai ' s maid , whence camest thou ? and whither wilt thou go ? And she said , I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as : « Hajara taklit ən Saray mənis du - təhe ? mənis tədaga ? » Təjjəwwab tən ̣ n ̣ - as : « Əd ̣ əggəg a əgeɣ fəl Saray , m ̣ ass - i . »

text: And the angel of the LORD said unto her , Return to thy mistress , and submit thyself under her hands .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Angalos n Əməli : « Əqqəl mas ̣ s ̣ - am tassan ̣ saɣ - as . »

text: And the angel of the LORD said unto her , I will multiply thy seed exceedingly , that it shall not be numbered for multitude .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as tolas : « Ad - əsəffələyləya əzzurriya - nnam wəllen haras wər z - itəwəfrəg ətəwəšid ̣ ən - net fəl igət . »

text: And the angel of the LORD said unto her , Behold , thou art with child , and shalt bear a son , and shalt call his name Ishmael ; because the LORD hath heard thy affliction .
text2: Ilas Angalos n Əməli in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Kam da təgat tadist da , ad - təgrəwa barar tagaɣ - as es ̣ əm Ismaɣil fəlas Əməli a islan i təkurayt - nam .

text: And he will be a wild man ; his hand will be against every man , and every man ' s hand against him ; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren .
text2: Am ̣ aran barar - nam ad - iqqəl šilat n ajad n əs ̣ uf . Ad - itamagar d aytedan kul , ətamagaran dər - əs , iwər aganna daɣ məd ̣ rayan - net kul . »

text: And she called the name of the LORD that spake unto her , Thou God seest me : for she said , Have I also here looked after him that seeth me ?
text2: Təɣra Əməli a das iššewalan s es ̣ əm n Atta - El - Roy ( almaɣna - nnet : təm ̣ osa Məššina wa di ihan ̣ n ̣ ayan ) , fəlas tən ̣ n ̣ a : « Awak wərge da da ad - ənaya wa di ihan ̣ n ̣ ayan ? »

text: Wherefore the well was called Beer - lahai - roi ; behold , it is between Kadesh and Bered .
text2: A di da a fəl itawagga y an ̣ u wa es ̣ əm Ber - Laxay - Roy ( almaɣna - net an ̣ u ən wa iddaran wa d - i - ihan ̣ n ̣ ayan ) , an ̣ u illan gər Kadeš əd Bered .

text: And Hagar bare Abram a son : and Abram called his son ' s name , which Hagar bare , Ishmael .
text2: Teraw Hajara barar n Abram , ig - as es ̣ əm Ismaɣil .

text: And Abram was fourscore and six years old , when Hagar bare Ishmael to Abram .
text2: Abram iga ət ̣ t ̣ amat təm ̣ ərwen n awatay əd s ̣ ədis as igraw əd Hajara Ismaɣil .

text: And I will make my covenant between me and thee , and will multiply thee exceedingly .
text2: Ad - akna arkawal ən tassaqq - in dər - ək , akfaq - qay əzzurriya iknan igət . »

text: And Abram fell on his face : and God talked with him , saying ,
text2: Issəjad Abram daɣ am ̣ adal , ilas Məššina iššewal :

text: As for me , behold , my covenant is with thee , and thou shalt be a father of many nations .
text2: « Ənta da arkawal ən tassaqq - in dər - ək : ad təqqəlaɣ əmaraw ən təmattiwen əknanen igət ,

text: Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram , but thy name shall be Abraham ; for a father of many nations have I made thee .
text2: wər za - tələsa ətəwəɣra s Abram , es ̣ əm - nak ad - iqqəl Ibrahim fəlas əmaraw ən təmattiwen əknanen igət a kay z - aga .

text: And I will make thee exceeding fruitful , and I will make nations of thee , and kings shall come out of thee .
text2: A - kay - əkanna əsəssirəw , təqqəla šimattiwen a daɣ z - agin mənokalan .

text: And I will establish my covenant between me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant , to be a God unto thee , and to thy seed after thee .
text2: Ad - ak - ət ̣ t ̣ əfaɣ arkawal iɣlalan ən tassaqq - in , ət ̣ t ̣ əfaq - qu y əzzurriya - nnak ihayawan əs hayawan dəffər - ək fəl ad - əqqəla Məššina - nnak kay d əzzurriya - nnak .

text: And I will give unto thee , and to thy seed after thee , the land wherein thou art a stranger , all the land of Canaan , for an everlasting possession ; and I will be their God .
text2: A - kay - akfa kay d əzzurriya - nnak akal wa daɣ tənnəftaɣa , akal kul wa n Kanan . Akal wa ad - iggəz təla n əzzurriya - nnak har faw , əqqəla Məššina - nnet .

text: And God said unto Abraham , Thou shalt keep my covenant therefore , thou , and thy seed after thee in their generations .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Məššina y Ibrahim : « Əmərədda , kay d əzzurriya - nnak ihayawan əs hayawan ad - tət ̣ t ̣ əfam arkawal ən tassaqq - in dər - wan .

text: This is my covenant , which ye shall keep , between me and you and thy seed after thee ; Every man child among you shall be circumcised .
text2: Ənta da təməwit as za - tət ̣ t ̣ əfa arkawal ən tassaqq - in dər - wan , kay d əzzurriya - nnak : I daɣ - wan im ̣ osan yay ad - amman ̣ kad .

text: And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin ; and it shall be a token of the covenant betwixt me and you .
text2: Im ̣ os əmən ̣ kəd en asannal n arkawal ən tassaqq - in dər - wan .

text: And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you , every man child in your generations , he that is born in the house , or bought with money of any stranger , which is not of thy seed .
text2: As daɣ - wan iga barar wa n yay ət ̣ t ̣ am ad ̣ an əd təhut təsəmmən ̣ kədam - tu gər za daɣ azzaman win wala win dəffər - san . Ad - təsaman ̣ kadam tolas bararan n eklan gər za win əhunen daɣ n ̣ an nawan wala win du - təzzənzam .

text: He that is born in thy house , and he that is bought with thy money , must needs be circumcised : and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant .
text2: Daɣ a di əššil eklan - nak kul ad - amman ̣ kadan win əhunen daɣ n ̣ an nawan əd win d - ənzanen . Ad - iggəz asannal n arkawal iɣlalan ən tassaqq - in elam - nawan .

text: And the uncircumcised man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised , that soul shall be cut off from his people ; he hath broken my covenant .
text2: Yay wa wər nəmmən ̣ kad ad - izəmməzzəy d aytedan - net fəlas arkawal ən tassaqq - in a iɣtas .

text: And God said unto Abraham , As for Sarai thy wife , thou shalt not call her name Sarai , but Sarah shall her name be .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Məššina y Ibrahim : « Tant ̣ ut - nak wər tat təllisa teɣaray əs Saray es ̣ əm - net ad - iqqəl Sarata .

text: And I will bless her , and give thee a son also of her : yea , I will bless her , and she shall be a mother of nations ; kings of people shall be of her .
text2: A fall - as aga albaraka am ̣ aran akfaq - qay dər - əs barar . A fall - as aga albaraka təqqəl təmarawt ən təmattiwen šiyyad ̣ n əddənet , əg ̣ mədan - tanat - du mənokalan .

text: Then Abraham fell upon his face , and laughed , and said in his heart , Shall a child be born unto him that is an hundred years old ? and shall Sarah , that is ninety years old , bear ?
text2: Issəjad Ibrahim daɣ am ̣ adal , ad id ̣ azzu . In ̣ n ̣ a daɣ m ̣ an - net : « Mas du - z - arəw i igan t ̣ emeday n awatay ? Am ̣ aran Sarata təgat t ̣ azayat təm ̣ ərwen n awatay ma zza - tassahu ? »

text: And Abraham said unto God , O that Ishmael might live before thee !
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim i Məššina : « Igd - i ad iddar Ismaɣil , təs ̣ s ̣ ana daɣ - as . »

text: And God said , Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed ; and thou shalt call his name Isaac : and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant , and with his seed after him .
text2: Məššina in ̣ n ̣ a : « Kala kala , tant ̣ ut - nak Sarata ad - təgrəw barar as za - tagaɣ es ̣ əm Isxaq . A das ət ̣ t ̣ əfaɣ arkawal iɣlalan ənta d əzzurriya - nnet .

text: And as for Ishmael , I have heard thee : Behold , I have blessed him , and will make him fruitful , and will multiply him exceedingly ; twelve princes shall he beget , and I will make him a great nation .
text2: Mišan ad - əqbəla man ̣ say - nak y Ismaɣil : a fall - as aga albaraka , əsəssirəwaq - qu , agaq - qu a wər nəla əket . Ad - arəw m ̣ araw mənokalan d əššin , agaq - qu əmaraw ən tamattay təknat igət .

text: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac , which Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year .
text2: Mišan ad - ət ̣ t ̣ əfa arkawal y Isxaq a za - təgrəwa əd Sarata azzaman a da azanen . »

text: And he left off talking with him , and God went up from Abraham .
text2: As iɣrad Məššina awal y Ibrahim , ig ̣ mad - as ənəfilal .

text: And Abraham took Ishmael his son , and all that were born in his house , and all that were bought with his money , every male among the men of Abraham ' s house ; and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day , as God had said unto him .
text2: Ibrahim idkal Ismaɣil d eklan - net kul win ɣur - əs əhunen əd win d - izzənza , xasil yayyan n ahan - net kul , isamman ̣ kad - tan əzəl wen da , əmmək wa as t - omar Məššina . Ibrahim iga t ̣ azayat təm ̣ ərwen n awatay əd t ̣ aza , Ismaɣil barar - net iga m ̣ araw elan əd karad as əmmən ̣ kadan . Əmmən ̣ kadan əzəl wen da əntanay əd yayyan kul n ahan n Ibrahim , eklan - net win ɣur - əs əhunen əd win d - izzənza daɣ təsədag .

text: And he lift up his eyes and looked , and , lo , three men stood by him : and when he saw them , he ran to meet them from the tent door , and bowed himself toward the ground ,
text2: As idkal Ibrahim as ̣ awad - net ogga karad meddan əbdadan dat - əs . Ozal - in dat ahaket - net har dər - san im ̣ m ̣ ənay , issəjad har am ̣ adal .

text: And said , My Lord , if now I have found favour in thy sight , pass not away , I pray thee , from thy servant :
text2: Am ̣ aran in ̣ n ̣ a : « Əməli - nin kud əgrawa ɣur - ək arraxmat ad wər takəya daɣ igəg n əkli - nnak .

text: Let a little water , I pray you , be fetched , and wash your feet , and rest yourselves under the tree :
text2: Ammawayanet - awan - du arat n am ̣ an as təššoradam id ̣ aran - nawan . Dəffər a di tas ̣ s ̣ anfim daw ašəkk a .

text: And I will fetch a morsel of bread , and comfort ye your hearts ; after that ye shall pass on : for therefore are ye come to your servant . And they said , So do , as thou hast said .
text2: A - kawan - akfa arat ən t ̣ attay a - kawan - du - təssuɣəl šiɣurad - nawan , am ̣ aran takəyam daɣ tarrayt - nawan . S ig ' a di wər z - iqqəl as du - təllamam dagma n ahan - in bannan . » Əjjəwwaban - as magaran : « Agu a w ' as tən ̣ n ̣ e ! »

text: And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah , and said , Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal , knead it , and make cakes upon the hearth .
text2: Iqqal Ibrahim ahaket - net irrorad , in ̣ n ̣ a i Sarata : « Tarmad , ədkəl - du iyyat n əɣlal n agel - nam w ' ofan taga šigəlwen .

text: And Abraham ran unto the herd , and fetcht a calf tender and good , and gave it unto a young man ; and he hasted to dress it .
text2: Dəffər a wen ozal Ibrahim s aharay - nnet isan ̣ n ̣ afran d abarkaw wa ləmmidan iddəren , ikf - ay y amaššaɣal - net , issətrab amaknaw - net .

text: And he took butter , and milk , and the calf which he had dressed , and set it before them ; and he stood by them under the tree , and they did eat .
text2: Am ̣ aran idkal - du t ̣ awna d əx d abarkaw wa iŋŋan , issən ̣ s - en dat - san . Igla ibdad ɣur - san daw ašək , ət ̣ attan .

text: And they said unto him , Where is Sarah thy wife ? And he said , Behold , in the tent .
text2: Təzzar ən ̣ n ̣ an - as : « Ma təga Sarata ta n tənt ̣ ut - nak ? » Ijjəwwab - asan : « Təlla da , təha am ̣ m ̣ as n ahaket . »

text: And he said , I will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life ; and , lo , Sarah thy wife shall have a son . And Sarah heard it in the tent door , which was behind him .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a iyyan daɣ - san : « Illikan as a - kay - d - əqqəla ad ̣ an a da azanen , ad - tilu tənt ̣ ut - nak Sarata barar . » Sarata təs ̣ s ̣ isam daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as n ahaket - net illan dəffər Ibrahim .

text: Now Abraham and Sarah were old and well stricken in age ; and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women .
text2: Ibrahim əd Sarata əglan daɣ elan , amaran Sarata təsiɣaraggat .

text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself , saying , After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure , my lord being old also ?
text2: Ad - təd ̣ azzu daɣ m ̣ an - net . Təgannu : « Əmərədda ad waššera ad - ileɣ ən ̣ n ̣ iyat n ənəmən ̣ sa ? Aləs - in deɣ waššar . »

text: And the LORD said unto Abraham , Wherefore did Sarah laugh , saying , Shall I of a surety bear a child , which am old ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Əməli y Ibrahim : « Mas təd ̣ azzu Sarata , təgannu : " Immikkan as ad əgrəwa barar , nak igan tušaray a da ? "

text: Is any thing too hard for the LORD ? At the time appointed I will return unto thee , according to the time of life , and Sarah shall have a son .
text2: Illa - ttu a im ̣ osan muxal fəl Əməli ? Daɣ tamert a dak - əssəbdada a - kay - d - as ̣ a , am ̣ aran daɣ tamert di Sarata təla barar . »

text: Then Sarah denied , saying , I laughed not ; for she was afraid . And he said , Nay ; but thou didst laugh .
text2: Təga Sarata bahu as tən ̣ n ̣ a : « Wər əd ̣ ze » , ənta tərəmmeq a təga . Mišan in ̣ n ̣ - as Əməli : « Awalla təd ̣ zə ! »

text: And the men rose up from thence , and looked toward Sodom : and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way .
text2: Əggazan meddan tarrayt , əgan anamod ən Sədom har oggan aɣrəm - net , intak - kan Ibrahim .

text: And the LORD said , Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do ;
text2: « Awak , in ̣ n ̣ a Əməli , ad - əɣbəra y Ibrahim a wa z - aga ?

text: Seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation , and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him ?
text2: Illikan as Ibrahim ad - iqqəl əmaraw ən tamattay təknat igət , təkna as ̣ s ̣ ahat , amaran a sər - əs əgrəwnat təmattiwen kul n əddənet albaraka ,

text: For I know him , that he will command his children and his household after him , and they shall keep the way of the LORD , to do justice and judgment ; that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him .
text2: fəlas əsinafranaq - qu fəl ad - amər əzzurriya - nnet s id ̣ uf ən tarrayen - nin s ən ̣ n ̣ iyat togdat toɣad fəl a - das - assanda a wa das ərkawala .

text: And the LORD said , Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great , and because their sin is very grievous ;
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Əməli y Ibrahim : « Šiɣəttas ən Sədom əd Gamora šilabasnen , ibakkadan - nasan izawwarnen ,

text: I will go down now , and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it , which is come unto me ; and if not , I will know .
text2: a - tan - awəda aššaggara a wa sər - san itawan ̣ n ̣ an . Kud əgan aššar wədi , ad - əs ̣ s ̣ əna . »

text: And the men turned their faces from thence , and went toward Sodom : but Abraham stood yet before the LORD .
text2: Əššin daɣ magaran əg ̣ madan edag di , əgan anamod ən Sədom , s iga a di Əməli illa ɣur Ibrahim .

text: And Abraham drew near , and said , Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked ?
text2: Ihoz - t - id Ibrahim , in ̣ n ̣ a : « Əməli , awak ad - təhləka aytedan win n alɣadilan əd win tan wər nəm ̣ os ?

text: Peradventure there be fifty righteous within the city : wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are therein ?
text2: Mijas əllanat - tu s ̣ əmmosat təm ̣ ərwen n alɣadil daɣ əɣrəm a - tan - təhləka ? Wər za - təs ̣ s ̣ urəfa y əɣrəm fəl udəm ən s ̣ əmmosat təm ̣ ərwen as immikkan as t - əhanat ?

text: That be far from thee to do after this manner , to slay the righteous with the wicked : and that the righteous should be as the wicked , that be far from thee : Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right ?
text2: Kala kala wər imməkkan ad - tagaɣ a di , ad - tanɣa aytedan əɣdalnen təssərtəyaq - qan əd win aššarnen , əšəššili ən win əɣdalnen əd win aššarnen ! Iguk - kay əm ̣ edran di ! Əmašraɣ n əddənet ad - ammazal s əššəriɣa di ? »

text: And the LORD said , If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city , then I will spare all the place for their sakes .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Əməli : « As əgrawa daɣ Sədom s ̣ əmmosat təm ̣ ərwen n alɣadil , ad - əs ̣ s ̣ urəfa y əɣrəm kul fəl udəm - nasan . »

text: And Abraham answered and said , Behold now , I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord , which am but dust and ashes :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim tolas : « Əhala awal s Əməli , ənta nak wər əm ̣ osa ar əg ̣ odrar d ezəd .

text: Peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous : wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five ? And he said , If I find there forty and five , I will not destroy it .
text2: Kud iqqəddar as aba s ̣ əmmos daɣ s ̣ əmmosat təm ̣ ərwen n alɣadil ad - təhləka aɣrəm kul fəl s ̣ əmmos aytedan di ? » « Wər tu - z - əhləka , ijjəwwab Əməli , as daɣ - as əgrawa əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen n alɣadil əd s ̣ əmmos . »

text: And he spake unto him yet again , and said , Peradventure there shall be forty found there . And he said , I will not do it for forty ' s sake .
text2: Id ̣ gaz Ibrahim tolas in ̣ n ̣ a : « Mijas tu wər iha ar əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen n alɣadil ! » « Wər z - əhləka aɣrəm fəl udəm n əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen . »

text: And he said unto him , Oh let not the Lord be angry , and I will speak : Peradventure there shall thirty be found there . And he said , I will not do it , if I find thirty there .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim tolas : « Əməli - nin ardu s a kay wər iggez alham , ad - ak - ammagrada tolas ! Mijas tu wər iha ar karadat təm ̣ ərwen . » « As daɣ - as əgrawa karadat təm ̣ ərwen , ijjawwab Əməli , wər tu - z - aga . »

text: And he said , Behold now , I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord : Peradventure there shall be twenty found there . And he said , I will not destroy it for twenty ' s sake .
text2: Igla Ibrahim is ̣ s ̣ əstan : « Əhala awal s Əməli . Mijas wər t - iha ar s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ərwen ! » « Fəl udəm ən s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ərwen di wər tu - z - əhləka . »

text: And he said , Oh let not the Lord be angry , and I will speak yet but this once : Peradventure ten shall be found there . And he said , I will not destroy it for ten ' s sake .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim tolas : « Are daɣ Əməli a tu wər iggez alham as əge awal - in wa ilkaman ! Mijas tu wər iha ar m ̣ araw . » Amaran ijjəwwab Məššina : « Fəl udəm ən m ̣ araw alɣadilan wər z - əhləka aɣrəm di . »

text: And the LORD went his way , as soon as he had left communing with Abraham : and Abraham returned unto his place .
text2: As təɣrad əljəmat fəl a wa , igl ' Əməli , am ̣ aran Ibrahim iqqal aɣaywan - net .

text: And he said , Behold now , my lords , turn in , I pray you , into your servant ' s house , and tarry all night , and wash your feet , and ye shall rise up early , and go on your ways . And they said , Nay ; but we will abide in the street all night .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - asan : « On ̣ sayaq - qawan , məssaw - i , a - di - tagim sadkal n a - du - təm ̣ m ̣ əram ehan - in , ehan n əkli - nnawan , təšširədam id ̣ aran - nawan , tan ̣ sim ɣur - i , t ̣ ufat tənzəyam , təggəzam tarrayt - nawan . » « Kala , ən ̣ n ̣ an - as , ad - nan ̣ su daɣ tarrayt daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as n əɣrəm . »

text: And he pressed upon them greatly ; and they turned in unto him , and entered into his house ; and he made them a feast , and did bake unleavened bread , and they did eat .
text2: Mišan Lot id ̣ gaz wəllen har ardan s iki n ahan - net . Ig - asan imen ̣ sewan , issəŋŋ - asan tagəlla , ətšan .

text: But before they lay down , the men of the city , even the men of Sodom , compassed the house round , both old and young , all the people from every quarter :
text2: Harwa da wər ən ̣ sen as əɣalayɣalayan meddan ən Sədom ehan - net , win mad ̣ rornen əd win waššarnen kul əllan əddi , wər din - iqqim waliyyan .

text: And they called unto Lot , and said unto him , Where are the men which came in to thee this night ? bring them out unto us , that we may know them .
text2: Əɣran Lot ən ̣ n ̣ an - as : « Magan meddan win d - edwanen ehan - nak ? Suɣəb - tan - du . A nara a dər - san nag ' əzzəna . »

text: And Lot went out at the door unto them , and shut the door after him ,
text2: Iqqab - du Lot dat ahan ihar - t - idu dəffər - əs .

text: And said , I pray you , brethren , do not so wickedly .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ - asan : « Kala , kala , imidawan - in , ad - wər - tagim ark - əmazal di .

text: Behold now , I have two daughters which have not known man ; let me , I pray you , bring them out unto you , and do ye to them as is good in your eyes : only unto these men do nothing ; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof .
text2: Ələɣ šibararen s ̣ anatat wər nəzday meddan , a - dawan - tanat - akfa , tagim - asnat a wa taram . Mišan ad wər təɣšədam arat i meddan a da , imagaran - in a əm ̣ osan , əhan taɣlift - in . »

text: And they said , Stand back . And they said again , This one fellow came in to sojourn , and he will needs be a judge : now will we deal worse with thee , than with them . And they pressed sore upon the man , even Lot , and came near to break the door .
text2: « Əg ̣ məd a di ! əjjəwwaban - as . Kay im ̣ an - nak amagar a təm ̣ osa , tarəɣ a - dana - taga əššəriɣa daɣ akal - nana . Ad - ak - nagu aššar ogaran wa dasan - za - nagu ! » Əbdaɣan - in Lot əs təɣurad əhozan - du imi n ahan fəl a - tt - arzin .

text: But the men put forth their hand , and pulled Lot into the house to them , and shut to the door .
text2: Assaɣa di ad obəzan meddan ann əššin , Lot , əgan - t - id daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as n ahan təzzar əlasan - tu təməhirt .

text: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness , both small and great : so that they wearied themselves to find the door .
text2: S ig ' a wen meddan win əllanen dat ahan əwatan - tan əs tad ̣ d ̣ arɣalt win mad ̣ rornen əd win waššarnen , haras orn - asan ad əs ̣ s ̣ ənan dad illa əmi n ahan . Ən ̣ n ̣ an meddan ann əššin i Lot : « Awak əllan - tu marwan - nak da ? Əd ̣ aggal , bararan , šibararen , madeɣ imarwan a əqqalan , əkkəs - tan daɣ əɣrəm a , fəlas ahluk a tu - za - nagu . Šiɣəttas - net aggotnen os ̣ anat - in Əməli , issokanaq - q - idu a - tu - nəhlək . »

text: And Lot went out , and spake unto his sons in law , which married his daughters , and said , Up , get you out of this place ; for the LORD will destroy this city . But he seemed as one that mocked unto his sons in law .
text2: Lot deɣ ikka id ̣ ulan - net imal - asan : « Tarmad ! Əg ̣ mədat edagg a da fəlas Əməli ad - ihlək aɣrəm a da . » Mišan əɣilan as addal a itag .

text: And when the morning arose , then the angels hastened Lot , saying , Arise , take thy wife , and thy two daughters , which are here ; lest thou be consumed in the iniquity of the city .
text2: Ɣur təɣəttawt n azaɣan , əd ̣ gazan angalosan Lot fəl ad - aglu : « Əbəz tarrayt ! ən ̣ n ̣ an - as . Ədkəl taɣur - ək əd təbararen - nak an s ̣ anatat , amər wər iga a di a - kawan - əg ̣ mədan m ̣ an , as irzam əɣrəm aššar - net . »

text: And while he lingered , the men laid hold upon his hand , and upon the hand of his wife , and upon the hand of his two daughters ; the LORD being merciful unto him : and they brought him forth , and set him without the city .
text2: As ənayan meddan as Lot ih - ay sandad , əbazan - tu s əfus ənta əd taɣur - əs əd təbararen - net an s ̣ anatat əkkasan - tu daɣ əɣrəm , fəlas Əməli a das ihanatten .

text: And it came to pass , when they had brought them forth abroad , that he said , Escape for thy life ; look not behind thee , neither stay thou in all the plain ; escape to the mountain , lest thou be consumed .
text2: As tan əkkasan daɣ əɣrəm in ̣ n ̣ a iyyan daɣ - san i Lot : « Daggag fəl ad - tassafsa təmməddurt - nak , a du wər təs ̣ wəd ̣ a dəffər - ək , ad wər təsəlluleɣ im ̣ an - nak daɣ am ̣ adal a da , d ̣ aggag s ədɣaɣ made təhləka . »

text: And Lot said unto them , Oh , not so , my Lord :
text2: Ijjəwwab Lot : « Kala , kala , məšš - i , ad wər təgməya daɣ əkli - nnak a di !

text: Behold now , thy servant hath found grace in thy sight , and thou hast magnified thy mercy , which thou hast shewed unto me in saving my life ; and I cannot escape to the mountain , lest some evil take me , and I die :
text2: Əs ̣ s ̣ anaɣ as əgrawa arraxmat am ̣ aran təhəkkawt zəwwərat as di - tog ̣ aza in ̣ fas - in . Mišan nak wər əfrega azzal har ədɣaɣ dat ad - i - d - awəd ̣ albas , təzzar ib - i .

text: Behold now , this city is near to flee unto , and it is a little one : Oh , let me escape thither , ( is it not a little one ? ) and my soul shall live .
text2: Təhan ̣ n ̣ aya a wen ən təɣrəmt ten ? Təkna ihəz fəl ad - azəla har den . Taɣrəmt ənd ̣ ərrat a təm ̣ os , ayy - i a daɣ - as əlɣəsa fəl a daɣ - as əgrəwa efsan ən təməddurt - in . »

text: And he said unto him , See , I have accepted thee concerning this thing also , that I will not overthrow this city , for the which thou hast spoken .
text2: « Ənta di da , in ̣ n ̣ - as , ardeɣ - ak tolas s ad wər igrew arat waliyyan taɣrəmt ta as təganna .

text: Haste thee , escape thither ; for I cannot do any thing till thou be come thither . Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar .
text2: Aglu tarmad , əlɣəs , fəlas wər əfrega igi n arat iket wər teweda . » ( Təmməd ̣ rəyt ən təɣrəmt ta ənta a fəlas itawagga es ̣ əm Tsohar )

text: The sun was risen upon the earth when Lot entered into Zoar .
text2: Təfuk tətag ̣ azzay as din - ewad Lot Tsohar .

text: Then the LORD rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD out of heaven ;
text2: Assaɣa wen da a dd - issərtak Əməli əlkəbrit ibilaglagan daɣ jənnawan fəl Sədom əd Gamora .

text: And he overthrew those cities , and all the plain , and all the inhabitants of the cities , and that which grew upon the ground .
text2: Issəba tamayyamayt ən ɣərman win əd tatawla ket - net əd win tan əzdaɣnen d annabatan n am ̣ adal .

text: But his wife looked back from behind him , and she became a pillar of salt .
text2: Tant ̣ ut ən Lot a din təs ̣ wadat dəffər - əs təqqal əwelwel n əsaləɣ .

text: And Abraham gat up early in the morning to the place where he stood before the LORD :
text2: Ibrahim inzay t ̣ ufat s adag wa daɣ d - iqqal dəffər Əməli as dər - əs imməgrad .

text: And he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah , and toward all the land of the plain , and beheld , and , lo , the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace .
text2: Is ̣ wad daɣ anamod ən Sədom əd Gamora əd tatawla kul , ihan ̣ n ̣ ay əhu itag ̣ azzay daɣ am ̣ adal olan d eqqad zəwwəran .

text: And it came to pass , when God destroyed the cities of the plain , that God remembered Abraham , and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow , when he overthrew the cities in the which Lot dwelt .
text2: Assaɣa wa d - ihlak Əməli iɣərman əd tatawla win as kala tan təha təməɣsurt ən Lot , ikta - ddu Məššina Ibrahim təzzar issəfsa Lot daɣ əlmihlak .

text: And Lot went up out of Zoar , and dwelt in the mountain , and his two daughters with him ; for he feared to dwell in Zoar : and he dwelt in a cave , he and his two daughters .
text2: Lot iggəlat daɣ Tsohar iɣsar daɣ ədɣaɣ , ənta əd təbararen - net , id fəlas təh - ay t ̣ asa daɣ Tsohar . Izdaɣ əɣəɣi ənta əd təbararen - net an s ̣ anatat .

text: And the firstborn said unto the younger , Our father is old , and there is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth :
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ a ta waššarat i ta ənd ̣ ərrat : « Abba - nnana iwaššaran , amaran wər t - əllen meddan daɣ əhazi əngəm akkin - ana - du , a wa itawaggan daɣ əddənet kul .

text: Come , let us make our father drink wine , and we will lie with him , that we may preserve seed of our father .
text2: Ayaw ad - naššašu abba - nnana esmad , a dər - əs nənəmən ̣ su fəl a - tu - nakfu əzzurriya . »

text: And they made their father drink wine that night : and the firstborn went in , and lay with her father ; and he perceived not when she lay down , nor when she arose .
text2: Təzzar əššəšwanat abba - nnasnat esmad ahad wədi , tənaman ̣ sa dər - əs ta waššarat wər ila iggi y asarod - net wala tan ̣ akra - nnet .

text: And it came to pass on the morrow , that the firstborn said unto the younger , Behold , I lay yesternight with my father : let us make him drink wine this night also ; and go thou in , and lie with him , that we may preserve seed of our Father .
text2: As t ̣ ufat tən ̣ n ̣ a i tamad ̣ rayt - net : « Əssirtaya im ̣ an - nin d abba - nin ən ̣ dod , šašwanaq - qu esmad tolas ahad a tənəmən ̣ sa dər - əs kam da fəl a - tu - nakfu əzzurriya . »

text: And they made their father drink wine that night also : and the younger arose , and lay with him ; and he perceived not when she lay down , nor when she arose .
text2: Ahad wədi ənta da sammaswadnat abba - nnasnat tolas tənaman ̣ sa dər - əs ta n tamad ̣ rayt , daɣ - as wər ila iggi y asarod - net wala tan ̣ akra - nnet .

text: Thus were both the daughters of Lot with child by their father .
text2: Əmmək wa da as əganat təbararen ən Lot šidusen əs ši - ssanat .

text: And the firstborn bare a son , and called his name Moab : the same is the father of the Moabites unto this day .
text2: Ta waššarat təgraw barar təg - as es ̣ əm Mohab , ənta a dd - əg ̣ madan Kəl Mohab win n azala .

text: And the younger , she also bare a son , and called his name Benammi : the same is the father of the children of Ammon unto this day .
text2: Ta ənd ̣ ərrat ənta da təgraw barar təg - as es ̣ əm Ben - Hammi , ənta a dd - əg ̣ madan Kəl Hammon win n azala .

text: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife , She is my sister : and Abimelech king of Gerar sent , and took Sarah .
text2: Ibrahim igannu əs tənt ̣ ut - net Sarata : « tamad ̣ raytt - in a wa . » Abimelek əmənokal ən Gərar isassaway - du Sarata .

text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night , and said to him , Behold , thou art but a dead man , for the woman which thou hast taken ; for she is a man ' s wife .
text2: Ahad di da daɣ tərgət inafalal Məššina y Abimelek , in ̣ n ̣ - as : « A kay iba fəl əddəlil ən tənt ̣ ut ta du - təsassawaya fəlas təzlaf . »

text: But Abimelech had not come near her : and he said , Lord , wilt thou slay also a righteous nation ?
text2: Abimelek a tat wər nəd ̣ es harwa in ̣ n ̣ a : « Əməli - nin , nak əd tamattay - nin ad - ana - təhləka da nəɣdal ?

text: Said he not unto me , She is my sister ? and she , even she herself said , He is my brother : in the integrity of my heart and innocency of my hands have I done this .
text2: Awak tən ̣ n ̣ a a d - i wər iga tamad ̣ rayt - net a təm ̣ os ? Ənta im ̣ an - net tant ̣ ut tən ̣ n ̣ - i amaqqar - net a im ̣ os . A di da fəl əgeɣ a di s əwəl iddinan əd fassan zaddognen . »

text: And God said unto him in a dream , Yea , I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart ; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me : therefore suffered I thee not to touch her .
text2: Ijjəwwab - as Məššina daɣ tərgət : « Əs ̣ s ̣ anaɣ im ̣ an - in as s əwəl iddinan ad təgeɣ a di , a di da fəlas arəɣ a kay ag ̣ əza daɣ abakkad , taqqama da wər tat - təd ̣ esa .

text: Now therefore restore the man his wife ; for he is a prophet , and he shall pray for thee , and thou shalt live : and if thou restore her not , know thou that thou shalt surely die , thou , and all that are thine .
text2: Suɣəl tant ̣ ut n aləs di əmərədda ! Ənnəbi a im ̣ os , amaran a dak an ̣ səy Məššina fəl ad - təddəra . As tat wər təssoɣala əs ̣ s ̣ ən as illikan as a kay iba , kay d aytedan - nak . »

text: Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning , and called all his servants , and told all these things in their ears : and the men were sore afraid .
text2: Ɣur tan ̣ akra - nnet tənzayat , isassaɣra - ddu Abimelek aytedan - net ig - asan isalan kul . Aytedan təggaz - tan t ̣ asa zəwwərət .

text: Then Abimelech called Abraham , and said unto him , What hast thou done unto us ? and what have I offended thee , that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin ? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done .
text2: Təzzar iɣra - ddu Abimelek Ibrahim in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ma dana - təgeɣ da ? Ma dak - əɣšada as dana - təge , nak əd taɣmar - in , daɣ ədmaran n abakkad igan təzzəwwərt a da ? Təgəɣ - i əmazal da wər nətəwəggu . »

text: And Abimelech said unto Abraham , What sawest thou , that thou hast done this thing ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as tolas : « Ma tənnəye daɣ igi n əmazal a ? »

text: And Abraham said , Because I thought , Surely the fear of God is not in this place ; and they will slay me for my wife ' s sake .
text2: Ijjəwwab - as Ibrahim : « Aɣila wala aššak daɣ - as wər t - illa i iksudan Məššina daɣ akal a da , amaran təwənɣa fəl əddəlil ən tənt ̣ utt - in .

text: And yet indeed she is my sister ; she is the daughter of my father , but not the daughter of my mother ; and she became my wife .
text2: Mišan tidət as tamad ̣ raytt - in : elles n abba - nin mišan wər tat - terew anna - nin , təqqal tant ̣ utt - in .

text: And it came to pass , when God caused me to wander from my father ' s house , that I said unto her , This is thy kindness which thou shalt shew unto me ; at every place whither we shall come , say of me , He is my brother .
text2: Assaɣa wa di - d - išaššakal Məššina daɣ akal n abba - nin , ən ̣ n ̣ eɣ i tənt ̣ utt - in : " Ag - i tara - nin a : edag nos ̣ a tan ̣ n ̣ a nak amaqqar - nam a əm ̣ osa . " »

text: And Abimelech took sheep , and oxen , and menservants , and womenservants , and gave them unto Abraham , and restored him Sarah his wife .
text2: Idkal Abimelek ayfəd əd wəlli əd šitan d eklan əd taklaten , ikf - en y Ibrahim as t - in - issoɣal tant ̣ ut - net Sarata .

text: And Abimelech said , Behold , my land is before thee : dwell where it pleaseth thee .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as : « Akal - in innolam - ak . Əɣsər daɣ - as daɣ adag wa əran m ̣ an - nak . »

text: And unto Sarah he said , Behold , I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver : behold , he is to thee a covering of the eyes , unto all that are with thee , and with all other : thus she was reproved .
text2: Amaran in ̣ n ̣ a i Sarata : « Təhan ̣ n ̣ aya ! Əkfeɣ agim ən tafelt n əzrəf amaqqar - nam : im ̣ os a wen təgiyya dat aytedan - nam kul n as wər təle lahan daɣ batu a da . » Fəl əddəlil n a wa igrawan Sarata , tant ̣ ut n Ibrahim , Əməli isaggagra šid ̣ oden n ahan n Abimelek . On ̣ say Ibrahim Məššina , amaran iqbal Məššina man ̣ say - nnet , izzozay Abimelek , tant ̣ ut - net əd taklaten - net , əfragnat ad - ələsnat agaraw ən bararan .

text: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him , whom Sarah bare to him , Isaac .
text2: Ig ' Ibrahim i rur - es wa igraw əd Sarata da es ̣ əm Isxaq .

text: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac being eight days old , as God had commanded him .
text2: Isamman ̣ kad - tu əzəl wa d - iga ət ̣ t ̣ am ad ̣ an əd təhut , təməwit t ' as t ' omar Məššina .

text: And Abraham was an hundred years old , when his son Isaac was born unto him .
text2: Iga Ibrahim ɣur təhut n Isxaq temed ̣ ay n awatay .

text: And Sarah said , God hath made me to laugh , so that all that hear will laugh with me .
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ a Sarata : « Məššina isisag - i tad ̣ aza ən tədəwit . Aytedan kul win əslanen Isxaq ad - agin tad ̣ aza ta əgeɣ . »

text: And she said , Who would have said unto Abraham , that Sarah should have given children suck ? for I have born him a son in his old age .
text2: Təlas tən ̣ n ̣ a : « Ma im ̣ os wa z - issud ̣ əfan Ibrahim as Sarata ilkam daɣ - as əsən ̣ kəs ən bararan ? Ənta əkfeq - qu barar daɣ tušaray - nnet . »

text: And the child grew , and was weaned : and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned .
text2: Idwal barar . Əzəl w ' ad təmməzay Sarata d əsən ̣ kəs - net ig ' Ibrahim s ̣ aksas zəwwəran ən tədəwit .

text: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian , which she had born unto Abraham , mocking .
text2: Tənay Sarata barar ən wələt Mas ̣ ar ta təgat Hajara , wa təla d Ibrahim , itajab daɣ barar - net Isxaq .

text: Wherefore she said unto Abraham , Cast out this bondwoman and her son : for the son of this bondwoman shall not be heir with my son , even with Isaac .
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ a y Ibrahim : « Əstəɣ taklit a da ənta əd rur - es . Wa da , wər z - inəməkusət əd barar - in Isxaq »

text: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham ' s sight because of his son .
text2: Awalan win əkman Ibrahim wəllen fəlas Ismaɣil ənta da rur - es .

text: And God said unto Abraham , Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad , and because of thy bondwoman ; in all that Sarah hath said unto thee , hearken unto her voice ; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called .
text2: Mišan in ̣ n ̣ - as Məššina : « A - kay - wər - takmu batu ən barar əd tawahayt - nak . Ardu s igi n a w ' as dak tən ̣ n ̣ a Sarata . Id fəlas aganna wa n Isxaq a daɣ z - agu əzzurriya - nnak .

text: And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation , because he is thy seed .
text2: Amaran barar wa n tawahayt ad - iqqəl amaraw ən tamattay iyyat , id ənta da rur - ek . »

text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning , and took bread , and a bottle of water , and gave it unto Hagar , putting it on her shoulder , and the child , and sent her away : and she departed , and wandered in the wilderness of Beer - sheba .
text2: Aɣo ́ ra t ̣ ufat inzay Ibrahim daɣ adakal ən təgəlla d ən ̣ war id ̣ nayan am ̣ an , ikf - en i Hajara , issəwar - tan əzir - net , ikf - et barar , issəgl - et . Təgla , teway əd tan ̣ eray ən Ber - Šeba , təxrak .

text: And the water was spent in the bottle , and she cast the child under one of the shrubs .
text2: As əɣradan am ̣ an daɣ ən ̣ war , toyya - ddu rur - es daw təfsəq .

text: And she went , and sat her down over against him a good way off , as it were a bowshot : for she said , Let me not see the death of the child . And she sat over against him , and lift up her voice , and wept .
text2: Təzzar təkk - as əd ̣ d ̣ əkud ən taggor təqqim fəl - as tən ̣ n ̣ a : « Wər areɣ ad han ̣ n ̣ aya barar - in itiba - tu . » Təqqim - in sen da ad təhallu .

text: And God heard the voice of the lad ; and the angel of God called Hagar out of heaven , and said unto her , What aileth thee , Hagar ? fear not ; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is .
text2: Məššina isla i tala ən barar təzzar iɣra - ddu Angalos ən Məššina daɣ jənnawan Hajara is ̣ s ̣ əstan - tat : « Ma kam igrawan , Hajara ? Ad wər tərməɣa . Məššina isla i barar ihallu daɣ adag wa daq - q in toyye .

text: Arise , lift up the lad , and hold him in thine hand ; for I will make him a great nation .
text2: Əbdəd ! Ədkəl barar - nam , əs ̣ s ̣ ən daɣ - as , id ad - t - aga əmaraw ən tamattay tagget .

text: And God opened her eyes , and she saw a well of water ; and she went , and filled the bottle with water , and gave the lad drink .
text2: Olam Məššina šit ̣ t ̣ awen ən Hajara təzzar togg ' an ̣ u . Təgla təd ̣ nay an ̣ war təššəšwa barar - net . Daɣ təɣlift ən Məššina idwal barar , iqqal ənan ̣ d ̣ ab ən təganzay isad ̣ asan . Iɣsar daɣ tan ̣ eray ən Faran . Təzzəzlaf - tu m ̣ a - s wələt Mas ̣ ar .

text: And it came to pass at that time , that Abimelech and Phichol the chief captain of his host spake unto Abraham , saying , God is with thee in all that thou doest :
text2: Daɣ azzaman win di Abimelek os ̣ a - ddu Ibrahim , iddew əd Fikol əmənokal ən nammagaran - net . In ̣ n ̣ a Abimelek y Ibrahim : « Məššina og ̣ az kay daɣ a wa tətagga kul .

text: Now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me , nor with my son , nor with my son ' s son : but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee , thou shalt do unto me , and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned .
text2: Əmərədda əhəd ̣ - i əs Məššina as wər di - za - takkaddala nak wala bararan - in wala əzzurriya - nnin . Əmmək w ' as dak - əmmozala s əlləllu , mazal - i sər - əs , nak d akal a daɣ təɣsara . »

text: And Abraham said , I will swear .
text2: « Əhad ̣ a sər - əs » in ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim .

text: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water , which Abimelech ' s servants had violently taken away .
text2: Mišan išaššawad Ibrahim Abimelek tən ̣ n ̣ a ta təgat daɣ batu n an ̣ u wa əgdalan eklan - net .

text: And Abimelech said , I wot not who hath done this thing : neither didst thou tell me , neither yet heard I of it , but to day .
text2: Ijjəwwab - as Abimelek : « Wər əs ̣ s ̣ ena wa igan a di . Kay im ̣ an - nak wər di - tən ̣ n ̣ eɣ arat ̣ , amaran wər əsleɣ i sər - əs immigradan har azalada . »

text: And Abraham took sheep and oxen , and gave them unto Abimelech ; and both of them made a covenant .
text2: Idkal Ibrahim eharay wa ənd ̣ ərran əd šitan ikf - en y Abimelek , əsammarkas ̣ an tas ̣ s ̣ aq gar - essan .

text: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves .
text2: Is ̣ kat Ibrahim šibəgag əs ̣ s ̣ ayat daɣ aharay - nnet .

text: And Abimelech said unto Abraham , What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves ?
text2: « Ma fəl əns ̣ anat , in ̣ n ̣ - as Abimelek , əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təbəgag šin təs ̣ kata da ? »

text: And he said , For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand , that they may be a witness unto me , that I have digged this well .
text2: « Əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təbəgag a da a tanat təqbəla əg ̣ mədnat - in əfus ̣ - in , əm ̣ osnat təgəyya n as nak a iɣazan an ̣ u a da . »

text: Wherefore he called that place Beer - sheba ; because there they sware both of them .
text2: A di da a fəl ig ' adagg a da es ̣ əm Ber - Šeba : anu wa fəl əhad ̣ an ket - nasan .

text: Thus they made a covenant at Beer - sheba : then Abimelech rose up , and Phichol the chief captain of his host , and they returned into the land of the Philistines .
text2: Dəffər as sam ̣ m ̣ arkasan tas ̣ s ̣ aq daɣ Ber - Šeba iqqal Abimelek akal ən Kəl Filist , ənta əd Fikol wa n əmənokal ən nammagaran - net .

text: And Abraham planted a grove in Beer - sheba , and called there on the name of the LORD , the everlasting God .
text2: Ibrahim in ̣ bal ašək igan es ̣ əm ešel daɣ Ber - Šeba , amaran iɣbad Əməli , Məššina Amaɣlol daɣ adag wen .

text: And Abraham sojourned in the Philistines ' land many days .
text2: Igla Ibrahim iɣsar daɣ akal ən Kəl Filist har iga tamert .

text: And he said , Take now thy son , thine only son Isaac , whom thou lovest , and get thee into the land of Moriah ; and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Məššina : « Ədkəl barar - nak Isxaq , barar - nak ann iyyanda təknəɣ tara , takka dər - əs akal ən Moriyya , fəl adɣaɣ a kay z - assakna , amaran tagaɣ - i - tu takutay təkwayat . »

text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning , and saddled his ass , and took two of his young men with him , and Isaac his son , and clave the wood for the burnt offering , and rose up , and went unto the place of which God had told him .
text2: Tufat iga - ddu Ibrahim tan ̣ akra tənzayat , isaffardat eškan , iggəgga ajad ̣ - net , əbazan tarrayt ənta əd barar - net Isxaq d əššin daɣ eklan - net . Əkkan edag wa das imal Məššina .

text: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes , and saw the place afar off .
text2: As t ̣ ufatt en ogga edag wa əkkan daɣ əsəs ̣ wəd .

text: And Abraham said unto his young men , Abide ye here with the ass ; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship , and come again to you ,
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a y eklan : « Ɣamiwat da da tagəzam ajad , nak əd barar ad - nakku afalla ad - nəɣbəd Məššina , nəqqəl - kawan - du da da . »

text: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering , and laid it upon Isaac his son ; and he took the fire in his hand , and a knife ; and they went both of them together .
text2: Issəwar Ibrahim rur - es Isxaq eškan . Ənta im ̣ an - net eway šim ̣ akaten əddarnen d əlmoši . Əglan əššin - essan , əddəwan əjiwanken .

text: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father , and said , My father : and he said , Here am I , my son . And he said , Behold the fire and the wood : but where is the lamb for a burnt offering ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Isxaq y abba - nnet Ibrahim : « Abba - nin ! » Ikkəwan - as Ibrahim : « Nak da , barar - in ! Ma igan ? » In ̣ n ̣ - as Isxaq : « Temsay d eškan da mišan ma təga teɣsay ta n təkutay təkayat ? »

text: And Abraham said , My son , God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering : so they went both of them together .
text2: Ijjəwwab Ibrahim : « Məššina a du - z - igrəwan teɣsay ta n təkutay təkwayat , barar - in . » Əglan əššin - essan , əddəwan əjiwanken .

text: And they came to the place which God had told him of ; and Abraham built an altar there , and laid the wood in order , and bound Isaac his son , and laid him on the altar upon the wood .
text2: As din - os ̣ an edag wa das imal Məššina , ikras Ibrahim edagg ən təkutay , isammasan ̣ s ̣ a fall - as eškan , təzzar ikrad Isxaq barar - net issəwar - tu edagg ən təkutay fəl əfalla n eškan .

text: And Abraham stretched forth his hand , and took the knife to slay his son .
text2: Izzal Ibrahim əfus - net idkal - du əlmoši fəl ad igzəm rur - es .

text: And the angel of the LORD called unto him out of heaven , and said , Abraham , Abraham : and he said , Here am I .
text2: Mišan Angalos n Əməli iɣr - ay daɣ jənnawan , in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ibrahim ! Ibrahim ! » Ikkəwan - as : « Nak da ! »

text: And he said , Lay not thine hand upon the lad , neither do thou any thing unto him : for now I know that thou fearest God , seeing thou hast not withheld thy son , thine only son from me .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a tolas : « Ad - wər - təzzəla əfus nak əs barar ! A - das - wər - təɣšəda arat ! Id əmərədda əs ̣ s ̣ anaɣ as təksudaɣ Məššina . Wər di təgdela barar - nak ann iyyanda . »

text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes , and looked , and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns : and Abraham went and took the ram , and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son .
text2: Idkal Ibrahim as ̣ awad - net ogga ajaɣol iyyan daɣ təfəs ̣ s ̣ aɣ itiwat ̣ t ̣ af s əs ̣ kawan . Təzzar ikk - ay Ibrahim ibaz - t - iddu , ig - ay takutay təkwayat daɣ adagg ən barar - net .

text: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovah - jireh : as it is said to this day , In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen .
text2: Ig ' Ibrahim y adagg en den es ̣ əm : « Məššina a du - z - igrəwan . » A di da fəl itawan ̣ n ̣ u azala : « Fəl adɣaɣ wa n Məššina , a - dd - itəwəgrəw . »

text: And the angel of the LORD called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time ,
text2: Angalos n Əməli ilas - du teɣaray n Ibrahim daɣ jənnawan ,

text: And said , By myself have I sworn , saith the LORD , for because thou hast done this thing , and hast not withheld thy son , thine only son :
text2: in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Məššina in ̣ n ̣ a : " Id zama təgeɣ a wa : as wər təgdela barar - nak , ann iyyanda ,

text: That in blessing I will bless thee , and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven , and as the sand which is upon the sea shore ; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies ;
text2: illikan as a fall - ak aga albaraka əs tidət tolas əssəgətaɣ əzzurriya - nnak , šilat n et ̣ ran ən jənnawan madeɣ am ̣ adal daɣ t ̣ ama n agarew , amaran əzzurriya - nnak ad - arnu imagzaran - net .

text: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed ; because thou hast obeyed my voice .
text2: Šimattiwen n əddənet kul ad - əgrəwnat albaraka fəl udəm n əzzurriya - nnak fəlas takawent a di təge . " »

text: So Abraham returned unto his young men , and they rose up and went together to Beer - sheba ; and Abraham dwelt at Beer - sheba .
text2: Iqqal Ibrahim eklan - net , ən ̣ karan - du , əddewan əs Ber - Šeba . Igla iɣsar Ibrahim daɣ Ber - Šeba .

text: And it came to pass after these things , that it was told Abraham , saying , Behold , Milcah , she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor ;
text2: Dəffər aratan win den , os ̣ an - du salan Ibrahim n as : « Milka ənta da təla bararan əd Naxor amad ̣ ray - nnak .

text: Huz his firstborn , and Buz his brother , and Kemuel the father of Aram ,
text2: Uts aɣafadday - nnet , Buz amad ̣ ray - nnet , Kəmuhel ši - s n Aram ,

text: And Chesed , and Hazo , and Pildash , and Jidlaph , and Bethuel .
text2: Kesed , Xazo , Fildaš , Yidlaf əd Bətuhel . »

text: And Bethuel begat Rebekah : these eight Milcah did bear to Nahor , Abraham ' s brother .
text2: Bətuhel ši - s ən Raqqiyetu . Əntanay da da bararan ann ət ̣ t ̣ am ən Milka təgraw əd Naxor , amad ̣ ray n Ibrahim .

text: And his concubine , whose name was Reumah , she bare also Tebah , and Gaham , and Thahash , and Maachah .
text2: Takna - nnet təgat es ̣ əm Rəhuma , təgraw dər - əs ənta da bararan : Tebax , Gaxam , Taxaš əd Mahaka .

text: And Sarah died in Kirjath - arba ; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan : and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah , and to weep for her .
text2: Aba - tat daɣ Kiryat - Arba , azala Xebron , daɣ akal ən Kanan . Iggaz Ibrahim təfiyyawt ən Sarata , ihallu .

text: And Abraham stood up from before his dead , and spake unto the sons of Heth , saying ,
text2: Təzzar ig ̣ mad edag wa təha alzanazat ən tənt ̣ ut - net , igla iššewal i Kəl Xet .

text: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you : give me a possession of a buryingplace with you , that I may bury my dead out of my sight .
text2: « Əgeɣ təməddurt n amagar n əburar gar - ewwan , əgrəwat - i edagg ən zəkwan daɣ akal - nawan a daɣ ən ̣ bala tant ̣ ut - in . »

text: And the children of Heth answered Abraham , saying unto him ,
text2: Əjjəwwaban - as Kəl Xet :

text: Hear us , my lord : thou art a mighty prince among us : in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead ; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre , but that thou mayest bury thy dead .
text2: « Səsəm - ana , məšš - ikkana , təm ̣ osa məššis n albaraka ən Məššina daɣ gar - ena , ən ̣ bəl alzanazat ən tənt ̣ ut - nak daɣ adagg ən təs ̣ əska - nnana wa n təfrənt , wər dana - iha i dak - igdalan edagg ən təs ̣ əska - nnet y ad - tən ̣ bəla alzanazat ən tənt ̣ ut - nak . »

text: And Abraham stood up , and bowed himself to the people of the land , even to the children of Heth .
text2: In ̣ kar Ibrahim issəjad dat - san .

text: And he communed with them , saying , If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight ; hear me , and intreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar ,
text2: Amaran iššewal - asan ənta da : « Azzama tardam s ad - ən ̣ bəla alzanazat ən təntutt - in təzzar əkkəsaq - qat dat šit ̣ t ̣ awen - nin , wədi s ̣ əsəmat - i , tan ̣ səyam - i Efron , rur - es ən Tsoxar ,

text: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah , which he hath , which is in the end of his field ; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you .
text2: ad - i - azzanzu əɣəɣi ən Makfəla , im ̣ osan təla - nnet daɣ t ̣ am ̣ a ən tawagost - net . Ad - i - tt - azzanzu əket - net daɣ əzrəf , fəl ad - iqqəl təla - nin gar - ewwan .

text: And Ephron dwelt among the children of Heth : and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of the children of Heth , even of all that went in at the gate of his city , saying ,
text2: As ig ' a wen illa gar - essan Efron , ijjəwwab y Ibrahim dat Kəl Xet win d - os ̣ anen imi n əɣrəm :

text: Nay , my lord , hear me : the field give I thee , and the cave that is therein , I give it thee ; in the presence of the sons of my people give I it thee : bury thy dead .
text2: « Kala kala , məšš - i , s ̣ əsəm - i ! Əkfeq - qay tawagost , əkfeq - qay əɣəɣi wa tat ihan . Əkfeɣ - ak - kan dat šit ̣ t ̣ awen ən tamattay - nin : ən ̣ bəl alzanazat ən tənt ̣ ut - nak . »

text: And Abraham bowed down himself before the people of the land .
text2: Issəjad Ibrahim dat Kəl Xet .

text: And he spake unto Ephron in the audience of the people of the land , saying , But if thou wilt give it , I pray thee , hear me : I will give thee money for the field ; take it of me , and I will bury my dead there .
text2: Iššewal tolas y Efron dat kəl akal : « Səsəm - i on ̣ sayaq - qay ! A - kay - akfa əlqimat ən tawagost , əqbəl - i - tu , a daɣ - as ən ̣ bəla alzanazat ən tənt ̣ utt - in . »

text: And Ephron answered Abraham , saying unto him ,
text2: Ijjəwwab Efron y Ibrahim , in ̣ n ̣ - as :

text: My lord , hearken unto me : the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver ; what is that betwixt me and thee ? bury therefore thy dead .
text2: « Səsəm - i məšš - i ! Am ̣ adal n əkkozat təm ̣ ad ən tafelt n əzrəf ma z - iqqəl gar - i dər - ək ? Ən ̣ bəl alzanazat ən tənt ̣ ut - nak . »

text: And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron ; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver , which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth , four hundred shekels of silver , current money with the merchant .
text2: Igra Ibrahim , irda , ikat azrəf w ' as in ̣ n ̣ a Efron dat šit ̣ t ̣ awen ən Kəl Xet əkkozat təm ̣ ad ən tamma n əzrəf wa šəšɣalan mazanzan .

text: And the field of Ephron , which was in Machpelah , which was before Mamre , the field , and the cave which was therein , and all the trees that were in the field , that were in all the borders round about , were made sure
text2: Təqqal tawagost n Efron daɣ Makfela dagma ən Mamre , d əɣəɣi d eškan kul win əhanen tawagost əd win n iyyakatan - net ,

text: Unto Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth , before all that went in at the gate of his city .
text2: təla n Ibrahim dat šit ̣ tawen ən Kəl Xet win d - os ̣ anen imi n əɣrəm .

text: And after this , Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre : the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ bal Ibrahim Sarata , tant ̣ ut - net , daɣ əɣəɣi ən tawagost ta n Makfela dagma ən Mamre , im ̣ osan Xebron , daɣ akal ən Kanan .

text: And the field , and the cave that is therein , were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by the sons of Heth .
text2: Tawagost d əɣəɣi wa tat - ihan əqqalan təla n Ibrahim , təggaz - t - id əs Kəl Xet , a - tat - agu edagg ən zəkwan ən nəm ̣ m ̣ əttan - net .

text: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house , that ruled over all that he had , Put , I pray thee , thy hand under my thigh :
text2: Əzəl iyyan in ̣ n ̣ a Ibrahim y əkli - nnet wa n asahaw - net , wa inət ̣ t ̣ afan əd təla - nnet kul : « Ag ' əfus nak daw taɣma - nin ,

text: And I will make thee swear by the LORD , the God of heaven , and the God of the earth , that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites , among whom I dwell :
text2: amaran təhədaɣ - i s Əməli , Məššina ən jənnawan əd m ̣ ədlan , as du - wər - za - tədkəla i barar - in tant ̣ ut daɣ təbararen ən Kəl Kanan win ɣur əɣsara ,

text: But thou shalt go unto my country , and to my kindred , and take a wife unto my son Isaac .
text2: mišan ad - takka akal - in daɣ marwan - in tədkəla - du tant ̣ ut i barar - in Isxaq . »

text: And the servant said unto him , Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land : must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest ?
text2: Ijjəwwab - as əkli : « Mijas tant ̣ ut wər za - tardu s a - di - du - təlkəm əs kallan a da . Awak ad - awəya barar - nak s akal wa du - təg ̣ mada ? »

text: And Abraham said unto him , Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Ibrahim : « Kaššeday fəl ad - tewaya barar - in s akal en !

text: The LORD God of heaven , which took me from my father ' s house , and from the land of my kindred , and which spake unto me , and that sware unto me , saying , Unto thy seed will I give this land ; he shall send his angel before thee , and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence .
text2: Əməli , Məššina wa n jənnawan , a di - du - ikkas ̣ an daɣ ahan n abba - nin əd marwan - in , iššewal - i təzzar idkal - i arkawal , in ̣ n ̣ - i : " Akal a da ad - t - akfa y əzzurriya - nnak " , ənta im ̣ an - net ad - assaglu angalos - net dat - ək , amaran den da a - du - za - tədkəla tant ̣ ut i barar - in .

text: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee , then thou shalt be clear from this my oath : only bring not my son thither again .
text2: As tugay tənt ̣ ut s a - dak - du - təlkəm təfal - kay təhuday ta d - i təge da . Mišan ad - wər - tawəya barar - in s akal en . »

text: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master , and sware to him concerning that matter .
text2: Iga əkli əfus - net daw taɣma n Ibrahim , məšš - is , ihad as ad - ammazal a w ' as das - in ̣ n ̣ a .

text: And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master , and departed ; for all the goods of his master were in his hand : and he arose , and went to Mesopotamia , unto the city of Nahor .
text2: Isannafran - du m ̣ araw olaman daɣ m ̣ ənas ən məšš - is , issəwər - tan aratan n Ibrahim win əlanen əlqimat . Iga anamod ən fallatan ən Mesofotami , ikka aɣrəm wa iha ahan ən Naxor , amad ̣ ray n Ibrahim .

text: And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening , even the time that women go out to draw water .
text2: Issəgan olaman dagma n an ̣ u ihan t ̣ ama n əɣrəm , t ̣ akəst , alwaq wa daɣ du - kattarnat təd ̣ oden .

text: And he said , O LORD God of my master Abraham , I pray thee , send me good speed this day , and shew kindness unto my master Abraham .
text2: It ̣ t ̣ ar s a wa : « Əməli , Məššina ən məšš - i Ibrahim , tən ̣ saraɣ - i azalada . Səm ̣ m ̣ ətəkwəy əlluɣ - nak i məšš - i Ibrahim sa das - taga tara - nnet .

text: Behold , I stand here by the well of water ; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water :
text2: Nak da ɣur šat ̣ a amaran šibararen n əɣrəm a - dd - əzrəgnat .

text: And let it come to pass , that the damsel to whom I shall say , Let down thy pitcher , I pray thee , that I may drink ; and she shall say , Drink , and I will give thy camels drink also : let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac ; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master .
text2: Ad - an ̣ səya iyyat daɣ - asnat ad - i - du - takfu ətəkin - net ad - aššwa , as d - i - tən ̣ n ̣ a : " Yay ašəw , amaran ad - əššašwa olaman - nak tolas . " , ad - əs ̣ s ̣ ənaɣ as ənta a təfrana y əkli - nnak Isxaq . S asaway di ad - əs ̣ s ̣ əna as təsim ̣ atakwaya əlluɣ - nak i məšš - i . »

text: And it came to pass , before he had done speaking , that , behold , Rebekah came out , who was born to Bethuel , son of Milcah , the wife of Nahor , Abraham ' s brother , with her pitcher upon her shoulder .
text2: Wər iɣred d awal , as ogga Raqqiyetu təzay - du təssiwar ətəkin - net əzir - net , elles ən Bətuhel , rur - es ən Milka əd Naxor , amad ̣ ray n Ibrahim .

text: And the damsel was very fair to look upon , a virgin , neither had any man known her : and she went down to the well , and filled her pitcher , and came up .
text2: Təmawat təgat šihussay šin əqqitasnen , wər təzday meddan . Təras ̣ - du šat ̣ , təd ̣ nay ətəkin - net , təg ̣ g ̣ əzzay .

text: And the servant ran to meet her , and said , Let me , I pray thee , drink a little water of thy pitcher .
text2: Ozal əkli issəlkad - as , in ̣ n ̣ a : « On ̣ sayaq - qam ad - i - taššašwa daɣ ətəkin - nam . »

text: And she said , Drink , my lord : and she hasted , and let down her pitcher upon her hand , and gave him drink .
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ašəw , məšš - i ! » Tərrorad əsəggətti n ətəkin y as ad - ašəw .

text: And when she had done giving him drink , she said , I will draw water for thy camels also , until they have done drinking .
text2: As išwa , tən ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ad - əjjijəla y olaman - nak har ašwin kul . »

text: And she hasted , and emptied her pitcher into the trough , and ran again unto the well to draw water , and drew for all his camels .
text2: Tərrorad tanaɣla n ətəkin - net daɣ əɣlal , tozal təd ̣ nay - t - idu har təššəšwa olaman kul .

text: And the man wondering at her held his peace , to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not .
text2: A tat - izagaz - du aləs s əməkəyad da , wər in ̣ n ̣ a arat fəl ad - inəy kud əməli a in ̣ saran əšikəl - net wala .

text: And it came to pass , as the camels had done drinking , that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight , and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold ;
text2: As əšwan olaman , idkal - du aləs təzəbit n urəɣ təgat əzuk n ədinar ig - et daɣ tanjart - net . Idkal - du tolas ilkəzan əššin n urəɣ s akk - iyyan iga m ̣ araw dinaran əd s ̣ əmmos , iqqan - as - tan .
