text: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob , These daughters are my daughters , and these children are my children , and these cattle are my cattle , and all that thou seest is mine : and what can I do this day unto these my daughters , or unto their children which they have born ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Laban i Yaqub : « Šibararen a ši nnu , bararan a i nnu , eharay a i nnu , a wa təhan ̣ n ̣ aya da kul i nnu . Mišan , əmərədda , wər əle batu fəl təbararen in əd bararan nasnat .

text: Now therefore come thou , let us make a covenant , I and thou ; and let it be for a witness between me and thee .
text2: « Daɣ a di əmərədda nənəmətkəlet arkawal ən tassaq ad iqqal təgiyya gar - i dər - ək .

text: And Jacob took a stone , and set it up for a pillar .
text2: Təzzar itkal Yaqub təhunt issəɣt - et əs təzzəgrət - net , təqqal təm ̣ ətirt .

text: And Jacob said unto his brethren , Gather stones ; and they took stones , and made an heap : and they did eat there upon the heap .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub y aytedan - net : « Amədat - du šihun ! » Əgan - tanat sakfaw , ətšan fall - as .

text: And Laban called it Jegar - sahadutha : but Jacob called it Galeed .
text2: Iga Laban i sakfaw wen es ̣ əm Yəgar - Sahaduta ( almaɣna sakfaw wa n təgiyya ) , daɣ awal - net , ig - as Yaqub es ̣ əm əntada Galed ( almaɣna sakfaw wa n təgiyya ) .

text: And Laban said , This heap is a witness between me and thee this day . Therefore was the name of it called Galeed ;
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Laban i Yaqub : « Sakfaw a ən təhun a da ənta im ̣ osan təgiyya gar - i dər - ək azalada » , a di da fəl iga es ̣ əm Galed .

text: And Mizpah ; for he said , The LORD watch between me and thee , when we are absent one from another .
text2: Iga es ̣ əm tolas Mitsfa ( almaɣna edag n ag ̣ g ̣ az ) , id Laban in ̣ n ̣ a tolas : « Aglet Əməli išišawalana a nəga daɣ ənəməggag .

text: If thou shalt afflict my daughters , or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters , no man is with us ; see , God is witness betwixt me and thee .
text2: « As təjajjargana šibararen - in madeɣ təzlafa šiyyad šid ̣ oden , aktəw im ̣ an - nak as kud ɣur - na wər illa awedan da Məššina a im ̣ osan təgiyya n arkawal wa nənamatkal ! » Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Laban i Yaqub : « Təhunt ta əssəɣta da əs təzzəgrət - net əd sakfaw wa , əssəbdadaq - qan gar - i dər - ək , ad aggayyen as wər ana z - iggəz i tan z - akəyan əhan tu arak m ̣ an .

text: The God of Abraham , and the God of Nahor , the God of their father , judge betwixt us . And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac .
text2: « Məššina n Ibrahim d Əməli ən Naxor ələkanet - ana ! » Dəffər a wen ihad Yaqub əs Məššina wa iksud abba - nnet Isxaq ar ad - it ̣ t ̣ əf arkawal .

text: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount , and called his brethren to eat bread : and they did eat bread , and tarried all night in the mount .
text2: Təzzar iga Yaqub takutay fəl adɣaɣ , iššedaw du sər - əs iššəqqaɣan - net . Ədrawan - tat , ənaman ̣ san ahad wə di fəl adɣaɣ .

text: And when Jacob saw them , he said , This is God ' s host : and he called the name of that place Mahanaim .
text2: Wa iššokal Yaqub əsalkadan as du angalosan .

text: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir , the country of Edom .
text2: As tan inay Yaqub , in ̣ n ̣ a : « A wa aɣaywan ən Məššina ! » Adi da fəlas iga adagg en es ̣ əm Maxanayim ( almaɣna əššin ɣawnatan ) .

text: And he commanded them , saying , Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau ; Thy servant Jacob saith thus , I have sojourned with Laban , and stayed there until now :
text2: Izozar du Yaqub inəmmuzal s amaqqar - net Esaw daɣ ədɣaɣan ən Sehir , akal n Edom .

text: And I have oxen , and asses , flocks , and menservants , and womenservants : and I have sent to tell my lord , that I may find grace in thy sight .
text2: Om ̣ ar tan , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Ad tan ̣ n ̣ im i məšš - i Esaw a wa : " In ̣ n ̣ ' ak əkli nnak Yaqub : nak əqqimaɣ in ɣur Laban har azalada !

text: And the messengers returned to Jacob , saying , We came to thy brother Esau , and also he cometh to meet thee , and four hundred men with him .
text2: Əggaznat du sər - i šitan , d əzdan , d aharay wa ənd ̣ ərran , d eklan əd taklaten . Əzzozaraɣ in inəmmuzal in ad ak əməlan məšš - i , fəl ad əgrəwa ətəwəqbal ɣur - ək . " »

text: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed : and he divided the people that was with him , and the flocks , and herds , and the camels , into two bands ;
text2: Əqqalan du nəmmuzal Yaqub , ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Nos ̣ ' in amaqqar nak Esaw , ənta im ̣ an - net issilkad ak du , iddəw d əkkozat təm ̣ ad n aləs . »

text: And said , If Esau come to the one company , and smite it , then the other company which is left shall escape .
text2: As isla Yaqub y a wa , təggaz - tu t ̣ asa wəllen , inkad , izun aytedan - net d aharay - nnet wa ənd ̣ ərran əd šitan əd m ̣ ənas , ig - en s ̣ anatat tərəkfen .

text: And Jacob said , O God of my father Abraham , and God of my father Isaac , the LORD which saidst unto me , Return unto thy country , and to thy kindred , and I will deal well with thee :
text2: Id orda as as ikənnas Esaw əd tərəkəft iyyat , tahadatad təg ̣ məd .

text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies , and of all the truth , which thou hast shewed unto thy servant ; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan ; and now I am become two bands .
text2: Təzzar it ̣ t ̣ ar Yaqub : « Məššina n abba - nin Ibrahim , Məššina n abba - nin Isxaq , Əməli , kay a di - in ̣ n ̣ an : " Əqqəl akal - nak , ɣur marwan - nak fəl ad ak - aga alxer ! " wa di - təgeɣ d id ̣ uf n arkawal wa di təs ̣ s ̣ əkna , nak ann əkli - nnak ogaran - i . Id fəlas ɣur teklay - nin təburək ɣas a dər əɣrasa Yordan a , mišan , azala , as d - əqqala əm ̣ osa s ̣ anatat tərəkfen .

text: And thou saidst , I will surely do thee good , and make thy seed as the sand of the sea , which cannot be numbered for multitude .
text2: « On ̣ sayaq - qay ad - i tag ̣ əza daɣ amaqqar - in Esaw fəlas əksudaɣ ad - i - is ̣ rəy ihlək - i nak əd bararan əd təd ̣ oden .

text: And he lodged there that same night ; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother ;
text2: « Id kay im ̣ an - nak ad - i - in ̣ n ̣ an : " A dak - aga alxer wəllen , əssəgeɣ əzzurriya - nnak šilat ən təblalen n am ̣ adal ən t ̣ ama n agarew wər nəla am ̣ adin " . »

text: Two hundred she goats , and twenty he goats , two hundred ewes , and twenty rams ,
text2: Iga t ̣ anat n ad - an ̣ su den da ahad wədi . Isan ̣ n ̣ afran daɣ təla - nnet a iga s ̣ usay y amaqqar - net Esaw .

text: Thirty milch camels with their colts , forty kine , and ten bulls , twenty she asses , and ten foals .
text2: Sanatat təm ̣ ad ən taɣat əd s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ərwen n əzolaɣ , s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ad ən tilay əd s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ərwen n akar ,

text: And he delivered them into the hand of his servants , every drove by themselves ; and said unto his servants , Pass over before me , and put a space betwixt drove and drove .
text2: karadat təm ̣ ərwen ən talamt əd waran - nasnat , əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen ən t ̣ əst əd m ̣ araw zəgran , s ̣ anatat təm ̣ ərwen ən tajat əd m ̣ araw bangitan .

text: And he commanded the foremost , saying , When Esau my brother meeteth thee , and asketh thee , saying , Whose art thou ? and whither goest thou ? and whose are these before thee ?
text2: Izammazay isəgan isod ̣ af - tan y eklan - net , in ̣ n ̣ - asan : « Izarat - i , tagim taffawt gar - ewwan . »

text: Then thou shalt say , They be thy servant Jacob ' s ; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau : and , behold , also he is behind us .
text2: Dəffər a wen om ̣ ar akli - nnet wa izzərgazan əsəgən wa zzaran : « As təm ̣ ənaya d amaqqarr - in Esaw is ̣ əstan kay : " Ma kay ilan ? Mənis tədaga ? Ma ilan eharay wa təzzərgaza ? "

text: And so commanded he the second , and the third , and all that followed the droves , saying , On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau , when ye find him .
text2: Tan ̣ n ̣ aɣ - as : " In məšši akli - nnak Yaqub . Isəgan a s ̣ usay a əm ̣ osan i məšši Esaw . Yaqub im ̣ an - net ilkam - ana - du . »

text: And say ye moreover , Behold , thy servant Jacob is behind us . For he said , I will appease him with the present that goeth before me , and afterward I will see his face ; peradventure he will accept of me .
text2: Iga alamar wen da y eklan - net kul win əzzərgaznen isəgan win s ̣ usay .

text: So went the present over before him : and himself lodged that night in the company .
text2: « Tan ̣ n ̣ im - as tolas : " Akli - nnak Yaqub izay - du " » Id orda - as ad issəs ̣ mad əs s ̣ usay wa din azzaran . Az - z - am ̣ m ̣ anayan da mijas igraw ɣur - əs Yaqub ətəwəqbal . »

text: And he rose up that night , and took his two wives , and his two womenservants , and his eleven sons , and passed over the ford Jabbok .
text2: Issəgla Yaqub isəgan win iga s ̣ usay y amaqqar - net ad as in izaran . Ənta in ̣ sa ahad wen daɣ aɣaywan . In ̣ kar ahad wədi da itkal šid ̣ oden - net an s ̣ anatat , əd təwahayen - net s ̣ anatat əd bararan - net m ̣ araw d iyyan , issəɣras tan angi wan Yaboq . Dəffər a wen issəɣras a wa ila .

text: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him , he touched the hollow of his thigh ; and the hollow of Jacob ' s thigh was out of joint , as he wrestled with him .
text2: Iqqim - du ɣas - net , har t - id os ̣ a aləs iyyan Ibbəllan dər əs har affaw .

text: And he said , Let me go , for the day breaketh . And he said , I will not let thee go , except thou bless me .
text2: As inay aləs wa as wər ifreg əsənbəg ən Yaqub id ̣ as - tu daɣ təməllay ən taɣma , tərrəffat tətoɣast - net igla Yaqub it ̣ t ̣ af tu .

text: And he said unto him , What is thy name ? And he said , Jacob .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as aləs : « Šalw - i ad agla ezal iga ! » Mišan in ̣ n ̣ - as Yaqub : « Wər kay z - ayya wər fall - i təgeɣ albaraka . »

text: And he said , Thy name shall be called no more Jacob , but Israel : for as a prince hast thou power with God and with men , and hast prevailed .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as aləs : « Ma es ̣ əm - nak ? » Ijjəwwab - as : « Yaqub . »

text: And Jacob asked him , and said , Tell me , I pray thee , thy name . And he said , Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name ? And he blessed him there .
text2: Am ̣ aran in ̣ n ̣ - as aləs : « Dəffər azala , aba as təgəɣ es ̣ əm Yaqub id təbbillana əd Məššina , əd meddan , təssənbaga . A di da fəlas əmərədda ad tagaɣ es ̣ əm Israyel ( almaɣna ibbəllan əd Məššina )

text: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel : for I have seen God face to face , and my life is preserved .
text2: Dəffər a wen is ̣ s ̣ əstan - tu Yaqub : « On ̣ sayaq - qay ad - i təməlaɣ es ̣ əm - nak » Miššan in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ma fel təs ̣ astana d es ̣ əm - in ? » Iga fall - as albaraka .

text: And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him , and he halted upon his thigh .
text2: Iga Yaqub y adagg - en es ̣ əm Fənyel ( almaɣna udəm ən Məššina ) , id in ̣ n ̣ a : « Ən ̣ aya Məššina udəm s udəm , əgleɣ , əddara ! »

text: Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank , which is upon the hollow of the thigh , unto this day : because he touched the hollow of Jacob ' s thigh in the sinew that shrank .
text2: As ig ̣ mad Yaqub Fənyel , əg ̣ əzzəy ən təfuk . Is ̣ igadal əs tətoɣast - net .

text: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost , and Leah and her children after , and Rachel and Joseph hindermost .
text2: Iga šiwahayen - net əd maddan - əsnat daɣ aɣaf , issəlkam - asnat Leyya əd maddan - əs , am ̣ aran Raxil əd Yusəf ig - en daɣ ələqqam .

text: And he passed over before them , and bowed himself to the ground seven times , until he came near to his brother .
text2: Ənta im ̣ an - net azzar - asan . As din - ihoz amaqqar - net ig - in sər - əs as əs ̣ s ̣ a səjudan .

text: And Esau ran to meet him , and embraced him , and fell on his neck , and kissed him : and they wept .
text2: Ozal Esaw , issəlkad - as , izalammat - tu igabarrat iri - nnet Am ̣ aran ad hallan fəl tədəwit n əm ̣ ənəy .

text: And he lifted up his eyes , and saw the women and the children ; and said , Who are those with thee ? And he said , The children which God hath graciously given thy servant .
text2: As inay Esaw šid ̣ oden əd bararan is ̣ əstan Yaqub : « Ma m ̣ osan win dər təddewa ? » Ijjəwwab - as : « A wa bararan win ikfa Məššina s əlxurma - nnet akli - nnak . »

text: Then the handmaidens came near , they and their children , and they bowed themselves .
text2: Ewadnat - du təwahayen əd maddan - əsnat əssəjadan y Esaw .

text: And Leah also with her children came near , and bowed themselves : and after came Joseph near and Rachel , and they bowed themselves .
text2: Dəffər a di Leyya əd maddan - əs , əs tilkamat Yusəf əd Raxil .

text: And he said , What meanest thou by all this drove which I met ? And he said , These are to find grace in the sight of my lord .
text2: Is ̣ s ̣ əstan - t Esaw : « Mas təleɣ ən ̣ n ̣ iyat n a tu - taga əs səgan win dər əm ̣ m ̣ ənaya ? » In ̣ n ̣ - as Yaqub : « Areɣ a - dak - kan aga s ̣ usay Məšš - i fəl a ɣur - ək ile əlxurma »

text: And Esau said , I have enough , my brother ; keep that thou hast unto thyself .
text2: « Ələ ərrəzəɣ aggen amad ̣ ray - nin , ət ̣ t ̣ əf a wa təle , » in ̣ n ̣ - as Esaw .

text: And Jacob said , Nay , I pray thee , if now I have found grace in thy sight , then receive my present at my hand : for therefore I have seen thy face , as though I had seen the face of God , and thou wast pleased with me .
text2: Eges in ̣ n ̣ - as Yaqub : « Uhun , on ̣ sayaq - qay kud kay wər iha arat sər - i , əqbəl s ̣ usay - nin əmərədda . Ənayaq - qay šišalaɣ a wen d an ̣ ay ən Məššina im ̣ an - net id ələ ɣur - ək əlxurma .

text: Take , I pray thee , my blessing that is brought to thee ; because God hath dealt graciously with me , and because I have enough . And he urged him , and he took it .
text2: Əqbəl , a daɣ - ak are , s ̣ usay wa dak - d - immewayan id Məššina iga fall - i əlləllu - nnet d as ələɣ arat kul wa as əd ̣ d ̣ ərara . » Id ̣ gaz - tu Yaqub wəllen har iqbal Esaw s ̣ usay - nnet .

text: And he said , Let us take our journey , and let us go , and I will go before thee .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Esaw : « Əndawat ! Əddewa dər - ək . »

text: And he said unto him , My lord knoweth that the children are tender , and the flocks and herds with young are with me : and if men should overdrive them one day , all the flock will die .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Yaqub : « Təs ̣ s ̣ ana məšš - i as bararan ərkaman , as eharay wa ənd ̣ ərran əd šitan san ̣ kasnen ihhiššal - iənat ̣ t ̣ af dər - san id as itawazargaz s ətrub ad - id ̣ d ̣ əz daɣ əzəl iyyan - da , iggəz - t am ̣ m ̣ at . »

text: Let my lord , I pray thee , pass over before his servant : and I will lead on softly , according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure , until I come unto my lord unto Seir .
text2: « On ̣ sayaq - qay , məšš - i , ad - i tizara , əlkəmaɣ - ak - in əd təzrek sollan əs təɣəllət ən hərwan win dat - i əd təɣəllət ən bararan har din awəda aɣaywan nak daɣ Sehir . »

text: And Esau said , Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me . And he said , What needeth it ? let me find grace in the sight of my lord .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as Esaw : « On ̣ sayaq - qay ad - i təqbəla a ɣur - ək d - ayya iyyad daɣ meddan - in . » In ̣ n ̣ - as Yaqub : « Wər əd ̣ d ̣ ərara sər - san . » Igd - i ad əgrawa ɣur - ək əlxurma . »

text: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir .
text2: Əzəl wen da ibaz Esaw tarrayt ta n Sehir iqqal .

text: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth , and built him an house , and made booths for his cattle : therefore the name of the place is called Succoth .
text2: Təzzar ikka Yaqub Sukkot ( almaɣna ifərgan ) ikras ehan y im ̣ an - net , iga ifərgan y aharay - nnet a di da fəl itawaga y adgg - en es ̣ əm Sukkot .

text: And Jacob came to Shalem , a city of Shechem , which is in the land of Canaan , when he came from Padan - aram ; and pitched his tent before the city .
text2: Ɣur afel - net Mesofotami , Yaqub os ̣ a - ddu Šalem , aɣrəm wa n Šəkem , daɣ am ̣ adal ən Kanan , izzəbbat dat əɣrəm .

text: And he bought a parcel of a field , where he had spread his tent , at the hand of the children of Hamor , Shechem ' s father , for an hundred pieces of money .
text2: Izzənza ɣur maddan - əs ən Xamor , šis ən Šəkem , akarammu n am ̣ adal wa daɣ ikras ahaket - net s əlqimat ən tam ̣ eday ən tafelt n əzrəf .

text: And he erected there an altar , and called it El - elohe - Israel .
text2: Ikras daɣ - as edagg ən t ̣ əkutay , ig - as es ̣ əm El - Elohe - Israyel ( almaɣna - nnet Məššina ənta Məššina n Israyel ) .

text: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite , prince of the country , saw her , he took her , and lay with her , and defiled her .
text2: Inay - tat Šəkem , ahaya ən Xiwi , im ̣ os rures ən Xamor wa n əmənokal n akal , ibaz - tat issəxram daɣ - as . im ̣ an - net , Dina ta n elles ən Yaqub , ig - as tara n iblis ir - et wəllen am ̣ aran ad - igammay d a wa as tu - za - tirəw .

text: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor , saying , Get me this damsel to wife .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Šəken y abba - nnet Xamor : « Agu arat kul wa fəl z - əzləfa tabarart a . »

text: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter : now his sons were with his cattle in the field : and Jacob held his peace until they were come .
text2: Isla Yaqub as tabarart - net tətiwajajargan , mišan id zama as maddan - əs əhan əs ̣ uf d aharay iffəsta , wər in ̣ n ̣ a arat har d - əqqalan .

text: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him .
text2: Xamor , šis ən Šəkem , ikka Yaqub dər - əs ammagrad

text: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it : and the men were grieved , and they were very wroth , because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob ' s daughter ; which thing ought not to be done .
text2: As d - əfalan maddanəs ən Yaqub əs ̣ uf əgrawan isalan n a wa igan . Əɣšadan m ̣ an nasan , iggaz - tan alhan səksədan fəl as əmazal wa tan is ̣ s ̣ əkna Šəkem im ̣ osan əsəxrəm daɣ Dina , elles ən Yaqub , isifallas Kəl Israyel . Əmazal wa im ̣ os arat wər nəmməkkan .

text: And Hamor communed with them , saying , The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter : I pray you give her him to wife .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - asan Xamor : « Barar - in , Šəkem təbaz - tu tarramt ən tabarart - nawan , areɣ daɣ - wan das - tat takfim y azalaf .

text: And make ye marriages with us , and give your daughters unto us , and take our daughters unto you .
text2: « Nazlafatana , akfat - ana ašše - kawan , təkəlam šin nana .

text: And ye shall dwell with us : and the land shall be before you ; dwell and trade ye therein , and get you possessions therein .
text2: Təham əlxəyyar n ad - təɣsəram ɣur - naar - ena . Əgeɣ akal daɣ fassan nawan , əggəzat - tu , təssəɣləyam daɣ as tilem daɣ as ərrəzəɣan . »

text: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren , Let me find grace in your eyes , and what ye shall say unto me I will give .
text2: Šəkem im ̣ an - net in ̣ n ̣ a y abba ən Dina əd məqqaran - net : « Əqbəlat man ̣ say - nin , a kawan - akfa a wa dər təs ̣ s ̣ əstanam kul .

text: Ask me never so much dowry and gift , and I will give according as ye shall say unto me : but give me the damsel to wife .
text2: « Əgməyat daɣ - i taggalt zəwwərat əd tən ̣ afuten aggotnen ad awan - ərzəma a wa dər təs ̣ s ̣ əstanam kul mišan akfat - i tabarart a - tat - əzləfa ! »

text: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully , and said , because he had defiled Dinah their sister :
text2: Maddan - əs ən Yaqub id ̣ gaz ətəwəjəjərgan ən tamad ̣ rayt nasan Dina as əjjəwwaban i Šəkem əd šis Xamor əkkrrasan tan .

text: And they said unto them , We cannot do this thing , to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised ; for that were a reproach unto us :
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an - asan : « Wər nəfreg ad - nakfu tamad ̣ rayt - nana aləs wər nəmmən ̣ kad izləf - tat , id a di issiras - ana .

text: But in this will we consent unto you : If ye will be as we be , that every male of you be circumcised ;
text2: « Wər kawan - za - nakfu tərəddat - nana , ar s - ad - təsəmmən ̣ kədam yayyan kul win əzdaɣnen aɣrəm a .

text: Then will we give our daughters unto you , and we will take your daughters to us , and we will dwell with you , and we will become one people .
text2: « Assaɣa di a - kawan - nakfu aššek - ana , nəzləf šin nawan , nəɣsər daɣ - wan , nəkrəs aɣrəf iyyan - da .

text: But if ye will not hearken unto us , to be circumcised ; then will we take our daughter , and we will be gone .
text2: « Mišan as wər təqbelam ad - tamman ̣ kadam ad nətkəl tabarart - nana , naglu . »

text: And their words pleased Hamor , and Shechem Hamor ' s son .
text2: Əljəmat ten ogaman - tat id Xamor əd rures Šəkem .

text: And the young man deferred not to do the thing , because he had delight in Jacob ' s daughter : and he was more honourable than all the house of his father .
text2: Daɣ əd ̣ d ̣ əguz ən tara ən tabarart ən Yaqub issətrab Šəkem əlqəbulat n a wa daɣ - san itawagmayan . Ənta im ̣ os wa itawas ̣ ofan daɣ ahan - nasan .

text: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city , and communed with the men of their city , saying ,
text2: Ikka Xamor əd rures Šəkem edag wa n əm ̣ ənəy daɣ əmi n əɣrəm , əmməgradan i meddan n əɣrəm , ən ̣ n ̣ an :

text: These men are peaceable with us ; therefore let them dwell in the land , and trade therein ; for the land , behold , it is large enough for them ; let us take their daughters to us for wives , and let us give them our daughters .
text2: « Meddan en ənniyen - ana alxer , ayyatanaq - qan ad - əɣsəran daɣ akal , əssəɣləyan daɣ - as . Akal elwa fall - ana nakkanay dər - san ! Nəfrəg azalaf n ašš - essan , nakf - en šin nana .

text: Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us , to be one people , if every male among us be circumcised , as they are circumcised .
text2: « Mišan dər əššərəd n as meddan en wər z - əqbəlan tartit dər - na , nəqqəl aɣrəf iyyan - da ar s ad - əmmin ̣ kadan yayyan - nana kul šilat - nasan .

text: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours ? only let us consent unto them , and they will dwell with us .
text2: « Ardatana s ad - nəqbəl əššərəd - di , am ̣ aran as əɣsaran daɣ - na , əddi ihərwan - nasan d ərrəzaɣan nasan ad - əqqəlan in nana . »

text: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city ; and every male was circumcised , all that went out of the gate of his city .
text2: Əqbalan aytedan kul winn əɣrəm a wa dasan - in ̣ n ̣ a Xamor əd rures Šəkem , am ̣ aran əmmən ̣ kadan yayyan n əɣrəm .

text: And it came to pass on the third day , when they were sore , that two of the sons of Jacob , Simeon and Levi , Dinah ' s brethren , took each man his sword , and came upon the city boldly , and slew all the males .
text2: Mišan əzəl wa n karad , daɣ əknan yayyan win əm ̣ m ̣ ənkadnen təzzurt , ənkaran du maddanəs ən Yaqub əššin , iməqqaran ən Dina , Šimehon əd Lefi , ətkalan šikabiwen - nasan , əggazan aɣrəm wər nənked ad ənaqqan yayyan kul win t - əhanen .

text: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword , and took Dinah out of Shechem ' s house , and went out .
text2: Ənɣan Xamor im ̣ an - net əd rures Šəkem əs takoba , əbazan - du Dina daɣ ahan ən Šəkem , əglan dər - əs .

text: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain , and spoiled the city , because they had defiled their sister .
text2: Maddanəs ən Yaqub saffaykan šiməɣsa , oɣan aɣrəm wa ijajjarganan tamad ̣ rayt - nasan .

text: They took their sheep , and their oxen , and their asses , and that which was in the city , and that which was in the field ,
text2: Ətkalan eharay wa ənd ̣ ərran əd wa zuwwaran , d əzdan , d a wa ihan aɣrəm kul d əs ̣ uf .

text: And all their wealth , and all their little ones , and their wives took they captive , and spoiled even all that was in the house .
text2: Oɣan , ewayan təgərgist - nasan kul , əd maddan - əsan əd təd ̣ oden - nasan , d a wa ihan in ̣ an - nasan kul .

text: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi , Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land , among the Canaanites and the Perizzites : and I being few in number , they shall gather themselves together against me , and slay me ; and I shall be destroyed , I and my house .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i Šimehon əd Lefi : « Təgam - i daɣ aššawaša , təgam - i ark ad ̣ u dat Kəl - Kanan əd Kəl - Fəriz . Nak wər əleɣ ar təkəbəzzet ən meddan s iga adi əntanay as namannakan fall - i , əs ̣ rayan - i , a - di - əhləkan nak d aɣaywan - in . »

text: And they said , Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot ?
text2: Mišan ən ̣ n ̣ an - as : « Wər nəfreg ad - nayyu aləs wa išaššalan tamad ̣ rayt - nana əd tənəssexrəmt . »

text: Then Jacob said unto his household , and to all that were with him , Put away the strange gods that are among you , and be clean , and change your garments :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub y aytedan - net əd win dər - əs əddewnen : « Əgərat - in as ̣ s ̣ anaman win ɣur - wan əllanen , zəzdəgat , təsəm ̣ m ̣ əttəyam isəlsa !

text: And let us arise , and go up to Bethel ; and I will make there an altar unto God , who answered me in the day of my distress , and was with me in the way which I went .
text2: Ad - nəfəl edagg a , ad - nakku Bet - El dad z - əkrəsa edagg ən təkutay i Məššina wa di - isannaflayan assaɣa wa ad əmaɣatara , is ̣ s ̣ an daɣ - i edag os ̣ e . »

text: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand , and all their earrings which were in their ears ; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem .
text2: Təzzar əkfan Yaqub as ̣ s ̣ anaman win əlan kul , əd təzabaten ən təməzzugen kul id əm ̣ osnat addabaratan . In ̣ bal - tan Yaqub daw ašək igan es ̣ əm ela illan dagma n əɣrəm ən Šəkem .

text: And they journeyed : and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them , and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob .
text2: Dəffər a wen əs ̣ s ̣ əntan əšikəl . Ixrab Məššina kəl ɣərman win tan ɣalayɣalaynen a di da fəlas wər ilkem awedan i maddan - əs ən Yaqub .

text: So Jacob came to Luz , which is in the land of Canaan , that is , Bethel , he and all the people that were with him .
text2: Yaqub əd win dər iddew kul os ̣ an - in Luz igan es ̣ əm tolas Bet - El , ihan akal ən Kanan .

text: And he built there an altar , and called the place El - beth - el : because there God appeared unto him , when he fled from the face of his brother .
text2: Əddi ikras edagg ən təkutay , ig - as es ̣ əm El - Betel ( almaɣna - nnet Məššina ən Betel ) id dada a das - d - inafalal Məššina as id ̣ d ̣ əggag y amaqqar - net .

text: But Deborah Rebekah ' s nurse died , and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak : and the name of it was called Allon - bachuth .
text2: Aba Dəbora taklit ən Raqqiyyetu , tətawan ̣ bal daw ašək illan daw betel , igan es ̣ əm elon as har harwa es ̣ əm - net Elon wa n Tala .

text: And God appeared unto Jacob again , when he came out of Padan - aram , and blessed him .
text2: Inafalal - du Məššina tolas i Yaqub ɣur tawaɣlay - nnet Mesofotami , iga fall - as albaraka ,

text: And God said unto him , Thy name is Jacob : thy name shall not be called any more Jacob , but Israel shall be thy name : and he called his name Israel .
text2: in ̣ n ̣ - as : « Es ̣ əm - nak Yaqub mišan dəffər azala ad - tagaɣ es ̣ əm Israyel . » A di da fəl - as itawagga es ̣ əm Israyel .

text: And God said unto him , I am God Almighty : be fruitful and multiply ; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee , and kings shall come out of thy loins ;
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ - as Məššina : « Nak Məššina di maqqaran zəddig . A fall - ak aga albaraka fəl ad ifələyləy əzzurriya - nnak . Əzzurriya - nnak di a daɣ - as tətəwəggu tamattay madeɣ tidawat ən təmattiwen . Agin mənokalan daɣ - as .

text: And the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac , to thee I will give it , and to thy seed after thee will I give the land .
text2: « Akal wa əkfeɣ Ibrahim d Isxaq , a - dak - akfa kay da , akfaq - qu y əzzurriya - nnak dəffər - ək . »

text: And God went up from him in the place where he talked with him .
text2: Təzzar ig ̣ mad Məššina edag wa daɣ iššewal i Yaqub .

text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him , even a pillar of stone : and he poured a drink offering thereon , and he poured oil thereon .
text2: Issəɣta Yaqub daɣ adag wa sər - əs iššewal Məššina təhunt təzzar inɣal fall - as esmad im ̣ osan takutay , issəlal - tat widi , təqqal təm ̣ ətirt ən Məššina .

text: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him , Bethel .
text2: Təzzar iga adagg - en wa sər - əs iššewal Məššina es ̣ əm Bet - El ( almaɣna - nnet Ehan ən Məššina ) .

text: And they journeyed from Bethel ; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath : and Rachel travailed , and she had hard labour .
text2: Yaqub əd tələqqawen - net əg ̣ madan Bet - El . Daɣ tarrayt n əɣrəm n Efrata , daq - qu əggugan , təggaz Raxil šin ig ̣ uz n əm ̣ zur , das - wər - nələmmid .

text: And it came to pass , when she was in hard labour , that the midwife said unto her , Fear not ; thou shalt have this son also .
text2: Alwaq wa daɣ fall - as təs ̣ s ̣ as talɣa tən ̣ n ̣ - as tən ̣ tut ta n tənakbalt : « Dawat , barar iyyan tolas ! »

text: And it came to pass , as her soul was in departing , ( for she died ) that she called his name Ben - oni : but his father called him Benjamin .
text2: Mišan s iga di da təlla ɣur - əs tam ̣ attant , am ̣ aran dad zama təgraw tu daɣ amazay wa , təg - as es ̣ əm Benoni ( almaɣna ag talawayt - in ) mišan abba - nnet ig - as es ̣ əm Benyamin ( almaɣna ag əɣil ) .

text: And Rachel died , and was buried in the way to Ephrath , which is Bethlehem .
text2: Aba Raxil . Tətawan ̣ bal daɣ tarrayt n Efrata , s əmərədda aɣrəm di itawagg - as es ̣ əm Betlehem .

text: And Jacob set a pillar upon her grave : that is the pillar of Rachel ' s grave unto this day .
text2: Issəɣta Yaqub təhunt təqqal təm ̣ ətirt fəl tasas ̣ kawt - net . Təm ̣ ətirt - en təmmunn fəl tasas ̣ kawt ən Raxil har azalada .

text: And Israel journeyed , and spread his tent beyond the tower of Edar .
text2: Dəffər awen iggəlat , ikras ahaket dənnəg Migdal - Eder .

text: And it came to pass , when Israel dwelt in that land , that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father ' s concubine : and Israel heard it . Now the sons of Jacob were twelve :
text2: As iɣsar Israyel daɣ am ̣ adal wa , itinəmən ̣ su Ruben əd Bilha , tawahayt n abba - nnet . Isla Israyel a di wər t - ogem . Ila Yaqub m ̣ araw bararan d əššin .

text: The sons of Leah ; Reuben , Jacob ' s firstborn , and Simeon , and Levi , and Judah , and Issachar , and Zebulun :
text2: Ila əd Leyya : Ruben , aɣafadday , dəffər - əs Šimehon , Lefi , Yuda , Issakar əd Zəbulun

text: The sons of Rachel ; Joseph , and Benjamin :
text2: Ila əd Raxil : Yusəf əd Benyamin .

text: And the sons of Bilhah , Rachel ' s handmaid ; Dan , and Naphtali :
text2: Ila əd Bilha , taklit ən Raxil : Dan əd Naftali .

text: And the sons of Zilpah , Leah ' s handmaid ; Gad , and Asher : these are the sons of Jacob , which were born to him in Padan - aram .
text2: Ila əd Zilfa , taklit ən Leyya : Gad d Aššer . Əntanay da da maddanəs ən Yaqub win das - d - əhunen daɣ Mesofotami .

text: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father unto Mamre , unto the city of Arbah , which is Hebron , where Abraham and Isaac sojourned .
text2: Os ̣ - in Yaqub aɣaywan n abba - nnet Isxaq daɣ Mamre , daɣ Kiryat - Arba , im ̣ os əmərədda Xebron , dad iga Ibrahim d Isxaq təməɣsurt ən magaran .

text: And the days of Isaac were an hundred and fourscore years .
text2: Iga Isxaq təməddurt ən t ̣ ameday n awatay d ət ̣ t ̣ amat təm ̣ ərwen ,

text: And Isaac gave up the ghost , and died , and was gathered unto his people , being old and full of days : and his sons Esau and Jacob buried him .
text2: təzzar aba - tu . Dəffər təɣrəst zagret ilkam i win əglanen . Ən ̣ balan - tu bararan - net fəl əššin - essan Esaw əd Yaqub .

text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan ; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite , and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite ;
text2: Izlaf Esaw šid ̣ oden ən Kəl Kanan , əm ̣ osnen : Ada , elles n Elan , wa n aw Xiti , Oholibama , elles n Ana , tahayot ən Tsibon , wa n aw Xiwi ,

text: And Bashemath Ishmael ' s daughter , sister of Nebajoth .
text2: əd Basmat , elles n Ismaɣil , tam ̣ ad ̣ rayt ən Nəbayot .

text: And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz ; and Bashemath bare Reuel ;
text2: Ila d Ada Elifaz , ila əd Basmat , Rəhuhel ,

text: And Aholibamah bare Jeush , and Jaalam , and Korah : these are the sons of Esau , which were born unto him in the land of Canaan .
text2: ila d Oholibama Yehuš , Yalam , Korax . Bararan win kul əhuwan - du y Esaw daɣ akal ən Kanan .

text: And Esau took his wives , and his sons , and his daughters , and all the persons of his house , and his cattle , and all his beasts , and all his substance , which he had got in the land of Canaan ; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob .
text2: Dəffər a wen itkal Esaw šid ̣ oden əd bararan əd təbararen - net , d aytedan kul n aɣaywan - net , əd hərwan əd təlawen kul šin sər - əs əggaznen daɣ akal ən Kanan , igla , innəmad akal iyyan iggugan amad ̣ ray - nnet Yaqub ,

text: For their riches were more than that they might dwell together ; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their cattle .
text2: fəlas ihərwan - nasan əknanen igət wəllen wər - tan - ewayan m ̣ əssadan n akal iyyan - da .

text: Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir : Esau is Edom .
text2: Esaw , igan es ̣ əm tolas Edom , iɣsar daɣ adɣaɣ wa n Sehir .

text: And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir :
text2: Ənta da əttarix n əzzurriya n Esaw , am ̣ araw ən Kəl Edom , əɣsarnen daɣ akal n ədɣaɣan wa n Sehir .

text: These are the names of Esau ' s sons ; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau , Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau .
text2: Əntanay da is ̣ mawan ən maddanəs n Esaw : Elifaz , rures n Ada , tan ̣ tut n Esaw , Rəhuhel , rures ən Basmat , tan ̣ tut n Esaw .

text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman , Omar , Zepho , and Gatam , and Kenaz .
text2: Elifaz igraw bararan əm ̣ osnen : Teman , Ɣomar , Tsəfo , Gatam , əd Kənaz .

text: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau ' s son ; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek : these were the sons of Adah Esau ' s wife .
text2: Tawahayt n Elifaz , wa n agg Esaw , ila dər - əs Amalek . Win di bararan kul əzzurriya n Ada , ta ɣur Esaw .

text: And these are the sons of Reuel ; Nahath , and Zerah , Shammah , and Mizzah : these were the sons of Bashemath Esau ' s wife .
text2: Rəhuhel igraw bararan əm ̣ osnen : Naxat , Zerax , Šamma , əd Miza . Win di bararan kul əzzurriya ən Basmat ta ɣur Esaw .

text: And these were the sons of Aholibamah , the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon , Esau ' s wife : and she bare to Esau Jeush , and Jaalam , and Korah .
text2: Oholibama , elles n Ana , tahayyot ən Tsivon , təm ̣ os ta ɣur Esaw , teraw - as - du : Yehuš , Yalam , əd Korax . Əntanay da is ̣ mawan ən xakəmitan win əganen daɣ əzzurriya n Esaw . Elifaz , wa n aɣafadday - nnet , eraw xakəmitan ən Kəl Edom əm ̣ osnen : Teman , Ɣomar , Tsəfo , Kənaz , KoraxGatan , Amalek . Əm ̣ osan əzzurriya n Ada dd Esaw .

text: And these are the sons of Reuel Esau ' s son ; duke Nahath , duke Zerah , duke Shammah , duke Mizzah : these are the dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom ; these are the sons of Bashemath Esau ' s wife .
text2: Rəhuhel eraw xakəmitan wiyyad ən Kəl Edom əm ̣ osnen : Naxat , Zerax , Šamma əd Miza . Əm ̣ osan əzzurriya ən Basmat d Esaw .

text: And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau ' s wife ; duke Jeush , duke Jaalam , duke Korah : these were the dukes that came of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah , Esau ' s wife .
text2: Oholibama , elles n Ana , ta ɣur Esaw , teraw ənta da xakəmitan əm ̣ osnen : Yəhuš , Yalam , Korax .

text: These are the sons of Esau , who is Edom , and these are their dukes .
text2: Ənta əddi da əzzurriya n Esaw əd xakəmitan - net , win fəl təga tamattay ta n Kəl Edom . Aytedan win d azzarnen s akal wa n Edom əm ̣ osan əzzurriya ən Sehir wa n aw Xori . Əntanay da is ̣ mawan ən xakəmitan - nasan : Lotan , Šobal , Tsifon , Ana , Dišon , Etser , Dišan .

text: And the children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam ; and Lotan ' s sister was Timna .
text2: Maddanəs ən Lotan əm ̣ osan : Xori əd Xamam . Ila Lotan tamad ̣ rayt , təgat es ̣ əm Timna .

text: And the children of Shobal were these ; Alvan , and Manahath , and Ebal , Shepho , and Onam .
text2: Maddanəs ən Šobal əm ̣ osan : Alfan , Manaxat , Ebal , Šefo , d Onam .

text: And these are the children of Zibeon ; both Ajah , and Anah : this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness , as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father .
text2: Maddanəs ən Tsifon əm ̣ osan : Aya d Ana . Ana ad d - isaffaggan šit ̣ t ̣ awen n am ̣ an daɣ tan ̣ eray ɣur təməd ̣ int - net əzdan ən Tsifon , wa n abba - nnet .

text: And the children of Anah were these ; Dishon , and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah .
text2: Maddanəs n Ana əm ̣ osan : Dišon d Oholibama , ta n tabarart - net .

text: And these are the children of Dishon ; Hemdan , and Eshban , and Ithran , and Cheran .
text2: Maddanəs ən Dišon əm ̣ osan : Xemdan , Ešban , Itran əd Kəran .

text: The children of Ezer are these ; Bilhan , and Zaavan , and Akan .
text2: Maddanəs n Etser əm ̣ osan : Bilhan , Zafan d Akan .

text: The children of Dishan are these : Uz , and Aran .
text2: Maddanəs ən Dišan əm ̣ osan : Uts d Aran . Əntanay əddi xakəmitan ən Kəl Xori daɣ am ̣ adal ən Sehir əs təzunen ən taɣmaren - nasan : Lotan , Šobal , Tsibon , Ana , Dišon , Etser , Dišan .

text: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom , before there reigned any king over the children of Israel .
text2: Əgan mənokalan daɣ akal n Edom dat igi - nasan daɣ Kəl Israyel . Əntanay da is ̣ mawan ən mənokalan win ənasalkamnen daɣ Edom : Bela , ag Behor , n əɣrəm ən Dinhaba , dəffər iba - nnet , Yobab , ag Zerax , n əɣrəm ən Botsra , dəffər iba - nnet , Xušam , n akal ən Kəl Temani , dəffər iba - nnet , Hadad , ag Bədad , n əɣrəm n Afit , irza Kəl Midyan daɣ əs ̣ uf ən Mohab , dəffər iba - nnet , Samla , n əɣrəm ən Masreka , dəffər iba - nnet , Šahul , n əɣrəm ən Rəxobot fəl agarew , dəffər iba - nnet , Bahal - Xanan , agg Akbor , dəffər iba - nnet , Adar , n əɣrəm wa n Fahu , tan ̣ tut - net Məhetabel təm ̣ os elles ən Matred , tahayot ən Me - Zahab .

text: And these are the names of the dukes that came of Esau , according to their families , after their places , by their names ; duke Timnah , duke Alvah , duke Jetheth ,
text2: Əntanay da xakəmitan win əganen daɣ əzzurriya n Esaw əs tawšeten - nasan , əd kalan - nasan , d əsm ̣ awan - nasan : Timna , Alfa , Yətet , Oholibama , Ela , Finon , Kənaz , Teman , Mibtsar , Magdyel , d Iram . Əntanay di xakəmitan n Edom səməsəɣsar nasan daɣ kallan win əhan . Ənta əddi əttarix n Esaw , əmaraw ən Kəl Edom . ƏTTARIX ƏN YUSƏF AG YAQUB

text: These are the generations of Jacob . Joseph , being seventeen years old , was feeding the flock with his brethren ; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah , and with the sons of Zilpah , his father ' s wives : and Joseph brought unto his father their evil report .
text2: Ənta da əttarix ən maddanəs ən Yaqub . Yusəf im ̣ os abi ilan m ̣ araw elan d əs ̣ s ̣ a , faw itakku təməd ̣ int ən hərwan nasan iddew əd məqqaran - net maddanəs ən Bilha əd Zilfa , šid ̣ oden n abba nnet . Faw itaway du i ši - s isalan n arak tən ̣ n ̣ awen šin əgannin .

text: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children , because he was the son of his old age : and he made him a coat of many colours .
text2: Israyil ( es ̣ əm wahad ̣ an ən Yaqub ) is ̣ s ̣ of Yusəf bararan - net kul win had ̣ atnen fəlas tušaray - net a daq q igraw . Ig ' as takatkat təknat šihussay .

text: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren , they hated him , and could not speak peaceably unto him .
text2: Ənayan məqqaran - net as əntanay is ̣ s ̣ of tan ši - ssan Yusəf , təzzar əgzaran tu har as abas əfragan dər - əs ələsan takkayt .

text: And Joseph dreamed a dream , and he told it his brethren : and they hated him yet the more .
text2: Iga Yusəf targət , imal asan tat , təzzar əsannahalan tu gezzar .

text: And he said unto them , Hear , I pray you , this dream which I have dreamed :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Səsəmat i ad awan əməla targət ta əgeɣ ,

text: For , behold , we were binding sheaves in the field , and , lo , my sheaf arose , and also stood upright ; and , behold , your sheaves stood round about , and made obeisance to my sheaf .
text2: im ̣ an nana a nayaɣ nəha šiwəgas nətaqqan šibolasen n alkaman , as din əgreɣ təbolast ta nnu təbdad , əkkanat tat du šin nawan əɣalayɣalaynat tat , əssəjadnat as . »

text: And his brethren said to him , Shalt thou indeed reign over us ? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us ? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams , and for his words .
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an as məqqaran - net : « Əngəm kay a z iqqəlan əmənokal nana , təxkəmaɣ ana ? » Əsannahalan tu məqqaran - net gezzar wəllen fəl tərgət ta sər - san iga da , d amel wa dasan tat iga .

text: And he dreamed yet another dream , and told it his brethren , and said , Behold , I have dreamed a dream more ; and , behold , the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me .
text2: Ilas Yusəf igi ən tərgət iyyat imal tat i məqqaran - net . In ̣ n ̣ a : « Əgeɣ targət iyyat tolas təm ̣ osat as ənaya təfuk əd təllit d et ̣ ran əm ̣ osnen maraw d iyyan , a di sajadnen . »

text: And he told it to his father , and to his brethren : and his father rebuked him , and said unto him , What is this dream that thou hast dreamed ? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth ?
text2: Targət ta imal i məqqaran - net da , imal tat i ši - s ənta da . Iharaššat tu ši - s in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Ma im ̣ os almaɣna ən tərgət ta ? Mərda nnak ad ak nəssəjəd nak , d anna nak əd məqqaran nak ? »

text: And his brethren envied him ; but his father observed the saying .
text2: Təzzar əmmənzaɣan tu məqqaran - net mišan ši - s imməɣras in ikit ̣ t ̣ əw targət ta .

text: And his brethren went to feed their father ' s flock in Shechem .
text2: As əzəl iyyan əglan məqqaran - net əd ̣ anan eharay ən ši - ssan daɣ am ̣ adal ən Šəkem .

text: And Israel said unto Joseph , Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem ? come , and I will send thee unto them . And he said to him , Here am I .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Israyil i Yusəf : « Iməqqaran nak wərgeɣ əkkan təməd ̣ int əs Šəkem , ayaw a kay zəmmizəla sər - san . » Ikkəwan as Yusəf , in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Nak da . »

text: And he said to him , Go , I pray thee , see whether it be well with thy brethren , and well with the flocks ; and bring me word again . So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron , and he came to Shechem .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Aglu əs ̣ s ̣ ən iməqqaran nak əɣlasan , əntanay d aharay nasan , təqqəla du təməlaɣ i . Təzzar immozal Yusəf , ifal aɣlal wa n Xebron ikka Šəkem .

text: And a certain man found him , and , behold , he was wandering in the field : and the man asked him , saying , What seekest thou ?
text2: Ijiwankat as t igraw aləs iyyan , ixrak daɣ əs ̣ uf . In ̣ n ̣ ' as : « M ' as təs ̣ aggada ? »

text: And he said , I seek my brethren : tell me , I pray thee , where they feed their flocks .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yusəf : « Iməqqaran nin as əs ̣ aggada , təfraga ad i təməla edag wa daɣ əssəd ̣ anan . »

text: And the man said , They are departed hence ; for I heard them say , Let us go to Dothan . And Joseph went after his brethren , and found them in Dothan .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as aləs : « Əg ̣ madan edag wa fəlas əsallaɣ asan as ən ̣ n ̣ an : " Əndawatana am ̣ adal wa n Dotan ! " » Iggaz Yusəf ədəriz ən məqqaran - net har tan in os ̣ a daɣ Dotan .

text: And when they saw him afar off , even before he came near unto them , they conspired against him to slay him .
text2: As t ənayan daɣ igəg , izay tan in , əgan eɣaf fəl at t anɣin .

text: And they said one to another , Behold , this dreamer cometh .
text2: Ənaman ̣ n ̣ an gar - essan : « Əməggi ən tərgəten den ad d izayan den .

text: Come now therefore , and let us slay him , and cast him into some pit , and we will say , Some evil beast hath devoured him : and we shall see what will become of his dreams .
text2: Anɣiwatanaq qu a tu nəgər daɣ iyyat daɣ təgaziwen a , ad nan ̣ n ̣ u əmudar at t itšan , ad nəs ̣ s ̣ ən a wa z ' əqqəlnat tərgəten - net . »

text: And Reuben heard it , and he delivered him out of their hands ; and said , Let us not kill him .
text2: Isl asan Ruben , igmay d efsan - net in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Ad wər tagim im ̣ an - net . »

text: And Reuben said unto them , Shed no blood , but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness , and lay no hand upon him ; that he might rid him out of their hands , to deliver him to his father again .
text2: Ilas in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Ad wər tənɣəlam azni nnet , əgərat t in ɣas daɣ tagaza a təhat əs ̣ uf da , da wər das təɣšedam arat . » Ruben ira at t assafsu har t issuɣəl i ši - s .

text: And it came to pass , when Joseph was come unto his brethren , that they stript Joseph out of his coat , his coat of many colours that was on him ;
text2: As d ewad Yusəf iməqqaran - net əzzafan tu əkkas ̣ an daɣ - as takatkat - net ta təknat šihussay izlag .

text: And they took him , and cast him into a pit : and the pit was empty , there was no water in it .
text2: Təzzar ədkalan tu əgaran tu daɣ tagaza wər əhen am ̣ an .

text: And they sat down to eat bread : and they lifted up their eyes and looked , and , behold , a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh , going to carry it down to Egypt .
text2: Dəffər adi əqqiman ad ət ̣ attin as d ətkalan as ̣ awad nasan , ənayan taɣlamt ən Kəl Ismaɣil a du təfalat am ̣ adal ən Gilad . Olaman nasan əggiggan ilalan əganen daɣ məglan d ad ̣ utan əzodnen , əgan anamod ən Masar .

text: And Judah said unto his brethren , What profit is it if we slay our brother , and conceal his blood ?
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Yuda i məqqaran - net : « Ma dana z ' aknu ad nanɣu amad ̣ ray nnana nəɣbər azni nnet ?

text: Come , and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites , and let not our hand be upon him ; for he is our brother and our flesh . And his brethren were content .
text2: Əndawat a t in nazzanzu i Kəl Ismaɣil , da wər das nəɣšed arat , fəlas amad ̣ ray nnana a im ̣ os , nəm ̣ os dər - əs arat iyyanda . » Təzzar ət ̣ t ̣ afan məqqaran - net batu ta , ənamard ̣ an dər - əs fall - as .

text: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen ; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit , and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver : and they brought Joseph into Egypt .
text2: As d okoyan mazanzan wiyyad ̣ ən Kəl Midyan , əkkasan du Yusəf daɣ tagaza , əzzənzan t in i Kəl Ismaɣil s ̣ anatat təmərwen ən tamma n əzrəf . Ewayan tu Kəl Ismaɣil win əs Masar .

text: And Reuben returned unto the pit ; and , behold , Joseph was not in the pit ; and he rent his clothes .
text2: Iqqal du Ruben tagaza inay as Yusəf wər tat iha . Təzzar irmaɣ ad izazarrat isəlsa nnet .

text: And he returned unto his brethren , and said , The child is not ; and I , whither shall I go ?
text2: Iqqal iməd ̣ rayan - net , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Barar wər t ' illa ! Əmərədda , nak ma z ' aga ? »

text: And they took Joseph ' s coat , and killed a kid of the goats , and dipped the coat in the blood ;
text2: Təzzar əgzaman əzolaɣ ədkalan takatkat ən Yusəf , əssəlmaɣan tat daɣ əzni nnet .

text: And they sent the coat of many colours , and they brought it to their father ; and said , This have we found : know now whether it be thy son ' s coat or no .
text2: Əsassawayan takatkat ta təknat šihussay əs ši - ssan , ən ̣ n ̣ an as in : « A wa da a din nog ̣ az əs ̣ s ̣ ən kud takatkat ən barar nak adi wala . »

text: And he knew it , and said , It is my son ' s coat ; an evil beast hath devoured him ; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces .
text2: Izday tat in ̣ n ̣ a : « Takatkat ən barar in a wa ! Əmudar n əmətši at t ' itšan ! Yusəf barar in iqqal idesan immətša !

text: And Jacob rent his clothes , and put sackcloth upon his loins , and mourned for his son many days .
text2: Ad izazarrat Yaqub telassay - net fəl tərəmmeq , iggaz afartay ən rur - es har ig ' azzaman aggotnen .

text: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him ; but he refused to be comforted ; and he said , For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning . Thus his father wept for him .
text2: Ad gammayan bararan - net əd təbararen - net ket nasan ad t ' əsəssikəyan tərəmmeq mišan ugay , in ̣ n ̣ a : « Kala kala , har faw əheɣ afartay iket wər əlkema i barar in s alaxirat . » Imməɣras in ihallu fall - as .

text: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar , an officer of Pharaoh ' s , and captain of the guard .
text2: Siga wen Yusəf əzzənzan t ' in Kəl Midyan daɣ akal wa n Masar y aləs igan es ̣ əm Fotifar illan ɣur Firɣawna , im ̣ os əmuzar ən mag ̣ azan - net ən nammagaran .

text: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite , whose name was Shuah ; and he took her , and went in unto her .
text2: Aɣrəm wen da a daɣ inay Yuda tabarart n iyyan daɣ Kəl Kanan igan es ̣ əm Šuwa , təzzar izlaf tat , inaman ̣ sa dər - əs .

text: And she conceived , and bare a son ; and he called his name Er .
text2: Təga tadist , təggaz am ̣ zur ən barar , ig ' as es ̣ əm Er .

text: And she conceived again , and bare a son ; and she called his name Onan .
text2: Təga tadist tolas , təggaz am ̣ zur ən barar təg ' as es ̣ əm Onan .

text: And she yet again conceived , and bare a son ; and called his name Shelah : and he was at Chezib , when she bare him .
text2: Təlas igi ən tədist , ihu du barar təg ' as es ̣ əm Šela . Barar wa as ihu Yuda iha aɣrəm ən Kəzib .

text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn , whose name was Tamar .
text2: Izzəzlaf Yuda aɣafadday - net Er tant ̣ ut təgat es ̣ əm Tamar .

text: And Er , Judah ' s firstborn , was wicked in the sight of the LORD ; and the LORD slew him .
text2: Mišan Er , aɣafadday ən Yuda , itagg ' arak mazalan wər oggem Məššina , təzzar eway du sər - əs tam ̣ attant .

text: And Judah said unto Onan , Go in unto thy brother ' s wife , and marry her , and raise up seed to thy brother .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Yuda y Onan : « Aglu , nəmən ̣ su əd tənt ̣ ut n amaqqar nak , ad tagaɣ əzzəbun n ələggus , tagaɣ əzzurriya y amaqqar nak . »

text: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his ; and it came to pass , when he went in unto his brother ' s wife , that he spilled it on the ground , lest that he should give seed to his brother .
text2: Onan is ̣ s ̣ anan as əzzurriya wa wərgeɣ i nnet , id inaman ̣ sa əd tənt ̣ ut n amaqqar - net ad issənɣəl daɣ am ̣ adal fəl ma d ' iga əzzurriya y amaqqar - net .

text: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD : wherefore he slew him also .
text2: Arat wa wər t oggem Məššina , təzzar eway du sər - əs tam ̣ attant ənta da .

text: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law , Remain a widow at thy father ' s house , till Shelah my son be grown : for he said , Lest peradventure he die also , as his brethren did . And Tamar went and dwelt in her father ' s house .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yuda i təd ̣ aggalt - net Tamar : « Əggəz afartay daɣ ahan n abba nnam har idwəl barar in Šela . » Fəlas iksud ad agu barar - net wa da tam ̣ attant a əgan məqqaran - net . Təgla Tamar , təɣsar ɣur ši - s .

text: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah ' s wife died ; and Judah was comforted , and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath , he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite .
text2: As təga tamert tagget aba tabarart ən Šuwa , tant ̣ ut ən Yuda . As tu tokay tərəmmeq ən tam ̣ attant ən taɣur - əs , igla ənta Yuda , iddew d əmidi - net Xira wa n Adulam , əkkan Timna , edag wa daɣ du tətawakkas təd ̣ uft n ayfəd ̣ - net .

text: And it was told Tamar , saying , Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep .
text2: Ittəmal adi i Tamar , itawan ̣ n ̣ as əd ̣ aggal - net iha tarrayt idag sas Timna , fəl ikus ən təd ̣ uft n ayfəd ̣ - net .

text: And she put her widow ' s garments off from her , and covered her with a vail , and wrapped herself , and sat in an open place , which is by the way to Timnath ; for she saw that Shelah was grown , and she was not given unto him to wife .
text2: Təzzar təkkas isəlsa - nnet win n afartay , təssəwar afər fəl at təg ̣ məd tazdit , təqqim dagma n əs ̣ ihar ən tarrayen n Enayim , aɣrəm ihan tarrayt ta n Timna , fəlas togga as Šela idwal , mišan harwa da wər tat itawazazlaf .

text: When Judah saw her , he thought her to be an harlot ; because she had covered her face .
text2: As tat inay Yuda iɣil tənəssexrəmt fəlas udəm - net a təssəlsa .

text: And he turned unto her by the way , and said , Go to , I pray thee , let me come in unto thee ; ( for he knew not that she was his daughter in law . ) And she said , What wilt thou give me , that thou mayest come in unto me ?
text2: Ikk ' et fəl afay ən tarrayt in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Əndam a dər - əm nəmən ̣ sa , » fəlas wər is ̣ s ̣ en as a wa təd ̣ aggalt - net . Tən ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Ma di za takfa tənəmən ̣ sa dər - i . »

text: And he said , I will send thee a kid from the flock . And she said , Wilt thou give me a pledge , till thou send it ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ad am in əssəwəta aynəs daɣ aharay nin . » Tən ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ardeɣ mišan dər əššərəd n a di takfa təmət ̣ irt har i t ' idu təssəwəta . »

text: And he said , What pledge shall I give thee ? And she said , Thy signet , and thy bracelets , and thy staff that is in thine hand . And he gave it her , and came in unto her , and she conceived by him .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Ma təm ̣ os təmət ̣ irt ta dam z ' aga ? » Tən ̣ n ̣ - as : « Ad i takfa əjajwəl nak əd təzarkaten - net , əd təburək a tət ̣ t ̣ afa da . » Ikf - as - tan . Təzzar inaman ̣ sa dər - əs , təga tadist .

text: And she arose , and went away , and laid by her vail from her , and put on the garments of her widowhood .
text2: Təbdad , təgla , təkkas afər wa təssəwar , təqqal isəlsa - net win afartay .

text: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite , to receive his pledge from the woman ' s hand : but he found her not .
text2: Issəwat Yuda aynəs əmidi - net wa n Adulam fəl ad d ' awəy ɣur tənt ̣ ut kayatan win tət ̣ t ̣ af əm ̣ osnen təmət ̣ irt . Mišan wər tat in og ̣ ez .

text: Then he asked the men of that place , saying , Where is the harlot , that was openly by the way side ? And they said , There was no harlot in this place .
text2: Is ̣ s ̣ əstan dər - əs aytedan win əɣsarnen Enayim . In ̣ n ̣ - asan : « Ma təga tənəssexrəmt as kala təwar efay ən tarrayt ta ? » Ən ̣ n ̣ an ' as : « Wər kala a tu təmal tənəssexrəmt da . »

text: And he returned to Judah , and said , I cannot find her ; and also the men of the place said , that there was no harlot in this place .
text2: Iqqal Yuda imal as as wər tat igrew , amaran aytedan da ən ̣ n ̣ an wər təha tənəssexrəmt akal en .

text: And Judah said , Let her take it to her , lest we be shamed : behold , I sent this kid , and thou hast not found her .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yuda : « Tət ̣ t ̣ əfet aratan win ɣur - əs , fəlas wər areɣ ad əggəzan aytedan ši nnu . Aynəs za əssəwataɣ as t ' in mišan wər tətawagraw . »

text: And it came to pass about three months after , that it was told Judah , saying , Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot ; and also , behold , she is with child by whoredom . And Judah said , Bring her forth , and let her be burnt .
text2: As əganat karadat təlil dəffər adi ittəmal i Yuda as təd ̣ aggalt - net Tamar təssəxram , təga tadist . In ̣ n ̣ a Yuda : « Tətəwəkkəset du , tətəwəsəqqədet . »

text: When she was brought forth , she sent to her father in law , saying , By the man , whose these are , am I with child : and she said , Discern , I pray thee , whose are these , the signet , and bracelets , and staff .
text2: Amazay wa din tətawakkas təzammazal s əd ̣ aggal - net tən ̣ n ̣ ' as in : « Awedan wa ilan aratan a ənta a di igan tadist , əgmaya daɣ - ak ad təs ̣ s ̣ əna kud təzdayaɣ ejajwəl a əd təzarkaten - net əd təburək a , təməlaɣ i du məšši - ssan . »

text: And Judah acknowledged them , and said , She hath been more righteous than I ; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son . And he knew her again no more .
text2: Izday tan , Yuda in ̣ n ̣ a : « Tant ̣ ut ta təla fall - i tidət fəlas nak a tat wər nəzzəzlaf i barar in Šela . » A iga adi wər kala a dər - əs ilas ənəmən ̣ sa .

text: And it came to pass in the time of her travail , that , behold , twins were in her womb .
text2: As tənamahaz d iguz n əm ̣ zur itawas ̣ s ̣ an as eknewan a za tilu .

text: And it came to pass , when she travailed , that the one put out his hand : and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread , saying , This came out first ,
text2: Amazay wa ad tətaggaz am ̣ zur ig ̣ mad du əfus ən barar iyyan təqqan tənt ̣ ut ta n tənakbalt tawšet ən barar a əs tanallay zaggaɣat fəl at təssus ̣ ən as ənta ad d ' azzaran .

text: And it came to pass , as he drew back his hand , that , behold , his brother came out : and she said , How hast thou broken forth ? this breach be upon thee : therefore his name was called Pharez .
text2: Mišan issoɣal in əfus - net , azzar as du əmidi - net təhut . Təzzar tən ̣ n ̣ ' as tənakbalt : « Kay tərzeɣ du tarrayt im ̣ an nak ! » Adi da fəlas itawagg ' es ̣ əm Fares .

text: And afterward came out his brother , that had the scarlet thread upon his hand : and his name was called Zarah .
text2: Ihu du əmidi nnet , w ' as təqqan tanallay zaggaɣat daɣ tawšet - net , itawagg ' as es ̣ əm Zarax .

text: And the LORD was with Joseph , and he was a prosperous man ; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian .
text2: Is ̣ s ̣ an Əməli daɣ Yusəf , iqqal əmarzaɣ , iha ehan ən məšši - s .

text: And his master saw that the LORD was with him , and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand .
text2: Igr ' in məšši - s as is ̣ s ̣ an Əməli daɣ - as , irzaɣ arat kul wa itaggu .

text: And Joseph found grace in his sight , and he served him : and he made him overseer over his house , and all that he had he put into his hand .
text2: Igraw Yusəf saɣmar ɣur məšši - s ig ' ay amaššaɣal n ənaflis - net . Isannat ̣ t ̣ af tu əd təɣawšiwen kul šin n ahan - net .

text: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house , and over all that he had , that the LORD blessed the Egyptian ' s house for Joseph ' s sake ; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house , and in the field .
text2: Den da ad d ' izazzabbat Əməli albaraka fəl ahan n aw Masar wa , fəl əddəlil ən Yusəf . Ig ' Əməli tolas albaraka fəl a wa ihan aɣaywan - net kul harkid təwəgas - net .

text: And he left all that he had in Joseph ' s hand ; and he knew not ought he had , save the bread which he did eat . And Joseph was a goodly person , and well favoured .
text2: Is ̣ annat ̣ t ̣ af təla - net kul əd Yusəf har as abas t ' iwar ar tet ̣ t ̣ ay . Am ̣ aran ənta Yusəf təhossay azzat - net , igraw tablalt .

text: And it came to pass after these things , that his master ' s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph ; and she said , Lie with me .
text2: Dəffər a di tən ̣ kar tənt ̣ ut ən məšši - s ən Yusəf təla du sər - əs ən ̣ n ̣ iyat , təgmay daɣ - as a dər - əs inəmən ̣ su .

text: But he refused , and said unto his master ' s wife , Behold , my master wotteth not what is with me in the house , and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand ;
text2: Ugay , in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Wər təhən ̣ n ̣ iyaɣ əsənnət ̣ t ̣ əf wa di iga məšš - i d ar - es kul fəl təfləst a di iga .

text: There is none greater in this house than I ; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee , because thou art his wife : how then can I do this great wickedness , and sin against God ?
text2: Wər t illa wa di ogaran da , arat kul əle turagat - net ar iguz ən batu ən tənt ̣ ut - net . Ənnar əddəlil ətagga ark əmazal a ogdan d a wa , im ̣ osan təmazrəyt ən Məššina ? »

text: And it came to pass , as she spake to Joseph day by day , that he hearkened not unto her , to lie by her , or to be with her .
text2: Dər iga wen da təgla faw təgammay daɣ - as a dər - əs inəmən ̣ su mišan wər as is ̣ əsim .

text: And it came to pass about this time , that Joseph went into the house to do his business ; and there was none of the men of the house there within .
text2: Har əzəl iyyan wər t illa awedan waliyyan daɣ kəl ahan iggaz du ehan fəl a daɣ - as aknu əššəɣəl iyyan .

text: And she caught him by his garment , saying , Lie with me : and he left his garment in her hand , and fled , and got him out .
text2: Təzzar təbaz t ' əs takatkat - net tən ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Ayaw nəmən ̣ su dər - i ! » Iššəlw ' as in i takatkat , ozal , ig ̣ mad .

text: And it came to pass , when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand , and was fled forth ,
text2: As din təgra as oyya as du takatkat , id ̣ d ̣ əggag ,

text: That she called unto the men of her house , and spake unto them , saying , See , he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us ; he came in unto me to lie with me , and I cried with a loud voice :
text2: təzzar təɣra ddu aytedan n aɣaywan , tən ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Təhan ̣ n ̣ ayam ! Immeway du sər - na aw Ibri iyyan fəl a dana isaknu məlka : Fəlas iki a di du - iga igmay daɣ - i a dər - əs nəman ̣ sa mišan əsagɣare fall - as .

text: And it came to pass , when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried , that he left his garment with me , and fled , and got him out .
text2: As di isla as əsagɣare oyya ddu takatkat - net ɣur - i , ozal , ig ̣ mad . »

text: And she laid up his garment by her , until his lord came home .
text2: Tət ̣ t ̣ af takatkat ta har d os ̣ a aləs - net .

text: And she spake unto him according to these words , saying , The Hebrew servant , which thou hast brought unto us , came in unto me to mock me :
text2: Təzzar təssoɣal as əlqissat ta tən ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Akli wa n aw Ibri wa du tewaya sər - na ikk ' i du a di isaknu məlka .

text: And it came to pass , as I lifted up my voice and cried , that he left his garment with me , and fled out .
text2: Amazay wa ad əsagɣare oyya ddu ɣur - i takatkat - net , id ̣ d ̣ əggag .

text: And it came to pass , when his master heard the words of his wife , which she spake unto him , saying , After this manner did thy servant to me ; that his wrath was kindled .
text2: As das təɣrad igi ən salan kul iggaz t ' alham .

text: And Joseph ' s master took him , and put him into the prison , a place where the king ' s prisoners were bound : and he was there in the prison .
text2: Isat ̣ t ̣ armas du Yusəf ig ' ay daɣ kasaw wa əhan məskəsa n əmənokal , irtay dər - san .

text: But the LORD was with Joseph , and shewed him mercy , and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison .
text2: Is ̣ s ̣ an Əməli daɣ Yusəf , ig ' as arraxmat , issəɣmar t ' əmuzar ən kasaw .

text: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph ' s hand all the prisoners that were in the prison ; and whatsoever they did there , he was the doer of it .
text2: Təzzar , issəɣlaf əmuzar ən kasaw Yusəf iməskəsa kul , a wa itaggan kul ənta a ɣur du itakay .

text: The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand ; because the LORD was with him , and that which he did , the LORD made it to prosper .
text2: Əmuzar ən məskəsa wər isəɣrid fadda əššəɣəl ən Yusəf fəlas Əməli a daɣ - as is ̣ s ̣ anan , irzaɣ arat kul wa itaggu .

text: And Pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers , against the chief of the butlers , and against the chief of the bakers .
text2: Təzzar iggaz t ' alham nasan .

text: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard , into the prison , the place where Joseph was bound .
text2: Ig ' en Firɣawna ɣur əmuzar ən mag ̣ azan , daɣ kasaw , wa iha Yusəf .

text: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them , and he served them : and they continued a season in ward .
text2: Issəɣlaf tan əmuzar ən mag ̣ azan i Yusəf innət ̣ t ̣ af dər - san , har əgan azzaman daɣ kasaw .

text: And they dreamed a dream both of them , each man his dream in one night , each man according to the interpretation of his dream , the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt , which were bound in the prison .
text2: Daɣ ahad ̣ iyyanda imuzaran win den əgan targət daɣ kasaw s akk iyyat d almaɣna - net .

text: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning , and looked upon them , and , behold , they were sad .
text2: As ig ' aɣora os ̣ ' en du Yusəf , inay tan əzikanzaran .

text: And he asked Pharaoh ' s officers that were with him in the ward of his lord ' s house , saying , Wherefore look ye so sadly to day ?
text2: Təzzar is ̣ s ̣ əstan tan : « Ma fel təzikanzaram azalada ? »

text: And they said unto him , We have dreamed a dream , and there is no interpreter of it . And Joseph said unto them , Do not interpretations belong to God ? tell me them , I pray you .
text2: Əjjəwwaban - as : « Akk iyyan daɣ - na əd tərgət - net amaran wər t ' illa awedan wa ifragan emel nasnat . In ̣ n ̣ ' asan Yusəf : « Ifrag Məššina a dawan t akfu . Magaradat i əs tərgəten nawan . »

text: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph , and said to him , In my dream , behold , a vine was before me ;
text2: Imməgarad as əmuzar ən maššaɣalan win šašwinen Firɣawna əs tərgət - net : « Ənaya dat - i ašək n əzzəbib .

text: And in the vine were three branches : and it was as though it budded , and her blossoms shot forth ; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes :
text2: ašək en ila karad zəlan . Da da ad inzar a tu təlsa təjigay , d əzzəbiban əŋŋanen .

text: And Pharaoh ' s cup was in my hand : and I took the grapes , and pressed them into Pharaoh ' s cup , and I gave the cup into Pharaoh ' s hand .
text2: Takabart ən Firɣawna təha əfus in , ən ̣ kada du əzzəbiban win , əzmeq qan daɣ takabart , əzzalaɣ as tat in . »

text: And Joseph said unto him , This is the interpretation of it : The three branches are three days :
text2: « Ənta almaɣna ən tərget - nak , in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf , izəlan win karad n ašək əhan edagg ən karad ad ̣ an .

text: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head , and restore thee unto thy place : and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh ' s cup into his hand , after the former manner when thou wast his butler .
text2: Daɣ karad ad ̣ an Firɣawna a kay akfu atkul n almaqqam nak , issuɣəl kay əššəɣəl nak , təfrəga a das tələsa izul ən takabart , s əmmək w ' as das tat tətazzala anin .

text: But think on me when it shall be well with thee , and shew kindness , I pray thee , unto me , and make mention of me unto Pharaoh , and bring me out of this house :
text2: Amaran a di in wər tat ̣ t ̣ awa as təkna taɣra nnak , zəzəd amagarad sər - i i Firɣawna , təkkəsaɣ i in daɣ kasaw a .

text: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews : and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon .
text2: Fəlas əmətkəla du s əššil daɣ akal ən Kəl Ibri , am ̣ aran edag wa ənta da wər əmmozala a di igan daɣ kasaw . »

text: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good , he said unto Joseph , I also was in my dream , and , behold , I had three white baskets on my head :
text2: Assaɣa w ' ad in ̣ ay əmuzar ən maššaɣalan win šatšinen Firɣawna Yusəf as ikfa almaɣna ihossayan targət , in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Nak da orge . Daɣ tərgət in tawaya fəl aɣaf in karadat təsayyen əhanat təgəlwen šin əzodnen .

text: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh ; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head .
text2: Daɣ tasayt ta n afalla əhan tat i Firɣawna ənnuɣan kul ən təgəlwen šin əzodnen , mišan tas ̣ in du g ̣ ədad , ətat ̣ t ̣ in tanat daɣ tasayt təwarat eɣaf in . »

text: And Joseph answered and said , This is the interpretation thereof : The three baskets are three days :
text2: « Ənta da , in ̣ n ̣ ' as Yusəf , almaɣna n adi : šisayyen šin karadat adi karad ad ̣ an .

text: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee , and shall hang thee on a tree ; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee .
text2: Daɣ karad ad ̣ an ad ikkəs Firɣawna eɣaf nak , iššiləy kay daɣ ašək , atšin g ̣ ədad is ̣ an nak . »

text: And it came to pass the third day , which was Pharaoh ' s birthday , that he made a feast unto all his servants : and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants .
text2: Əzəl wa n karad im ̣ os amud ən təhut ən Firɣawna , iɣra ddu imaššaɣalan - net iga ddu daɣ - san əmuzar ən win tu šašwinen d əmuzar ən win tu šatšinen , win əhanen kasaw .

text: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again ; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh ' s hand :
text2: Issoɣal əmuzar ən win tu šašwinen əššəɣəl - net , ənta deɣ izzal takabart i Firɣawna ,

text: But he hanged the chief baker : as Joseph had interpreted to them .
text2: Amaran əmuzar ən win tu šatšinen iššolay tu , iɣsal du a wa dasan in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf .

text: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph , but forgat him .
text2: Mišan əmuzar ən win tu šašwinen wər d ' ikta Yusəf , it ̣ t ̣ əw t ' in .

text: And , behold , there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed ; and they fed in a meadow .
text2: Inay əs ̣ s ̣ ayat šitan əg ̣ ammadnat t ' idu əhossaynat əddəratnat ənnaznat əd ̣ d ̣ annat daɣ taddalət .

text: And , behold , seven other kine came up after them out of the river , ill favoured and leanfleshed ; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river .
text2: Am ̣ aran əg ̣ madnat du šiyyad əs ̣ s ̣ ayat Ənnil əbrarnen əlbaknat əkkanat šin n azzarnen əbdadnat dagma - nasnat daɣ təšəšwit n Ənnil .

text: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine . So Pharaoh awoke .
text2: Am ̣ aran šitan šin əbrarnen əlbaknen , ətšanat əs ̣ s ̣ ayat šin hossaynen əddəratnen . Təzzar in ̣ kar du Firɣawna daɣ etəs ̣ .

text: And he slept and dreamed the second time : and , behold , seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk , rank and good .
text2: Iqqal etəs ̣ ilas targət , inay : əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təɣaɣanen ət ̣ fasnen əhossaynat idkal tanat agabal iyyanda .

text: And , behold , seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them .
text2: Dəffər adi šiyyad ̣ əs ̣ s ̣ ayat əs ̣ s ̣ umnen issiqqad - tanat əhud , ədwalnat du dəffər šin azzarnen .

text: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears . And Pharaoh awoke , and , behold , it was a dream .
text2: Əlmaznat təɣaɣanen šin əs ̣ s ̣ umnen šin n əs ̣ s ̣ ayat ət ̣ fasnen zawwarnen . In ̣ kar du Firɣawna , igr ' in as awa targət .

text: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled ; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt , and all the wise men thereof : and Pharaoh told them his dream ; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh .
text2: As affaw da Firɣawna irriddad , isassaɣara ddu imaššaɣawan əd mus ̣ anan kul ən Masar . Imməgrad asan əs tərgət - net . Mišan waliyyan a t ' ikfan almaɣna nnet .

text: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh , saying , I do remember my faults this day :
text2: Təzzar ibdad du əmuzar ən maššaɣalan win tu šašwinen in ̣ n ̣ a i Firɣawna : « Ad assakta azala alxatatan in win okaynen .

text: Pharaoh was wroth with his servants , and put me in ward in the captain of the guard ' s house , both me and the chief baker :
text2: Əzəl iyyan iggaz kay alham in nak d əmuzar ən maššaɣalan win kay šatšinen , təgeɣ ana daɣ kasaw ɣur əmuzar ən mag ̣ azan nak .

text: And we dreamed a dream in one night , I and he ; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream .
text2: Norga nak dər - əs ahad iyyanda əkkullu ən tərgət d almaɣna nnet .

text: And there was there with us a young man , an Hebrew , servant to the captain of the guard ; and we told him , and he interpreted to us our dreams ; to each man according to his dream he did interpret .
text2: Kasaw wen nənimah ' ay d iyyan daɣ Kəl Ibri ašku wa n əmuzar ən mag ̣ azan nak . Nəmməgrad as əs tərgəten nana təzzar iffəssar anaq qanat s akk iyyan a wa tən ̣ n ̣ a tərgət - net .

text: And it came to pass , as he interpreted to us , so it was ; me he restored unto mine office , and him he hanged .
text2: Ənta əmmək wa as danaq - qanat iffəssar im ̣ os a wa : Nak issoɣal i əššəɣəl in , amaran ənta itawašalay . »

text: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph , and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon : and he shaved himself , and changed his raiment , and came in unto Pharaoh .
text2: Firɣawna izammazal , ad itəwəɣru Yusəf . Itawakkas du daɣ kasaw , ilza , isam ̣ m ̣ attay isəlsa . Təzzar ibdad du dat Firɣawna .

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , I have dreamed a dream , and there is none that can interpret it : and I have heard say of thee , that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « Nak orge , amaran ab ' i i di tanat iffəssaran , mišan əsləɣ as kay tətafassara targəten .

text: And Joseph answered Pharaoh , saying , It is not in me : God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace .
text2: Ijjəwwab as Yusəf , in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Wərge nakku , kala kala ar Məššina a dak z ' iməlan təkəbbert ta təge . »

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , In my dream , behold , I stood upon the bank of the river :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « Daɣ tərgət in an ̣ ay a əgeɣ as əbdada daɣ t ̣ ama n Ənnil ,

text: And , behold , there came up out of the river seven kine , fatfleshed and well favoured ; and they fed in a meadow :
text2: har din əs ̣ wada daɣ əs ̣ s ̣ ayat šitan əddəratnen əhossaynen as t ' idd əg ̣ madnat . Ənaznat ənbarnat daɣ taddalət . Ənaya tolas šiyyad ̣ əs ̣ s ̣ ayat ənšašnen , əbrarnen wəllen , əlbaknat , as wər kala ad ənaya tulat nasnat daɣ Masar . Šitan šin , əlkamnat du i šin azzarnen əddəratnen ətšanat tanat .

text: And when they had eaten them up , it could not be known that they had eaten them ; but they were still ill favoured , as at the beginning . So I awoke .
text2: Əɣradnat iguz ən tədusen nasnat mišan wər dasnat tanat təha tən ̣ fa fəlas əglanat əbrarnat . Təzzar ən ̣ kara du daɣ etəs ̣ .

text: And I saw in my dream , and , behold , seven ears came up in one stalk , full and good :
text2: Əlasa orgeɣ ənaya əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təɣaɣanen ət ̣ fasnen əhossaynat əwarnat agabal iyyanda .

text: And , behold , seven ears , withered , thin , and blasted with the east wind , sprung up after them :
text2: Dəffər adi šiyyad ̣ əs ̣ s ̣ ayat əlliswaynen əs ̣ s ̣ umnen , issiqqad tanat əhud , ədwalnat du dəffər šin azzarnen .

text: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears : and I told this unto the magicians ; but there was none that could declare it to me .
text2: Ən ̣ karnat təɣaɣanen šin əs ̣ s ̣ umnen əlmaznat šin ət ̣ fasnen . targəten šin əmalaq qanat i maššaɣawan mišan wər tan iha i di imalan almaɣna nasnat .

text: And Joseph said unto Pharaoh , The dream of Pharaoh is one : God hath shewed Pharaoh what he is about to do .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf i Firɣawna : Firɣawna targəten šin almaɣna nasnat iyyanda . Məššina a iran ad ak iməl arat w ' as ot ̣ as igi nnet .

text: The seven good kine are seven years ; and the seven good ears are seven years : the dream is one .
text2: Əs ̣ s ̣ ayat šitan šin di əhossaynen adi əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan , am ̣ aran əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təɣaɣanen šin əhos ̣ s ̣ aynen əntanatay da əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan : targət iyyatda .

text: And the seven thin and ill favoured kine that came up after them are seven years ; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine .
text2: Əs ̣ s ̣ ayat šitan šin d əg ̣ madnen agarew daɣ tilkamat əm ̣ osnen šin əlbaknen , əbrarnen , adi əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan , am ̣ aran əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təɣaɣanen šin əs ̣ s ̣ umnen issiqqad tanat əhud adi əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan ən laz .

text: This is the thing which I have spoken unto Pharaoh : What God is about to do he sheweth unto Pharaoh .
text2: A wa da a dak ən ̣ n ̣ eɣ ihogan as Məššina imal ak a wa z ' agu .

text: Behold , there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt :
text2: Ad d ' as ̣ in əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan ən tewant daɣ akal ən Masar kul .

text: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine ; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt ; and the famine shall consume the land ;
text2: Əlkəman asan əs ̣ s ̣ a ən laz har din at ̣ t ̣ awin aytedan tewant ta n ̣ ad , təg ̣ məd tən ̣ fa akal .

text: And the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following ; for it shall be very grievous .
text2: A wa z ' agu laz daɣ igi , ad in at ̣ t ̣ awin aytedan tewant ta as kala ad təga .

text: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice ; it is because the thing is established by God , and God will shortly bring it to pass .
text2: Tišit ən tərgət ta s ̣ anatat ənta a isannafalalan as Məššina isigatakkat tan ̣ at - net , am ̣ aran ad d issətrəb azzaman win .

text: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise , and set him over the land of Egypt .
text2: Əmərədda ihor d ad təsənnəfrəna aləs n əməli ən tayttay a za təssənnət ̣ t ̣ əfa əd tan ̣ at n akal ən Masar ket - net .

text: Let Pharaoh do this , and let him appoint officers over the land , and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years .
text2: Ihor tolas at tətkəla imaššaɣalan daɣ akal kul fəl a du tabazan təzunt ta n s ̣ əmmosat n a wa talayan aytedan daɣ təwəgas nasan daɣ elan win n əs ̣ s ̣ a ən tewant .

text: And let them gather all the food of those good years that come , and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh , and let them keep food in the cities .
text2: Əššidəwanet irawan ən sudar kul daɣ elan ən tewant win d əzaynen da , əššidəwanet alkama daɣ ɣərman win tizart ən Firɣawna , iqqəlet šiɣebəren , ag ̣ g ̣ əzanet tu .

text: And that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine , which shall be in the land of Egypt ; that the land perish not through the famine .
text2: Isudar win ad əqqəlan šiɣebəren y elan win n əs ̣ s ̣ a ən laz win z aginen daɣ akal ən Masar . As iga di akal wər tu z ihlək laz .

text: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh , and in the eyes of all his servants .
text2: Təg ̣ raz batu ta i Firɣawna d aytedan - net .

text: And Pharaoh said unto his servants , Can we find such a one as this is , a man in whom the Spirit of God is ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna y aytedan - net : « Mənid za nəgrəw aləs olan əd wa , iha in ̣ fas ən Məššina ? »

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , Forasmuch as God hath shewed thee all this , there is none so discreet and wise as thou art :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « Azzama issos ̣ an kay Məššina daɣ aratan win , wədi wər t illa awedan n əməli ən tayttay ar kay .

text: Thou shalt be over my house , and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled : only in the throne will I be greater than thou .
text2: Kay a z izaran y aytedan in , it ̣ t ̣ əf akal kul tan ̣ at nak , nak taɣmar ɣas as kay z agəra . »

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , See , I have set thee over all the land of Egypt .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « Əmərədda əgeq qay əmuzar ən Masar . »
