text: And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand , and put it upon Joseph ' s hand , and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen , and put a gold chain about his neck ;
text2: Ikkas du Firɣawna təsənd ̣ ərt daɣ ad ̣ ad - net ig ' et daɣ wa n Yusəf . Ig ' as telassay mallat təhossayat , iqqan as t ̣ akaza n urəɣ .

text: And he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had ; and they cried before him , Bow the knee : and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt .
text2: Issəwan tu tam ̣ ara - net ta n s ̣ anatat təm ̣ osat amalankay ərkaban əggəsan , ta iggan ənəmmehəz - net , əsagɣaren dat əs meddan iyyad ən ̣ n ̣ an : « gərəffətat ! » Təməwit ta da as issod ̣ af Firɣawna Yusəf tan ̣ at n akal ən Masar kul .

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , I am Pharaoh , and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna tolas i Yusəf : « Nak Firɣawna a m ̣ osa am ̣ aran ətkalaɣ ak əlwaši n as wər t illa awedan wa za isəffərəkrəkan arat daɣ akal ən Masar kul ar əs turagat nak . »

text: And Pharaoh called Joseph ' s name Zaphnath - paaneah ; and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Poti - pherah priest of On . And Joseph went out over all the land of Egypt .
text2: Iga i Yusəf es ̣ əm Tsafnat - Fanex , təzzar izzəzlaf tu Asnat elles ən Foti - Fera əlfəqqi n əɣrəm wa n On . Təzzar in ̣ kar du Yusəf iššokal daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as n akal ən Mas ̣ ar as it ̣ t ̣ af tan ̣ at - net kul .

text: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt . And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh , and went throughout all the land of Egypt .
text2: Yusəf ila karadat təm ̣ ərwen n awatay as d immeway i Firɣawna , əmənokal ən Masar . Ig ̣ mad du Yusəf dat Firɣawna iššokal daɣ am ̣ adal wa n Masar kul .

text: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls .
text2: Daɣ elan win n əs ̣ s ̣ a ən tewant , šiwəgas əganat amaknaw olaɣan .

text: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years , which were in the land of Egypt , and laid up the food in the cities : the food of the field , which was round about every city , laid he up in the same .
text2: Ad išadaw Yusəf isudar kul daɣ elan win di n əs ̣ s ̣ a daɣ akal ən Masar . A tan iɣabbar daɣ ɣərman . Əkkullu n əɣrəm ad iššidəw daɣ təwəgas šin t ' əhoznen .

text: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea , very much , until he left numbering ; for it was without number .
text2: A wa iga alkama wa iɣabbar daɣ igət ogda əd təblalen n am ̣ adal ən t ̣ ama n agarew , wər ifreg əšid ̣ ən - net fəl iba ən təla - net əket .

text: And unto Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came , which Asenath the daughter of Poti - pherah priest of On bare unto him .
text2: Dat azzaman win laz igraw Yusəf əššin bararan əd tənt ̣ ut - net Asnat , elles ən Foti - Fera əlfəqqi n əɣrəm wa n On .

text: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh : For God , said he , hath made me forget all my toil , and all my father ' s house .
text2: Barar - net wa n aɣafadday ig ' as es ̣ əm Mənašše fəlas in ̣ n ̣ a : « Məššina di in isat ̣ t ̣ awin tamaɣatirt in kul d aɣaywan nana kul . »

text: And the name of the second called he Ephraim : For God hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction .
text2: Wa n əššin ig ' as es ̣ əm Efraym fəlas in ̣ n ̣ a : « Ikf i Məššina aratan daɣ akal wa daɣ ənaya ark an ̣ ay . »

text: And the seven years of plenteousness , that was in the land of Egypt , were ended .
text2: Əɣradan əs ̣ s ̣ ' elan win tewant ɣas ,

text: And the seven years of dearth began to come , according as Joseph had said : and the dearth was in all lands ; but in all the land of Egypt there was bread .
text2: ənt ̣ an win laz əs təməwit as tan imal Yusəf . laz daɣ kallan kul , wa n Masar ɣas a əhan sudar .

text: And when all the land of Egypt was famished , the people cried to Pharaoh for bread : and Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians , Go unto Joseph ; what he saith to you , do .
text2: As iggaz laz akal wa n Masar kul ənta da , təzzar əkkan Kəl Masar Firɣawna , sakkarayan fall - as . In ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Aglat , akkat Yusəf , tagim arat wa dawan z an ̣ n ̣ u kul . »

text: And the famine was over all the face of the earth : and Joseph opened all the storehouses , and sold unto the Egyptians ; and the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt .
text2: As iɣrad laz d ̣ əgguz n akal kul olam Yusəf šiɣebəren ši n ̣ ad iga da , ad in izanzu alkama i Kəl Masar . Ikna laz d ̣ əgguz n aytedan daɣ Masar kul .

text: And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph for to buy corn ; because that the famine was so sore in all lands .
text2: A du gallan aytedan daɣ kallan kul əgammayan du alkama əs Masar əzanzin t in ɣur Yusəf , fəlas laz ikallan kul as tan id ̣ gaz .

text: And he said , Behold , I have heard that there is corn in Egypt : get you down thither , and buy for us from thence ; that we may live , and not die .
text2: « Nak əsleɣ as Masar ih ' et alkama , ərəsat tat , zanzat ana du daɣ - as a dana wər anɣu laz . »

text: And Joseph ' s ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt .
text2: Ərasan m ̣ araw məqqaran ən Yusəf sas Masar ad d azzanzin daɣ - as alkama .

text: But Benjamin , Joseph ' s brother , Jacob sent not with his brethren ; for he said , Lest peradventure mischief befall him .
text2: Yaqub wər dər - san iššedaw Benyamin wa n amad ̣ ray ən Yusəf fəlas in ̣ n ̣ a iksud a tu təgrəw təkma iyyat əntada .

text: And the sons of Israel came to buy corn among those that came : for the famine was in the land of Canaan .
text2: Əglan maddanəs n Israyil əddewan d aytedan wiyyad ̣ əntanay da əgmaynen alkama fəlas akal ən Kanan əntada ewad t ' in laz .

text: And Joseph was the governor over the land , and he it was that sold to all the people of the land : and Joseph ' s brethren came , and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth .
text2: Yusəf ənta azzaran y akal , ənta a innət ̣ t ̣ afan əd taɣawšay ta n nazzan n alkama y aytedan kul win n akal . Iməqqaran - net as t ' in os ̣ an əssəjadan dat - əs daɣ am ̣ adal .

text: And Joseph saw his brethren , and he knew them , but made himself strange unto them , and spake roughly unto them ; and he said unto them , Whence come ye ? And they said , From the land of Canaan to buy food .
text2: Inay Yusəf iməqqaran - net ɣas izday tan mišan is ̣ s ̣ əkn ' en as wər tan izday , iharaššat tan in ̣ n ̣ ' as ̣ an : « Məni du təfalam ? » Əjjəwwaban as , ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Akal wa n Kanan a du nəfal fəl a du nəzzanzu isudar . »

text: And Joseph knew his brethren , but they knew not him .
text2: Yusəf izday iməqqaran - net mišan əntanay wər t ' əzdayan .

text: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them , and said unto them , Ye are spies ; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come .
text2: Iktad du Yusəf targəten ši n ̣ ad itag sər - san , təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' as ̣ an : « Kawanay inas ̣ s ̣ asaman a təm ̣ osam , tos ̣ am du fəl ad tənəyam idaggan win ərkamnen daɣ akal . »

text: And they said unto him , Nay , my lord , but to buy food are thy servants come .
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Kala kala əmizwar , eklan nak nakkanay , as ̣ s ̣ a ɣas a du nəga ad nazzanzu isudar .

text: We are all one man ' s sons ; we are true men , thy servants are no spies .
text2: Nakkanay ket nana abba nnana iyyanda , nakkanay aytedan ən təfləst a nəm ̣ os , wər nəm ̣ os inas ̣ s ̣ asaman . »

text: And he said unto them , Nay , but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come .
text2: « Kala , kala , in ̣ n ̣ - asan , tos ̣ am du fəl ad tənəyam idaggan win ərkamnen daɣ akal ! »

text: And they said , Thy servants are twelve brethren , the sons of one man in the land of Canaan ; and , behold , the youngest is this day with our father , and one is not .
text2: Əjjəwwaban as : « Nakkanay eklan nak m ̣ araw - ena d əššin eraw ana aləs iyyanda ən Kanan . Amad ̣ ray nnana wa ənd ̣ ərran noyyay in ɣur abba nnana , am ̣ aran wa das waššaran aba tu . »

text: And Joseph said unto them , That is it that I spake unto you , saying , Ye are spies :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - assan Yusəf : « Nak adi da a dawan ən ̣ n ̣ e kawanay inas ̣ s ̣ asaman a təm ̣ osam .

text: Hereby ye shall be proved : By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence , except your youngest brother come hither .
text2: Am ̣ aran a kawan ajjarraba : " Əhadaɣ awan s es ̣ əm ən Firɣawna kud təfalam da iket wər di d os ̣ a amad ̣ ray nnawan .

text: Send one of you , and let him fetch your brother , and ye shall be kept in prison , that your words may be proved , whether there be any truth in you : or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies .
text2: Saglat iyyan daɣ wan a t ' id ' awəy , kawanay am ̣ aran at takkim kasaw , a kawan ajjarraba har əs ̣ s ̣ əna kud a wa di təgannam tidət wala bahu , as wər iga di əhada s es ̣ əm ən Firɣawna as kawanay inas ̣ s ̣ asaman . »

text: And he put them all together into ward three days .
text2: Ig ' en daɣ kasaw har əgan karad ad ̣ an .

text: And Joseph said unto them the third day , This do , and live ; for I fear God :
text2: As ig ' əzəl wa n karad , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan Yusəf : « Agat a wa dawan z an ̣ n ̣ a , a kawan ayya təddaram , fəlas Məššina a əksuda .

text: If ye be true men , let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison : go ye , carry corn for the famine of your houses :
text2: Kud tidət as təm ̣ osam aytedan ən təfləst ayyaq qawan , aqqam du iyyan daɣ wan daɣ kasaw , kawanay taglim tawəyam alkama y aɣaywan nawan iha laz .

text: But bring your youngest brother unto me ; so shall your words be verified , and ye shall not die . And they did so .
text2: Təzzar tawəyam i du amad ̣ ray nnawan ad əs ̣ s ̣ ənaɣ as tidət a di təgam am ̣ aran wər za tam ̣ m ̣ atim . » Ərdan s a wen da .

text: And they said one to another , We are verily guilty concerning our brother , in that we saw the anguish of his soul , when he besought us , and we would not hear ; therefore is this distress come upon us .
text2: Ad ətinəmən ̣ n ̣ in gar - essan , tidət as nətawaddab fəl əddəlil n amad ̣ ray nnana . Tərəmmeq ta iga as daɣ - na igammay a tu nayyu mišan wər das nəs ̣ s ̣ əsam , tərəmmeq tədi da a nəga azal a .

text: And Reuben answered them , saying , Spake I not unto you , saying , Do not sin against the child ; and ye would not hear ? therefore , behold , also his blood is required .
text2: Iššewal Ruben in ̣ n ̣ - asan : « Wərge əmalaɣ awan as dawan ən ̣ n ̣ eɣ ad wər tagim abakkad ̣ im ̣ osan təkma ən barar di ? Mišan wər di təs ̣ s ̣ əsamam . Əmərədda azni - net a daɣ - na itawaran . »

text: And they knew not that Joseph understood them ; for he spake unto them by an interpreter .
text2: Iməqqaran - net wər əs ̣ s ̣ enan as Yusəf igra a wa əgannan , fəlas əməššewəl a illan gar - es dər - san .

text: And he turned himself about from them , and wept ; and returned to them again , and communed with them , and took from them Simeon , and bound him before their eyes .
text2: Igguk kan in ad ihallu . adi iqqal du fəl ad asan iššiwəl , obaz daɣ - san Šimehon issəɣfal tu dat šit ̣ t ̣ awen nasan .

text: Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn , and to restore every man ' s money into his sack , and to give them provision for the way : and thus did he unto them .
text2: Omar Yusəf y a dasan təwət ̣ kəran sumad nasan alkama , itəwəssuɣəl tan əzrəf nasan , akk iyyan itəwəgget as əzrəf - net daɣ əsaməd - net . Omar tolas a tan itəwəkfu allaw . Itawagg ' asan a wen da .

text: And they laded their asses with the corn , and departed thence .
text2: Ət ̣ t ̣ ərken isumad nasan fəl əzdan nasan , əglan .

text: And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn , he espied his money ; for , behold , it was in his sack ' s mouth .
text2: As os ̣ an edag iyyan a daɣ z an ̣ sin ora iyyan daɣ - san əsaməd wa - net fəl ad d ' ikkəs y ajad - net a itša təzzar inay azrəf - net daɣ əmi n əsaməd .

text: And he said unto his brethren , My money is restored ; and , lo , it is even in my sack : and their heart failed them , and they were afraid , saying one to another , What is this that God hath done unto us ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a i midawan - net : « Ənəyat azrəf in itawasaɣal i du , ənta da ihan əsaməd in da , » təzzar təggaz tan t ̣ asa , tən ̣ daw tan taysəst , ad ətinəmən ̣ n ̣ in gar - essan : « Ma dana itag Məššina da ? »

text: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan , and told him all that befell unto them ; saying ,
text2: As din os ̣ an abba nnasan Yaqub daɣ Kanan əmalan as arat wa tan igrawan kul , ən ̣ n ̣ an as :

text: The man , who is the lord of the land , spake roughly to us , and took us for spies of the country .
text2: « Aləs wa im ̣ osan əmizwar ən Masar as din nos ̣ a iharaššat ana , in ̣ n ̣ a : " Kawanay inas ̣ s ̣ asaman a təm ̣ osam . "

text: And we said unto him , We are true men ; we are no spies :
text2: Nən ̣ n ̣ ' as nakkanay aytedan ən təfləst , wər nəm ̣ os inas ̣ s ̣ asaman .

text: We be twelve brethren , sons of our father ; one is not , and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan .
text2: Nakkanay m ̣ araw - ena d əššin nədraw abba , iyyan daɣ - na aba tu , wa daɣ - na ənd ̣ arran iqqim in ɣur abba nnana daɣ akal ən Kanan . Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ - ana əmizwar ən Masar : " Arat w ' as z əs ̣ s ̣ əna kud aytedan ən təfləst a təm ̣ osam ,

text: And the man , the lord of the country , said unto us , Hereby shall I know that ye are true men ; leave one of your brethren here with me , and take food for the famine of your households , and be gone :
text2: wədi a du tayyim ɣur - i iyyan daɣ - wan tətkəlam alkama tawəyam tu y iɣawnatan nawan a əlluznen .

text: And bring your youngest brother unto me : then shall I know that ye are no spies , but that ye are true men : so will I deliver you your brother , and ye shall traffick in the land .
text2: As din tos ̣ am tawəyam i du am ̣ adray nnawan wa n alallawa ad əs ̣ s ̣ ənaɣ as wər təm ̣ osam inas ̣ s ̣ asaman mišan aytedan ən təfləst , amaran əssuɣəlaq qawan amad ̣ ray nnawan , akfaq qawan turagat ad təssəɣləyam i təɣawšiwen nawan daɣ akal . " »

text: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks , that , behold , every man ' s bundle of money was in his sack : and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money , they were afraid .
text2: As əggazan šin n ikus n alkama akk iyyan os ̣ ' in daɣ əsaməd - net əsəkməs n əzrəf - net . As ənnayan isəkmas n əzrəf nasan təggaz tan t ̣ asa əntanay əd ši - ssan .

text: And Jacob their father said unto them , Me have ye bereaved of my children : Joseph is not , and Simeon is not , and ye will take Benjamin away : all these things are against me .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' asan abba nnas ̣ an Yaqub : « Bararan in a dər - i təzammazzayam , Yusəf abas t ' illa , ilkam as Šimehon , amaran taram ad tawəyam Benyamin . Adi kul nak ad d iqqal . »

text: And Reuben spake unto his father , saying , Slay my two sons , if I bring him not to thee : deliver him into my hand , and I will bring him to thee again .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Ruben : « As dak du wər ewaya Benyamin tanɣa bararan in ann əššin . Əfləs i sər - əs , a dak k ' id ' əssuɣəla . »

text: And he said , My son shall not go down with you ; for his brother is dead , and he is left alone : if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go , then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yaqub : « Barar in wər dər - wan iddew , fəlas amaqqar - net aba tu iqqim du ɣas - net . As tu təgraw təkma daɣ əšikəl nawan nak a waššaran a a di tawəyam s alaxirat fəl tayyant - net . »

text: And it came to pass , when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt , their father said unto them , Go again , buy us a little food .
text2: As əzəl wa d iɣrad alkama wa dd ' immewayan daɣ Masar , in ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i maddan - əs : « Əqqəlat , ələsat du inazzan n arat ən sudar . »

text: And Judah spake unto him , saying , The man did solemnly protest unto us , saying , Ye shall not see my face , except your brother be with you .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' as Yuda : « Aləs wen irkab šiməzzugen nana fəl a t ' in wər nəqqel wər in neway amad ̣ ray nnana . As wər iga adi wər dər - əs za nam ̣ m ̣ anay .

text: If thou wilt send our brother with us , we will go down and buy thee food :
text2: Kud za tard ̣ e sa dər - na təššidəwa amad ̣ ray nnana wədi ad nərəs Masar ad ak du nazzanzu isudar .

text: But if thou wilt not send him , we will not go down : for the man said unto us , Ye shall not see my face , except your brother be with you .
text2: Mišan as wər dər - na iddew wər za naglu fəlas aləs wen in ̣ n ̣ ' ana wər dər - əs za nam ̣ m ̣ anay ar s ad nəddew d amad ̣ ray nnana . »

text: And Israel said , Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me , as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Israyil : « Ənnar əddəlil tətaggim i təkma n as das təmalam əstizarat as təlam amad ̣ ray iyyan ? »

text: And they said , The man asked us straitly of our state , and of our kindred , saying , Is your father yet alive ? have ye another brother ? and we told him according to the tenor of these words : could we certainly know that he would say , Bring your brother down ?
text2: Əjjəwwaban , ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Aləs di əs ̣ əstan a dana iyyəwan əd m ̣ an nana əd marwan nana , is ̣ s ̣ əstan ana kud abba nnana iddar harwa wala , kud nəla amad ̣ ray wala . Təzzar nəjjəwwab i s ̣ əstanan - net . Awak məni a wa as za nəs ̣ s ̣ ən kud tara a iga ad as du nawəy amad ̣ ray nnana wala ? »

text: And Judah said unto Israel his father , Send the lad with me , and we will arise and go ; that we may live , and not die , both we , and thou , and also our little ones .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yuda y abba - net Israyil : « Ayy ' ana ad nən ̣ kər nəššikəl , fəl a du nərəg daɣ laz nakkanay dər - ək əd bararan nana .

text: I will be surety for him ; of my hand shalt thou require him : if I bring him not unto thee , and set him before thee , then let me bear the blame for ever :
text2: Nak at t ilmanan , nak a daq qu təs ̣ s ̣ ana as dak k id wər əs ̣ s ̣ oɣala . As t ' idu wər əge dat - ək təs ̣ s ̣ əna daɣ - i im ̣ an - net .

text: For except we had lingered , surely now we had returned this second time .
text2: Fadda ənnar wər nəllolat əmərədda nəga ddu tewaɣlay ta n s ̣ anatat . »

text: And their father Israel said unto them , If it must be so now , do this ; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels , and carry down the man a present , a little balm , and a little honey , spices , and myrrh , nuts , and almonds :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' asan Israyil abba nnasan : « Kud tan ̣ at əddi , wədi agliwat tawəyam daɣ sumad nawan kayatan win ofanen daɣ akal , tagim tan tən ̣ afut y aləs wen : arat ən məglan , d arat ən turawat , d ad ̣ utan əzodnen , d aratan wiyyad əqqurnen n eškan .

text: And take double money in your hand ; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks , carry it again in your hand ; peradventure it was an oversight :
text2: Awəyat ən ̣ ətfus n əzrəf , təssuɣəlam im ̣ an nawan a wa dd itawaggan daɣ sumad nawan , mijas təɣilt ɣas adi .

text: Take also your brother , and arise , go again unto the man :
text2: Awəyat amad ̣ ray nnawan , tən ̣ kəram , təqqəlam aləs di .

text: And God Almighty give you mercy before the man , that he may send away your other brother , and Benjamin . If I be bereaved of my children , I am bereaved .
text2: Təmmozal təhanint ən Məššina a maqqaran fall - awan issuɣəl awan du aləs di amad ̣ ray nnawan wahadan əd Benyamin . Nak amaran kud ətəwəkkas a ɣur - i ətawaggin bararan in wədi ətəwəkkəsanet ɣur - i ! »

text: And the men took that present , and they took double money in their hand , and Benjamin ; and rose up , and went down to Egypt , and stood before Joseph .
text2: Ədkalan šinufa nnasan d ən ̣ ətfus n əzrəf nasan , ən ̣ karan , əglan , əddewan əd Benyamin , ərasan Masar har əzzəkken dat Yusəf .

text: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them , he said to the ruler of his house , Bring these men home , and slay , and make ready ; for these men shall dine with me at noon .
text2: As inay Yusəf Benyamin iddəw dər - san in ̣ n ̣ a y əmuzar ən maššaɣalan - net : « Agu meddan a daɣ ahan , təgzəma teɣsay tasaŋŋaq qat fəlas meddan win a ɣur - i atšin ɣur ammasnazal a . »

text: And the man did as Joseph bade ; and the man brought the men into Joseph ' s house .
text2: Ig ' aləs wa arat wa das in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf : eway tan s ahan wa n Yusəf .

text: And the men were afraid , because they were brought into Joseph ' s house ; and they said , Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in ; that he may seek occasion against us , and fall upon us , and take us for bondmen , and our asses .
text2: Təggaz tan t ̣ asa assaɣa wa sər - əs əmmewayan , ad ətinəmən ̣ n ̣ in gar - essan : « A wa əddəlil n əzrəf wa n ̣ ad a din nos ̣ a daɣ sumad nana da a fəl nətawazargaz , fəl ad nətəwəd ̣ gəz , nətəwəsəknu tarna nəqqəl eklan , attarkaban daɣ - na əzdan nana .

text: And they came near to the steward of Joseph ' s house , and they communed with him at the door of the house ,
text2: Təzzar ən ̣ karan əhozan in əmuzar ən maššaɣalan as din ewadan imi n ahan wa n Yusəf ən ̣ n ̣ an as :

text: And said , O sir , we came indeed down at the first time to buy food :
text2: « Xa , aləs wa , s ̣ urəf ana ! Nakkanay id ̣ as ana as ̣ s ̣ a da nəzzənz ' in isudar ,

text: And it came to pass , when we came to the inn , that we opened our sacks , and , behold , every man ' s money was in the mouth of his sack , our money in full weight : and we have brought it again in our hand .
text2: as nəqqal aɣaywan nəššo ́ kal har dad nəns ̣ a nolam isumad nana akk iyyan os ̣ ' in daɣ əmi n əsaməd - net azrəf - net , itiwasaɣal t ' idu . Azrəf wa nəqqal du dər - əs ,

text: And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food : we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks .
text2: wər nəs ̣ s ̣ en wa tt ' igan daɣ sumad nana . Neway du tolas iyyan a daɣ nara isudar . »

text: And he said , Peace be to you , fear not : your God , and the God of your father , hath given you treasure in your sacks : I had your money . And he brought Simeon out unto them .
text2: Ijjəwwab asan , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Wər t ' illa ar alxer y awan , a kawan wər təggəz t ̣ asa . Məššina nnawan ənta məššina n abba nnawan ənta a kawan ikfan ərrəzəɣ daɣ sumad nawan . Azrəf nawan illikan as iggaz i əfus . » Ikkas asan du Šimehon .

text: And the man brought the men into Joseph ' s house , and gave them water , and they washed their feet ; and he gave their asses provender .
text2: Ig ' en aləs wa daɣ ahan ən Yusəf ikf ' en d am ̣ an əššoradan id ̣ aran nasan ikf ' əzdan nasan ələmmuz .

text: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon : for they heard that they should eat bread there .
text2: Əsammatagan du šin ̣ ufa nnasan iket di ad d ' itas ̣ u Yusəf ɣur ammasnazal fəlas əslan as da da az z atšin .

text: And when Joseph came home , they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house , and bowed themselves to him to the earth .
text2: As d ' iggaz Yusəf ehan əkfan t ' in šin ̣ ufa šin das d ' ewayan da , təzzar əssəjadan as .

text: And he asked them of their welfare , and said , Is your father well , the old man of whom ye spake ? Is he yet alive ?
text2: Is ̣ s ̣ əstan tan d a wa əxlakan , in ̣ n ̣ ' as ̣ an : « Abba nnawan w ' as di təgannam ma ixlak ? Iddar harwa ? »

text: And they answered , Thy servant our father is in good health , he is yet alive . And they bowed down their heads , and made obeisance .
text2: Əjjəwwaban as : « Akli nnak abba nnana wər ila malad , iddar harwa . » Əlasan ənazan , əssəjadan as .

text: And he lifted up his eyes , and saw his brother Benjamin , his mother ' s son , and said , Is this your younger brother , of whom ye spake unto me ? And he said , God be gracious unto thee , my son .
text2: Yusəf idkal asawad ̣ - net inay Benyamin amad ̣ ray nnet , rures n anna nnet , is ̣ s ̣ əstan tan : « Amad ̣ ray nnawan wa da as di təgannam ? » Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Ig ' ak Məššina arraxmat barar in ! »

text: And Joseph made haste ; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother : and he sought where to weep ; and he entered into his chamber , and wept there .
text2: Iggaz tu ətkər n amad ̣ ray nnet , itrab olɣat daɣ am ̣ m ̣ as n ahan - net , ad ihallu .

text: And he washed his face , and went out , and refrained himself , and said , Set on bread .
text2: As iššorad udəm - net iqqal tan du , igammay id ̣ uf ən tala daɣ m ̣ an - net , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Əggəzat šin tat ̣ t ̣ ay ! »

text: And they set on for him by himself , and for them by themselves , and for the Egyptians , which did eat with him , by themselves : because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews ; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians .
text2: Ətawakkasan as melkewan s aganna , iməd ̣ rayan - net s aganna , əd Kəl Masar win ɣur - əs əllanen s aganna , fəlas Kəl Masar wər ədərrəwan əd Kəl Əlyəhud , im ̣ os a wen arat wər noleɣ daɣ əddin ən Kəl Masar .

text: And they sat before him , the firstborn according to his birthright , and the youngest according to his youth : and the men marvelled one at another .
text2: Ətawasaɣaman dat - əs s əməzuzar n əket n elan nasan ad d ' obazan ɣur wa waššaran har wa ənd ̣ ərran . Ənimas ̣ wadan , gar - essan əqqanan ɣafawan nasan .

text: And he took and sent messes unto them from before him : but Benjamin ' s mess was five times so much as any of theirs . And they drank , and were merry with him .
text2: Ig ' asan du idəgran daɣ melkewan win - net , amaran wa n Benyamin isassagar tu əs s ̣ əmmos n ̣ ətfisan fəl win nasan . Əšwan , əfalawasan əntanay dər - əs .

text: And put my cup , the silver cup , in the sack ' s mouth of the youngest , and his corn money . And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken .
text2: Tagaɣ takabart in ta n əzrəf daɣ əmi n əsaməd ən wa ənd ̣ ərran təssərt ̣ əyaɣ as tat d əzrəf - net wa daɣ izzənza alkama . » Ig ' amaššaɣal wa innət ̣ t ̣ afan d ahan a wa das in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf .

text: As soon as the morning was light , the men were sent away , they and their asses .
text2: As affaw t ̣ ufat ətawašašakalan meddan , əzdan san əggigan .

text: And when they were gone out of the city , and not yet far off , Joseph said unto his steward , Up , follow after the men ; and when thou dost overtake them , say unto them , Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good ?
text2: Əg ̣ madan aɣrəm mišan wər əggugan as in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf y amaššaɣal wa innət ̣ t ̣ afan d ahan - net : « Aglu , əlkəm i meddan a n ahogan as tan tewada tan ̣ n ̣ aɣ asan : « Ma fəl tərazzamam alxer əs təkma ?

text: Is not this it in which my lord drinketh , and whereby indeed he divineth ? ye have done evil in so doing .
text2: Wər təs ̣ s ̣ enam as takabart a ənta a daɣ isas ̣ s ̣ u məšš - i , innay du sər - əs igitan win əkkəntalnen ? Wər təgem arat olaɣan . »

text: And he overtook them , and he spake unto them these same words .
text2: Ewat tan , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan a wen da .

text: And they said unto him , Wherefore saith my lord these words ? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing :
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Ma fəl məšš - ik igannu adi ? Eklan - net idag daɣ - san igi n əmazal olan d adi .

text: Behold , the money , which we found in our sacks ' mouths , we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan : how then should we steal out of thy lord ' s house silver or gold ?
text2: Təhan ̣ n ̣ ayaɣ as wala azrəf wa nəgraw daɣ mawan ən sumad nana daɣ akal ən Kanan , da neway awan t ' idu , məni za a w ' az za nakər azrəf wala urəɣ daɣ ahan ən məšš - ik ?

text: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found , both let him die , and we also will be my lord ' s bondmen .
text2: Iyyan daɣ - na wa ɣur du təgrawa takabart ibatet , amaran win d əqqimnen əqqəlanet eklan ən məšš - ik . »

text: And he said , Now also let it be according unto your words ; he with whom it is found shall be my servant ; and ye shall be blameless .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ - asan : « Ardeɣ s a wa tən ̣ n ̣ am , mišan wa ɣur du təgraw takabart ɣas az z ' abəza iqqəl akli , amaran kawanay ərsəbaɣ awan .

text: Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground , and opened every man his sack .
text2: Kullu n iyyan izizabbat tarmad əsaməd - net , olam tu .

text: And he searched , and began at the eldest , and left at the youngest : and the cup was found in Benjamin ' s sack .
text2: A tan itaggaz amaššaɣal innay tan , issən ̣ ta ddu ɣur wa waššaran har wa ənd ̣ ərran . Tətawagraw du daɣ əsaməd wa n Benyamin .

text: Then they rent their clothes , and laded every man his ass , and returned to the city .
text2: Ərmaɣan ad əzazarren isəlsa nnasan , kullu n iyyan iggigga ajad - net , əqqalan aɣrəm .

text: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph ' s house ; for he was yet there : and they fell before him on the ground .
text2: As din os ̣ a Yuda əd mad ̣ rayan - net , əggazan ehan wa n Yusəf . As t ' in os ̣ an harwa da ih ' ay , əssəjadan dat - əs .

text: And Joseph said unto them , What deed is this that ye have done ? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' asan Yusəf : « Ma im ̣ os əmazal wa təgam da ? Wər təs ̣ s ̣ enam as aləs ən šilat in ila fərregat ən mas ̣ nat n arat ikkintalan ? »

text: And Judah said , What shall we say unto my lord ? what shall we speak ? or how shall we clear ourselves ? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants : behold , we are my lord ' s servants , both we , and he also with whom the cup is found .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yuda : « Ma dak za nan ̣ n ̣ u məšš - i ? Ma dak za najjawwab ? Maz za nəkkəs im ̣ an nana ? Məššina a isaffaggan abakkad n eklan nak . Nakkanay da əmərədda ad nəqqəl eklan nak , nakkanay harkid wa ɣur du tətawagraw takabart . »

text: And he said , God forbid that I should do so : but the man in whose hand the cup is found , he shall be my servant ; and as for you , get you up in peace unto your father .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf : « Ənimaggaga d adi , igi n ark əmazal , aləs wa ɣur du tətawagraw takabart in ɣas a z ' iqqəlan akli nin , kawanay amaran taglim təggəzam alxer , təqqəlam abba nnawan . »

text: Then Judah came near unto him , and said , Oh my lord , let thy servant , I pray thee , speak a word in my lord ' s ears , and let not thine anger burn against thy servant : for thou art even as Pharaoh .
text2: Təzzar ihoz t ' id Yuda in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Əgmaya daɣ - ak məšš - i turagat n a dak əššiwəla da wər kay iggez alham fəlas šilat ən Firɣawna a təm ̣ osa .

text: My lord asked his servants , saying , Have ye a father , or a brother ?
text2: Kay im ̣ an nak məšši as dana təs ̣ s ̣ əstana kud nəla abba wala , təs ̣ s ̣ əstanaɣ ana kud nəla amad ̣ ray əntada wala .

text: And we said unto my lord , We have a father , an old man , and a child of his old age , a little one ; and his brother is dead , and he alone is left of his mother , and his father loveth him .
text2: Nəjjəwwab ak as nəla abba nnana waššaran əd barar - net ənd ̣ ərran igraw daɣ tušaray nnet , w ' as amaqqar net ̣ wa dər wər ig ' afandes , aba tu . Azzama ənta ɣas ad d ' iqqiman isannahal tu abba nnana tara .

text: And thou saidst unto thy servants , Bring him down unto me , that I may set mine eyes upon him .
text2: Tən ̣ n ̣ eɣ y eklan nak : " Awəyat i t ' idu har t ənəyaɣ əs šit ̣ t ̣ awen in . "

text: And we said unto my lord , The lad cannot leave his father : for if he should leave his father , his father would die .
text2: Nəjjəwwab ak nən ̣ n ̣ ' ak : " Barar wa wər ifreg abba - net a t ' id ' ifəl , as t ' id ' ifal at t ' iba . "

text: And thou saidst unto thy servants , Except your youngest brother come down with you , ye shall see my face no more .
text2: Mišan tən ̣ n ̣ eɣ y eklan nak : " As du wər təddewam d amad ̣ ray nnawan wər za tələsam agraw ən turagat n a dat - i tazzakkem . "

text: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father , we told him the words of my lord .
text2: As nəqqal akli nnak abba nnana nəg ' as batu ta dana təge .

text: And our father said , Go again , and buy us a little food .
text2: Am ̣ aran as dana in ̣ n ̣ a abba nnana : " Əqqəlat zanzat ana du arat ən sudar , "

text: And we said , We cannot go down : if our youngest brother be with us , then will we go down : for we may not see the man ' s face , except our youngest brother be with us .
text2: nən ̣ n ̣ - as : " Wər nəfreg tewaɣlay ar s an nəddəw d amad ̣ ray nnana . As dər - əs wər nəddew wər za nəgrəw turagat n an nazzakkat dat aləs wen . "

text: And thy servant my father said unto us , Ye know that my wife bare me two sons :
text2: Ijjəwwab akli - nnak abba nnana in ̣ n ̣ ' ana : " Təs ̣ s ̣ anam as tant ̣ ut in Raxil əššin bararan a di du teraw .

text: And the one went out from me , and I said , Surely he is torn in pieces ; and I saw him not since :
text2: Iyyan ifal i , m ̣ aran əkkasaɣ aššak as əmətši a iga fəlas har əmərədda wər t ' ənaya .

text: And if ye take this also from me , and mischief befall him , ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave .
text2: As ɣur - i təkkasam wa ənta da , təgraw tu təkma , wədi nak a waššaran a ad i tawəyam s alaxirat fəl tərəmmeq - net . "

text: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father , and the lad be not with us ; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad ' s life ;
text2: Əmərədda as nəqqal akli nnak , abba nnana , wər nəddew əd barar , azzama təməddurt - net təqqan daɣ - as ,

text: It shall come to pass , when he seeth that the lad is not with us , that he will die : and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave .
text2: wədi at t ' iba , nawəy akli nnak abba nnana a waššaran s alaxirat fəl tərəmmeq ən rur - es .

text: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father , saying , If I bring him not unto thee , then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever .
text2: Fəlas nak akli nnak a ilmanan barar a , ənneɣ y abba nnana : " As dak k ' idu wər əs ̣ s ̣ oɣala əhan i im ̣ an - net har faw . "

text: Now therefore , I pray thee , let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord ; and let the lad go up with his brethren .
text2: Əmərədda əgmaya daɣ - ak ad aqqama nak , ad əqqəla akli nnak əggəzaɣ edagg ən barar a , idaw ənta əd məqqaran - net , əqqəlanet ket nasan .

text: For how shall I go up to my father , and the lad be not with me ? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father .
text2: Man əmmək a wa zz ' əqqəla abba nin wər əddewa əd barar a ? Kala kala wər əfrega an ̣ ay n abba nin har tu tanɣu tərəmmeq ! »

text: And he wept aloud : and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard .
text2: Ikna tala haras əslan tu Kəl Masar , ewadan salan ehan ən Firɣawna ənta da .

text: And Joseph said unto his brethren , I am Joseph ; doth my father yet live ? And his brethren could not answer him ; for they were troubled at his presence .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf i məqqaran - net : « Nak Yusəf . Abba nin iddar harwa ? » Mišan iməqqaran - net wər əfregan a das ajjawwaban fəlas əhagan dat - əs .

text: And Joseph said unto his brethren , Come near to me , I pray you . And they came near . And he said , I am Joseph your brother , whom ye sold into Egypt .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf i məd ̣ rayan - net : « Ihazat i du ! » Təzzar əhozan du . In ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Nak Yusəf amad ̣ ray nnawan wa din təzzənzam , immeway əs Masar .

text: Now therefore be not grieved , nor angry with yourselves , that ye sold me hither : for God did send me before you to preserve life .
text2: Əmərədda ad wər tərməɣam tammag ̣ razam inazzan win din təgam , əmmewaya du da , fəlas Məššina a di kawan d ' issokan , a du tərəgam daɣ tam ̣ attant .

text: For these two years hath the famine been in the land : and yet there are five years , in the which there shall neither be earing nor harvest .
text2: Əmərədda əššin elan a ig ' akal ih ' ay laz am ̣ aran əqqiman in wiyyad ̣ s ̣ əmmos a daɣ wər z ' agin n ̣ abalan za wala allayan .

text: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth , and to save your lives by a great deliverance .
text2: Məššina izammazal i du dat - wan fəl igi n amaggaluz daɣ əzzurriya nnawan daɣ əddənet əd fəl areg nawan daɣ tamat ̣ t ̣ ant , taknim əgurəg .

text: So now it was not you that sent me hither , but God : and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh , and lord of all his house , and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt .
text2: Daɣ adi wərge kawanay a di d ' ewayan da , kala kala ar Məššina . Ənta a di igan ənaflis w ' ogaran ən Firɣawna idkal i dənnəg maššaɣalan n ahan - net kul , issod ̣ af i tan ̣ at n akal ən Masar kul .

text: Haste ye , and go up to my father , and say unto him , Thus saith thy son Joseph , God hath made me lord of all Egypt : come down unto me , tarry not :
text2: Əqqəlat tarmad abba nin tan ̣ n ̣ im as : " Ənta da a wa dak in ̣ n ̣ a rur - ek Yusəf : issod ̣ af i Məššina tan ̣ at n akal ən Masar kul . Akk ' i du tarmad .

text: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen , and thou shalt be near unto me , thou , and thy children , and thy children ' s children , and thy flocks , and thy herds , and all that thou hast :
text2: At təɣsəra daɣ am ̣ adal wa n Gošen təməla dagma - nin kay əd bararan nak əd hayawan nak d aharay nak wa ənd ̣ ərran əd wa zəwwaran , da wa ihan təla nnak kul .

text: And there will I nourish thee ; for yet there are five years of famine ; lest thou , and thy household , and all that thou hast , come to poverty .
text2: Da a dər - ək annat ̣ t ̣ afa fəlas harwa da əqqiman in s ̣ əmmos elan ən laz , fəl a kay wər iggez əššil kay d aɣaywan nak d a wa ihan təla nnak kul .

text: And , behold , your eyes see , and the eyes of my brother Benjamin , that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you .
text2: Təhan ̣ n ̣ ayam əs šit ̣ t ̣ awen nawan kawanay əd Benyamin amad ̣ ray nin as nak da a dawan iššewalan .

text: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt , and of all that ye have seen ; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither .
text2: Təməlam y abba nin ətəwəsəɣmar in daɣ Masar d a wa tənayam kul . Təd ̣ gəzam s a t ' idu tassaglim sa da . »

text: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin ' s neck , and wept ; and Benjamin wept upon his neck .
text2: Igabarrat Yusəf iri n amad ̣ ray - net Benyamin ad ihallu , ad ihallu Benyamin ənta da fəl əzir - net .

text: Moreover he kissed all his brethren , and wept upon them : and after that his brethren talked with him .
text2: Ad itəzələmmit iməqqaran - net kul , ihallu . Təzzar əggazan dər - əs šin n əməšiwal ket nasan .

text: And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh ' s house , saying , Joseph ' s brethren are come : and it pleased Pharaoh well , and his servants .
text2: Isalan n as ̣ s ̣ a ən məqqaran ən Yusəf ewadan ehan ən Firɣawna ig ̣ raz a wen i Firɣawna d aytedan - net .

text: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph , Say unto thy brethren , This do ye ; lade your beasts , and go , get you unto the land of Canaan ;
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « An ̣ n ̣ u i məqqaran nak : " ənta da arat wa za tagim : aglat gaggat šim ̣ ariwen nawan təqqəlam akal wa n Kanan .

text: And take your father and your households , and come unto me : and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt , and ye shall eat the fat of the land .
text2: Təzzar tawəyam i du abba nnawan əd təlaqqawen nawan a kawan akf ' edag w ' ofan daɣ akal ən Mas ̣ ar , təddəram əs šətša win ofanen daɣ akal . "

text: Now thou art commanded , this do ye ; take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones , and for your wives , and bring your father , and come .
text2: Omaraq qay s ad asan tan ̣ n ̣ a : " Ənta da a wa za tagim : Ad tədkəlam šim ̣ ariwen daɣ akal ən Masar i bararan - nawan əd təd ̣ oden - nawan , təsəggəlem du abba nnawan taglim du .

text: Also regard not your stuff ; for the good of all the land of Egypt is yours .
text2: Ad wər tammagrazam təyya n arat waliyyan fəlas a wa tt ' illan ofa daɣ akal ən Mas ̣ ar kul i nnawan . " »

text: And the children of Israel did so : and Joseph gave them wagons , according to the commandment of Pharaoh , and gave them provision for the way .
text2: Əgan bararan n Israyil a wen da . Ikf ' en Yusəf šim ̣ ariwen s alamar ən Firɣawna , ikf ' en tolas allaw n əšikəl .

text: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment ; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver , and five changes of raiment .
text2: Kulluk n iyyan ikf ' ay telassay am ̣ aran ikfa Benyamin karadat t ̣ əmad ən tamma n əzrəf , ikf ' ay tolas s ̣ əmmos səlsa aynaynen .

text: And to his father he sent after this manner ; ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt , and ten she asses laden with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way .
text2: Isassaway tolas y abba - net m ̣ araw əzdan əggigganen a w ' ofan daɣ akal ən Masar əd m ̣ arawat təzden əggigganen alkama əd təgəlwen d allaw y əšikəl - net .

text: So he sent his brethren away , and they departed : and he said unto them , See that ye fall not out by the way .
text2: As issəgla Yusəf iməqqaran - net , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Ad wər tannalhamam gar - ewwan . »

text: And they went up out of Egypt , and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacob their father ,
text2: Əfalan Masar , əg ̣ g ̣ əzzayan əqqalan abba nnasan Yaqub daɣ akal wa n Kanan .

text: And told him , saying , Joseph is yet alive , and he is governor over all the land of Egypt . And Jacob ' s heart fainted , for he believed them not .
text2: Əgan as isalan ən ̣ n ̣ an : « Yusəf iddar harwa , ənta fadda a it ̣ t ̣ afan tan ̣ at n akal kul wa n Masar . » Mišan ənta Yaqub wər arden m ̣ an - net fəlas wər dasan izzəgzan .

text: And they told him all the words of Joseph , which he had said unto them : and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him , the spirit of Jacob their father revived :
text2: Mišan as das əmalan arat kul wa dasan in ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf , inay šimariwen šin das d ' issəgla fəl a tanat in əwənan , əqqalan t ' idu m ̣ an - net .

text: And Israel said , It is enough ; Joseph my son is yet alive : I will go and see him before I die .
text2: « Adi da a igan , in ̣ n ̣ a Israyil , barar in Yusəf iddar harwa ! Ad agla at t ' ənəya harwa wər i aba ! »

text: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night , and said , Jacob , Jacob . And he said , Here am I .
text2: Iššewal Məššina y Israyil daɣ an ̣ ay daɣ et ̣ əs in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Yaqub ! Yaqub ! » Ikkəwan as : « Nak da »

text: And he said , I am God , the God of thy father : fear not to go down into Egypt ; for I will there make of thee a great nation :
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Nak Məššina , məššina n abba nnak . A kay wər təggəz t ̣ asa n iki ən Masar fəlas den da a kay z ' aga tamattay tagget .

text: I will go down with thee into Egypt ; and I will also surely bring thee up again : and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes .
text2: Nak im ̣ an in a dər - ək iddəwan əs Masar am ̣ aran illikan as nak a kay du z ' issuɣəlan . As kay z ' iba illa ɣur - ək Yusəf . »

text: And Jacob rose up from Beer - sheba : and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father , and their little ones , and their wives , in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him .
text2: Ifal Yaqub Ber - Šeba . Əssəwanan bararan n Israyil abba nnasan Yaqub ənta əd bararan nasan əd təd ̣ oden nasan šim ̣ ariwen šin dasan d ' issəgla Firɣawna fəl a tan in awəynat . Əwatan ihərwan nasan , ewayan təla nnasan kul ta əkrazan daɣ akal ən Kanan , ikka Yaqub Masar . əs Masar bararan - net , əd hayawan - net , əd təbararen - net əd təhayawen - net . Əzzurriya - net kul as dər - əs iddew .

text: And these are the names of the children of Israel , which came into Egypt , Jacob and his sons : Reuben , Jacob ' s firstborn .
text2: Əntanay da is ̣ mawan ən maddanəs n Israyil ( es ̣ əm - net wahadan Yaqub ) win os ̣ anen Masar : Aɣafadday - net es ̣ əm - net Ruben .

text: And the sons of Reuben ; Hanoch , and Phallu , and Hezron , and Carmi .
text2: Maddanəs ən Ruben əm ̣ osan Xenok , Falu , Xetsron əd Karmi .

text: And the sons of Simeon ; Jemuel , and Jamin , and Ohad , and Jachin , and Zohar , and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman .
text2: Maddanəs ən Šimehon əm ̣ osan Yəmul , Yamin , Ohad , Yakin , Isoxas əd Šul eššes ən wələt Kanan .

text: And the sons of Levi ; Gershon , Kohath , and Merari .
text2: Maddanəs ən Lebi əm ̣ osan Geršon , Kəhat əd Mərari .

text: And the sons of Judah ; Er , and Onan , and Shelah , and Pharez , and Zerah : but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan . And the sons of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul .
text2: Maddanəs ən Yuda əm ̣ osan Er , Onan , Šela , Ferets əd Zarax . Mišan Er d Onan aba tan daɣ akal wa n Kanan . Maddanəs ən Ferets əmos ̣ an Hetsran əd Xamul .

text: And the sons of Issachar ; Tola , and Phuvah , and Job , and Shimron .
text2: Maddanəs n Issakar əm ̣ osan Tola , Fuhax , Yašub əd Šimron .

text: And the sons of Zebulun ; Sered , and Elon , and Jahleel .
text2: Maddanəs ən Zəbulun əm ̣ osan Sered , Elon əd Yaxlel .

text: These be the sons of Leah , which she bare unto Jacob in Padan - aram , with his daughter Dinah : all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three .
text2: Əntanay da da bararan win teraw Leyya əd Yaqub daɣ Faddan - Aram , dəffər adi teraw tabarart - net Dina . Iqqal əket ən bararan - net əd təbararen - net karadat təm ̣ ərwen əd karad .

text: And the sons of Gad ; Ziphion , and Haggi , Shuni , and Ezbon , Eri , and Arodi , and Areli .
text2: Maddanəs ən Gad əmos ̣ an Isifyon , Xaggi , Šuni , Etsbon , Eri , Arodi , d Areli .

text: And the sons of Asher ; Jimnah , and Ishuah , and Isui , and Beriah , and Serah their sister : and the sons of Beriah ; Heber , and Malchiel .
text2: Maddanəs n Ašer əm ̣ osan Yimna , Yišfi , Bərya əd Serax tamad ̣ rayt nasan . Maddanəs ən Bərya əm ̣ osan Xeber əd Malkyel .

text: These are the sons of Zilpah , whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter , and these she bare unto Jacob , even sixteen souls .
text2: Əntanay da da bararan ən Zilfa tamaššaɣalt ən Laban ta ikfa ell - es Leyya . Teraw tan du əd Yaqub im ̣ os əket nasan maraw əd s ̣ ədis .

text: The sons of Rachel Jacob ' s wife ; Joseph , and Benjamin .
text2: Maddanəs ən Raxil tant ̣ ut ən Yaqub : Yusəf əd Benyamin .

text: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim , which Asenath the daughter of Poti - pherah priest of On bare unto him .
text2: Yusəf igraw bararan - net daɣ akal ən Masar Manašše d Efraym , teraw as tan du Asnat ell - es ən Foti - Fera əlfəqqi n əɣrəm wa n On .

text: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah , and Becher , and Ashbel , Gera , and Naaman , Ehi , and Rosh , Muppim , and Huppim , and Ard .
text2: Maddanəs ən Benyamin əm ̣ osan Bela , Beker , Ašbel , Gera , Naman , Exi , Roš , Muffim , Xuffin d Ard .

text: These are the sons of Rachel , which were born to Jacob : all the souls were fourteen .
text2: Əntanay da da bararan ən Raxil win du teraw i Yaqub , im ̣ os əket nasan m ̣ araw d əkkoz .

text: And the sons of Dan ; Hushim .
text2: Rures ən Dan im ̣ os Rušim .

text: And the sons of Naphtali ; Jahzeel , and Guni , and Jezer , and Shillem .
text2: Maddanəs ən Naftali əm ̣ osan Yaxtsel , Guni , Yetser əd Šilem .

text: These are the sons of Bilhah , which Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter , and she bare these unto Jacob : all the souls were seven .
text2: Əntanay da da bararan ən Bilha tamaššaɣalt ən Laban ta ikfa ell - es Raxil . Teraw tan du əd Yaqub imos ̣ əket nasan əs ̣ s ̣ a .

text: All the souls that came with Jacob into Egypt , which came out of his loins , besides Jacob ' s sons ' wives , all the souls were threescore and six ;
text2: Əket n aytedan win d əg ̣ madnen Yaqub os ̣ an du Masar əddəwan dər - əs as wər əhenat təd ̣ oden ən maddan - əs , im ̣ os s ̣ ədisat təm ̣ ərwen əd s ̣ ədis .

text: And the sons of Joseph , which were born him in Egypt , were two souls : all the souls of the house of Jacob , which came into Egypt , were threescore and ten .
text2: Əket wen əwaran t ' in əššin bararan ən Yusəf əhunen daɣ Masar . Iqqal əket n aytedan kul ən Yaqub win d ' os ̣ anen Masar əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təm ̣ ərwen .

text: And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph , to direct his face unto Goshen ; and they came into the land of Goshen .
text2: Izzozar in Yaqub Yuda əs Yusəf fəl a das iməl as əntanay əzayan in Gošen . As d ' in os ̣ an akal ən Gošen ,

text: And Joseph made ready his chariot , and went up to meet Israel his father , to Goshen , and presented himself unto him ; and he fell on his neck , and wept on his neck a good while .
text2: isammatag Yusəf tam ̣ ara - net ikka akal wen fəl ad ilkəd y abba - net Israyil . Da da ad t ' inay a sər - əs in iggad igabarrat iri - net har iga tamert ihallu fəl əzir - net .

text: And Israel said unto Joseph , Now let me die , since I have seen thy face , because thou art yet alive .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i Yusəf : « Əmərədda kud ira ib ' i azzama ənayaq qay təddara harwa . »

text: And Joseph said unto his brethren , and unto his father ' s house , I will go up , and shew Pharaoh , and say unto him , My brethren , and my father ' s house , which were in the land of Canaan , are come unto me ;
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf i məqqaran - net d aɣaywan n abba nnet : « Ad agla ad əməla i Firɣawna as iməqqaran in d aɣaywan n abba nin win əhanen akal ən Kanan os ̣ an ' i du ,

text: And the men are shepherds , for their trade hath been to feed cattle ; and they have brought their flocks , and their herds , and all that they have .
text2: əməlaɣ as as imad ̣ anan a əm ̣ osan fəlas ihərwan a əlan gər za win mad ̣ rornen wala win zawwarnen ewayan tan du əntanay d a wa əlan kul .

text: And it shall come to pass , when Pharaoh shall call you , and shall say , What is your occupation ?
text2: As kawan in isassaɣra Firɣawna is ̣ s ̣ əstan kawan d əššəɣəl nawan , tan ̣ n ̣ im as : « Eklan nak imad ̣ anan as faw əm ̣ osan tan ɣur təmməd ̣ rəyt nasan har əmərədda , nakkanay əd marwan nana » , adi da a fəl za təfrəgam təməɣsurt daɣ am ̣ adal wa n Gošen fəlas Kəl Masar mušəkat a əgan im ̣ adanan . »

text: And he took some of his brethren , even five men , and presented them unto Pharaoh .
text2: Isan ̣ n ̣ afran daɣ məqqaran - net s ̣ əmmos , issəkn ' en i Firɣawna .

text: And Pharaoh said unto his brethren , What is your occupation ? And they said unto Pharaoh , Thy servants are shepherds , both we , and also our fathers .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i məqqaran ən Yusəf : « Ma im ̣ os əššəɣəl nawan ? » Ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Eklan nak təməd ̣ int əššəɣəl nasan , og ̣ azan tat du ɣur marwan nasan . »

text: They said moreover unto Pharaoh , For to sojourn in the land are we come ; for thy servants have no pasture for their flocks ; for the famine is sore in the land of Canaan : now therefore , we pray thee , let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen .
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an as tolas : « Nakkanay təzrek a du nəga s akal wa fəlas amassad ̣ on as abas iha akal wa n Kanan , ikn ' ay m ̣ anna iguz . Adi da fəlas eklan nak əgmayan daɣ - ak turagat n ad azzabben am ̣ adal wa n Gošen . »

text: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph , saying , Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee :
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Firɣawna i Yusəf : « Abba nnak əd məqqaran nak os ̣ an kay du .

text: The land of Egypt is before thee ; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell ; in the land of Goshen let them dwell : and if thou knowest any men of activity among them , then make them rulers over my cattle .
text2: Akal wa n Mas ̣ ar ih ' ak əfus zəzzəbbət tan daɣ aganna w ' ofan n akal . Əggəzanet am ̣ adal wa n Gošen . Kud tordeɣ as əhan tan wiyyad ̣ ən təfləst əs ̣ s ̣ annen əššəɣəl ən təməd ̣ int wəllen , taga tan ̣ at n aharay nin daɣ fassan nasan .

text: And Joseph brought in Jacob his father , and set him before Pharaoh : and Jacob blessed Pharaoh .
text2: Iddew du Yusəf əd Yaqub abba nnet , issəkn ' ay i Firɣawna , ig ' as Yaqub assalam n əzzəbun .

text: And Pharaoh said unto Jacob , How old art thou ?
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Firɣawna : « Mənəket elan nak ? »

text: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh , The days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years : few and evil have the days of the years of my life been , and have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage .
text2: Ijjəwwab as Yaqub , in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Elan ən təməddurt in t ̣ emeday n awatay əd karadat təm ̣ ərwen a əm ̣ osan . Taɣrəst in šigəzzulat ənaya daɣ - as ark - an ̣ ay , am ̣ aran wər togda əd ta n marwan in . »

text: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh , and went out from before Pharaoh .
text2: Iga Yaqub i Firɣawna šiwat ̣ riwen əmməzzayan .

text: And Joseph placed his father and his brethren , and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt , in the best of the land , in the land of Rameses , as Pharaoh had commanded .
text2: Issəɣsar Yusəf abba - net əd məqqaran - net , ikf ' en edagg ən təməɣsurt iggaz təla nnasan . Edag w ' ofan daɣ akal ən Masar ihan am ̣ adal ən Ramses , əmmək w ' as t omar Firɣawna .

text: And Joseph nourished his father , and his brethren , and all his father ' s household , with bread , according to their families .
text2: It ̣ t ̣ af Yusəf təməddurt n abba - net əd məqqaran - net d aɣaywan n abba - net s əket ən bararan - net .

text: And there was no bread in all the land ; for the famine was very sore , so that the land of Egypt and all the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine .
text2: Abas t illa a itamatšin daɣ akal ket - net fəl a wa iga laz daɣ igi , əm ̣ m ̣ utan kallan win Masar əd wa n Kanan .

text: And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt , and in the land of Canaan , for the corn which they bought : and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh ' s house .
text2: Iššedaw du Yusəf azrəf kul wa ihan akal wa n Masar əd wa n Kanan , im ̣ os inazzan n alkama . Eway tu s ahan ən Firɣawna .

text: And when money failed in the land of Egypt , and in the land of Canaan , all the Egyptians came unto Joseph , and said , Give us bread : for why should we die in thy presence ? for the money faileth .
text2: As iɣrad əzrəf kul wa ihan akal wa n Masar əd wa n Kanan əkkan du Kəl Mas ̣ ar ket nasan Yusəf , ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Əngəm ɣas wər za nam ̣ m ̣ at dat - ək akf ' ana a nətša ! »

text: And Joseph said , Give your cattle ; and I will give you for your cattle , if money fail .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' asan Yusəf : « Awəyat i du eharay nnawan azzama abas təlam azrəf , a kawan akfa daɣ adag - net a tətšam . »

text: And they brought their cattle unto Joseph : and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for horses , and for the flocks , and for the cattle of the herds , and for the asses : and he fed them with bread for all their cattle for that year .
text2: Təzzar ewayan du iherwan nasan kul i Yusəf daɣ awatay wa , ikf ' en išətša . A dasan isamaskal išətša əggəsan əd wəlli d ayfəd əd zəgran d əzdan .

text: When that year was ended , they came unto him the second year , and said unto him , We will not hide it from my lord , how that our money is spent ; my lord also hath our herds of cattle ; there is not ought left in the sight of my lord , but our bodies , and our lands :
text2: Okay awatay wa . As ig ' awatay wahadan əqqalan t ' idu ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Abas nəfrag ad ak nəɣbər məšš - i as abas nəla azrəf , ihərwan nana am ̣ aran təɣradam tan təla məšš - i , abas nəla a kawan nəkfa məšš - i ar ilamawan nana əd təwəgas nana .

text: Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes , both we and our land ? buy us and our land for bread , and we and our land will be servants unto Pharaoh : and give us seed , that we may live , and not die , that the land be not desolate .
text2: Ənnar əddəlil nəhallak nakkanay əd təwəgas nana ? Zanz ' ana an nəggəz təla ən Firɣawna nakkanay əd təwəgas nana , takfaɣ ana a nətša . Akf ' ana am ̣ asa a du nərəg aqqam am ̣ adal wər im ̣ m ̣ ut .

text: And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh ; for the Egyptians sold every man his field , because the famine prevailed over them : so the land became Pharaoh ' s .
text2: Izzənza Yusəf am ̣ adal kul ən Masar i Firɣawna fəlas aw Masar kul izzinz ' as in tawagost - net id laz a tan id ̣ gazan . Iqqal akal kul in Firɣawna .

text: And as for the people , he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of Egypt even to the other end thereof .
text2: Əggazan aytedan kul təla ən Firɣawna daɣ Masar kul .

text: Only the land of the priests bought he not ; for the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh , and did eat their portion which Pharaoh gave them : wherefore they sold not their lands .
text2: Im ̣ ədlan win n əlfəqqitan ɣas a wər izzənza fəlas ihakk ' en Firɣawna adagar iskatan wa daɣ ətattin , im ̣ os əlqanun , adi da fəlas din wər əzzənzan im ̣ ədlan win nasan .

text: Then Joseph said unto the people , Behold , I have bought you this day and your land for Pharaoh : lo , here is seed for you , and ye shall sow the land .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf i tamattay : « Əmərədda a kawan əzzənza i Firɣawna kawanay əd m ̣ ədlan nawan wədi am ̣ asa da tən ̣ bəlam tan .

text: And it shall come to pass in the increase , that ye shall give the fifth part unto Pharaoh , and four parts shall be your own , for seed of the field , and for your food , and for them of your households , and for food for your little ones .
text2: As təga ɣarat tolayam takfim Firɣawna təzunt tan s ̣ əmmosat tilem əkkozat təzunen šin d əqqimnen əm ̣ osnen am ̣ asa ən təwəgas nawan əd sudar nawan kawanay əd bararan nawan d aytedan win əhanen iɣawnatan nawan . »

text: And they said , Thou hast saved our lives : let us find grace in the sight of my lord , and we will be Pharaoh ' s servants .
text2: Ən ̣ n ̣ an as : « Tam ̣ attant a daɣ - ana du təraga . Nəgrəwet saɣmar ɣur məšš - i ad nəqqəl eklan ən Firɣawna . »

text: And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt unto this day , that Pharaoh should have the fifth part ; except the land of the priests only , which became not Pharaoh ' s .
text2: Iga Yusəf a wen əlqanun iktaban ən təwəgas n akal ən Masar kul a tt ' illan har azalada iga sər - əs əššəɣəl : təzunt ta n s ̣ əmmosat a igarraw Firɣawna . Im ̣ ədlan win n əlfəqqitan ɣas a wər nəha təla ən Firɣawna .

text: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt , in the country of Goshen ; and they had possessions therein , and grew , and multiplied exceedingly .
text2: Izdaɣ Israyil ( es ̣ əm wahadan ən Yaqub ) daɣ Masar daɣ edagg ihan am ̣ adal ən Gošen , əlan tu . Ad ətarawan əkannin əfələyləy .

text: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years : so the whole age of Jacob was an hundred forty and seven years .
text2: Iga Yaqub m ̣ araw elan d əs ̣ s ̣ a iɣsar daɣ Masar əqqalan elan ən təɣrəst - net kul t ̣ emeday n awatay d əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen d əs ̣ s ̣ a .

text: And the time drew nigh that Israel must die : and he called his son Joseph , and said unto him , If now I have found grace in thy sight , put , I pray thee , thy hand under my thigh , and deal kindly and truly with me ; bury me not , I pray thee , in Egypt :
text2: As du təhoz təmas ̣ tant - net iɣra ddu rur - es Yusəf in ̣ n ̣ ' as : « kud əgrawa ɣur - ək saɣmar əgmaya daɣ - ak a du taga əfus nak daw taɣma nin tədkəlaɣ i arkawal n as wər i za tammazala daɣ Masar , as təgeɣ adi , a di tassakna tara əd təfləst .

text: But I will lie with my fathers , and thou shalt carry me out of Egypt , and bury me in their buryingplace . And he said , I will do as thou hast said .
text2: As di aba təkkəssaɣ i daɣ Masar tawəyaɣ i əs zəkwan ən marawan in . » In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yusəf : « Ad ak agaɣ arat wa di tən ̣ n ̣ e . »

text: And he said , Swear unto me . And he sware unto him . And Israel bowed himself upon the bed ' s head .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yaqub : « Əhəd i . » Ihad as Yusəf . Təzzar issəjad Yaqub daɣ gərmuz ən tes ̣ s ̣ at - net .

text: And one told Jacob , and said , Behold , thy son Joseph cometh unto thee : and Israel strengthened himself , and sat upon the bed .
text2: Ittəmal i Yaqub itawan ̣ n ̣ ' as : « Barar nak da Yusəf ad d ' iglan da a kay inəy » . Iga ddu Yaqub šiɣurad - net har d ' iqqim daɣ tes ̣ s ̣ at .

text: And Jacob said unto Joseph , God Almighty appeared unto me at Luz in the land of Canaan , and blessed me ,
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i Yusəf : « Məššina əməqqar inifalal i du daɣ əɣrəm wa n Luz ( es ̣ əm - net əmərədda Bet - El ) daɣ akal wa n Kanan , iga fall - i albaraka nnet .

text: And said unto me , Behold , I will make thee fruitful , and multiply thee , and I will make of thee a multitude of people ; and will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession .
text2: Inn ' i : « A kay əsəssirəwa əsəffələyləyaq qay agaq qay šimattiwen aggotnen agaɣ akal a daɣ təla n əzzurriya nnak har faw .

text: And now thy two sons , Ephraim and Manasseh , which were born unto thee in the land of Egypt before I came unto thee into Egypt , are mine ; as Reuben and Simeon , they shall be mine .
text2: Əmərədda bararan nak win n əššin təgrawa daɣ Masar dat as ̣ s ̣ a nin bararan in a əmos ̣ an , wər tan əzlaya əd Ruben əd Šimehon .

text: And thy issue , which thou begettest after them , shall be thine , and shall be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance .
text2: Am ̣ aran bararan win təgrawa dəffər win , win di i nnak . Əntanay ad əgrəwan adagar nasan daɣ təkasit s es ̣ əm ən məqqaran nasan Mənašše d Efraym .

text: And as for me , when I came from Padan , Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan in the way , when yet there was but a little way to come unto Ephrath : and I buried her there in the way of Ephrath ; the same is Bethlehem .
text2: As d ' əfala am ̣ adal ən Fad ̣ an - Aram aba anna nak Raxil ɣur - i daɣ əšikəl daɣ akal wa n Kanan harwa wər in newed Efrata . Denda a tat ən ̣ bala daɣ tarrayt n Efrata . Aɣrəm w ' as itawan ̣ n ̣ u əmərədda Betlexem . Amazay wenda ad in iswad ̣ Yaqub daɣ maddanəs ən Yusəf , amaran šit ̣ t ̣ awen - net təssirkam tanat tušaray haras abas ifrag an ̣ ay wəllen . Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' i Yusəf : « Ma əm ̣ osan za win den ? » In ̣ n ̣ ' as Yusəf : « Bararan in a wa , win di ikfa Məššina da da . » Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ ' as Yaqub : « Zəhəz i tan du fəl a fall - asan aga albaraka . » Izzəhaz as tan du Yusəf , imməllat asan izalammat tan .

text: And Israel said unto Joseph , I had not thought to see thy face : and , lo , God hath shewed me also thy seed .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i Yusəf : « Wər əɣila a kay ələsa an ̣ ay fadda , əmərədda bararan nak da is ̣ s ̣ əkn ' i tan Məššina . »

text: And Joseph brought them out from between his knees , and he bowed himself with his face to the earth .
text2: Ikkas tan du Yusəf daɣ faddan - net , issəjad daɣ am ̣ adal .

text: And Joseph took them both , Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel ' s left hand , and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel ' s right hand , and brought them near unto him .
text2: Təzzar idkal tan Yusəf it ̣ t ̣ af Efraym s əfus - net wa n əɣil fəl ad iggəz zalgat ən Yaqub , amaran idkal tu Mənašše s əfus - net wa n zalgat fəl ad iggəz aɣil ən Yaqub , izzəhaz as tan du .

text: And Israel stretched out his right hand , and laid it upon Ephraim ' s head , who was the younger , and his left hand upon Manasseh ' s head , guiding his hands wittingly ; for Manasseh was the firstborn .
text2: Izzal du Israyil əfus - net wa n əɣil issəwar tu eɣaf n Efraym kuddeɣ as ənta wa ənd ̣ ərran . Izammazray ifassan - net fəlas əsəwər a iga wa n zalgat Mənašše kuddeɣ as ənta wa waššaran .

text: And he blessed Joseph , and said , God , before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk , the God which fed me all my life long unto this day ,
text2: Iga fall - assan albaraka - net in ̣ n ̣ a : « Məššina nin təgeɣ albaraka nak fəl bararan a , Məššina w ' as əlkaman marawan nin Ibrahim d Isxaq , Məššina wa im ̣ osan am ̣ adan nin ɣur təhut in har azala ,

text: The Angel which redeemed me from all evil , bless the lads ; and let my name be named on them , and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac ; and let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth .
text2: Məššina wa di issəfsan daɣ aššar . Əssudəranet es ̣ əm in d əs ̣ mawan ən marawan in Ibrahim d Isxaq , igatanet daɣ əddənet .

text: And when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim , it displeased him : and he held up his father ' s hand , to remove it from Ephraim ' s head unto Manasseh ' s head .
text2: As inay Yusəf abba - net as issəwar əfus - net wa n əɣil eɣaf n Efraym wər oggem a wen . Təzzar ibaz əfus n abba - net ikkas t ' idu fəl aɣaf n Efraym issəwar tu wa n Mənašše .

text: And Joseph said unto his father , Not so , my father : for this is the firstborn ; put thy right hand upon his head .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ a Yusəf y abba nnet : « Wərge adi abba nin , wa ənta a waššaran ! Səwər əfus nak wa n əɣil eɣaf - net . »

text: And his father refused , and said , I know it , my son , I know it : he also shall become a people , and he also shall be great : but truly his younger brother shall be greater than he , and his seed shall become a multitude of nations .
text2: Mišan ugay as abba nnet . In ̣ n ̣ ' as : « əs ̣ s ̣ ana barar in , əs ̣ s ̣ ana . Ənta da ad iqqəl tamattay igat , mišan amad ̣ ray - net ad as izar tadawla , iqqəl əzzurriya - net šimattiwen aggotnen . »

text: And he blessed them that day , saying , In thee shall Israel bless , saying , God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh : and he set Ephraim before Manasseh .
text2: Əzəl wədi da iga fall - assan albaraka - net in ̣ na : « Kəl Israyil ad əɣarrin is ̣ mawan nawan as ətaggin albaraka ad əgannin : « Idkal kay Məššina əmmək as idkal Efraym əd Mənašše » . Adi da a fəl izzozar Efraym i Mənašše .

text: And Israel said unto Joseph , Behold , I die : but God shall be with you , and bring you again unto the land of your fathers .
text2: Təzzar in ̣ n ̣ a Yaqub i Yusəf : « Nak ad i iba tarmad mišan Məššina a daɣ - wan is ̣ s ̣ ən , a kawan issuɣəl akal ən marawan nawan .

text: Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brethren , which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow .
text2: Am ̣ aran ad ak əššita fəl adagar wa əkfeɣ iməqqaran nak akfaq qay am ̣ adal wa ərkaba daɣ Kəl Amori əs takoba nin d allaɣ in . »

text: And Jacob called unto his sons , and said , Gather yourselves together , that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the last days .
text2: « Idawat du a dawan əməla a wa kawan z igrəwan daɣ azzaman win du zaynen .

text: Gather yourselves together , and hear , ye sons of Jacob ; and hearken unto Israel your father .
text2: Idawat du bararan in , s ̣ əsəmat y awal in :

text: Reuben , thou art my firstborn , my might , and the beginning of my strength , the excellency of dignity , and the excellency of power :
text2: Ruben kay aɣafadday nin , Kay as ̣ s ̣ ahat in , kay eɣaf ən təɣurad in , Kay a ogaran ətəwəsəɣmar daɣ bararan in , Kay a ogaran təla ən fərregaten .

text: Unstable as water , thou shalt not excel ; because thou wentest up to thy father ' s bed ; then defiledst thou it : he went up to my couch .
text2: Təm ̣ osa angi n am ̣ an ozalnen Mišan a kay igməd almaqam nak , Wa n tizart y iməd ̣ rayan nak Fəlas təsaffallasa abba nnak S ənəmən ̣ sa wa təge d anna nnak .

text: Simeon and Levi are brethren ; instruments of cruelty are in their habitations .
text2: Šimehon əd Lebi iməd ̣ rayan olanen Šikabiwen nasan kayatan əkmanen .

text: O my soul , come not thou into their secret ; unto their assembly , mine honour , be not thou united : for in their anger they slew a man , and in their selfwill they digged down a wall .
text2: Sənnəməggəgaɣet šim ̣ ərkas nawan əd m ̣ an in Əqqamet ətəwəsaɣmar in Wər irtay dər - wan daɣ ahan in , Fəlas daɣ alham nawan , bararan in Ad tənɣam aytedan aggotnen daɣ tara ən m ̣ an təɣtasam agozan ən zəgran əddarnen .

text: Cursed be their anger , for it was fierce ; and their wrath , for it was cruel : I will divide them in Jacob , and scatter them in Israel .
text2: Təwar tulɣant alham nawan ilan šiɣərden Fəlas təkmawen a t ' əhanen . Təwar tulɣant aššar nawan ad d izzibben , Fəlas təhanint kawan wər nəha , əd m ̣ an mallolnen A kawan əzəmməzzəya əd temattay nin , Am ̣ aran əzəwwəziwəzaq qawan daɣ akal in .

text: Judah , thou art he whom thy brethren shall praise : thy hand shall be in the neck of thine enemies ; thy father ' s children shall bow down before thee .
text2: Yuda kay a əflasan məd ̣ rayan nak Ad tarna imagzaran nak , Maddanəs n abba nnak ad əssəjədan dat - ək .

text: Judah is a lion ' s whelp : from the prey , my son , thou art gone up : he stooped down , he couched as a lion , and as an old lion ; who shall rouse him up ?
text2: Yuda , barar in , ahar ənd ̣ ərran a dər toleɣ im ̣ an - net , Wa dd iyyəwanan daɣ təgmərt , iqqal du edag - net . Ikram id ̣ aran - net , Israd : ma ihalan əsəbdəd - net ?

text: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah , nor a lawgiver from between his feet , until Shiloh come ; and unto him shall the gathering of the people be .
text2: Taɣmar wər za təfəl ehan - net , Ət ̣ t ̣ əbil illa ɣur əzzurriya nnet Har d ' as ̣ u wa tt ' ilan im ̣ an - net , Ənta as ət ̣ t ̣ afnat təmattiwen tan ̣ at - net .

text: Binding his foal unto the vine , and his ass ' s colt unto the choice vine ; he washed his garments in wine , and his clothes in the blood of grapes :
text2: Ewad daɣ tənafləyt As iqqan ajad - net Daɣ təfs ̣ əq n əzzəbib - net , Irabbaz isəlsa nnet Daɣ esmad d əzzəwi nnet .

text: His eyes shall be red with wine , and his teeth white with milk .
text2: Isas ̣ s ̣ ahat esmad təməllay ən šit ̣ t ̣ awen - net , təssəmlal tes ̣ s ̣ ay n əx išenan - net .

text: Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea ; and he shall be for an haven of ships ; and his border shall be unto Zidon .
text2: Zəbulun ad iɣsər fəl t ̣ ama ən gərwan , Dad ətazakken əɣlalan win n am ̣ an . Akal - net igla har əɣrəm wa n Tsidon .

text: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens :
text2: Issakar im ̣ os ajad is ̣ s ̣ ohen , Itallaman gər məssəgan , Is ̣ aggad y alxeran .

text: And he saw that rest was good , and the land that it was pleasant ; and bowed his shoulder to bear , and became a servant unto tribute .
text2: As tan inay ad idakkal əzuk fəl zeran Išɣəl ardu s i tt ' ilan .

text: Dan shall judge his people , as one of the tribes of Israel .
text2: Dan ad as ̣ s ̣ ahen aytedan - net Šilat n iyyat tawšet daɣ šin n Israyil ket - net .

text: Dan shall be a serpent by the way , an adder in the path , that biteth the horse heels , so that his rider shall fall backward .
text2: Dan šila n taššolt təhat tarrayt - net Təddad agozan n ays fəl ad d ' ud ̣ u am ̣ awan - net .

text: I have waited for thy salvation , O LORD .
text2: Əge daɣ - ak at ̣ t ̣ ama nin fəl efsan , ya Əməli !

text: Gad , a troop shall overcome him : but he shall overcome at the last .
text2: Gad ad t ' əgrəwan majjarakan Mišan a tan arnu istəq qan .

text: Out of Asher his bread shall be fat , and he shall yield royal dainties .
text2: Ašer ila tagəlla tən ̣ fat , Ənta z ihakkin isudar win əzodnen əmənokal .

text: Naphtali is a hind let loose : he giveth goodly words .
text2: Naftali tədəmit təggoragat Tətaraw awleɣan əhos ̣ s ̣ aynen .

text: Joseph is a fruitful bough , even a fruitful bough by a well ; whose branches run over the wall :
text2: Yusəf šilan ənezər n ašək itarawan s igət Illan dagma n am ̣ an ən šat ̣ , Əg ̣ g ̣ aran taɣərt iləlad - net .

text: The archers have sorely grieved him , and shot at him , and hated him :
text2: Əgrawan tu kəl təganziwen s igət A tu nad ̣ d ̣ aban har əlan talilant , Əsaknin tu əzzəngu nnasan s igət .

text: But his bow abode in strength , and the arms of his hands were made strong by the hands of the mighty God of Jacob ; ( from thence is the shepherd , the stone of Israel : )
text2: Mišan ikna id ̣ uf ən təganzay nnet Ətawasas ̣ ahen zayyan ən fassan - net S əfus n Əməqqar wa əɣbada d as ̣ s ̣ ahat - net , S ənta as əheɣ tag ̣ g ̣ azt - net , Im ̣ os wa s əsahhadda fəl təɣurad - net ,

text: Even by the God of thy father , who shall help thee ; and by the Almighty , who shall bless thee with blessings of heaven above , blessings of the deep that lieth under , blessings of the breasts , and of the womb :
text2: S əddəlil ən Məššina nin wa kay ikfan tadhəlt - net , S əddəlil n Əməqqar wa fall - ak itaggan albaraka - net , Daɣ tən ̣ fa n akonak wa n jənnawan , D am ̣ an win d əg ̣ ammadnen eres ən m ̣ ədlan . Ig ' ak tolas albaraka daɣ ara ən t ̣ ədoden əd hərwan .

text: The blessings of thy father have prevailed above the blessings of my progenitors unto the utmost bound of the everlasting hills : they shall be on the head of Joseph , and on the crown of the head of him that was separate from his brethren .
text2: Abba nnak ihakku albarakatan As win marawan in ogaran tan , Afalla n ədɣaɣan win ərunen okayan tan . Eɣaf ən Yusəf azzabbenet fall - as albarakatan , Fəl takannart ən win d in ̣ n ̣ əfrannen daɣ məqqaran .

text: Benjamin shall ravin as a wolf : in the morning he shall devour the prey , and at night he shall divide the spoil .
text2: Benyamin uray a im ̣ os iɣišašen S aɣora ilammaz tagmərt - net Əs t ̣ akəst ad uzan agləz - net .

text: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel : and this is it that their father spake unto them , and blessed them ; every one according to his blessing he blessed them .
text2: Əntanay da da awalan win dasan iga abba nasan as fall - asan itaggu albaraka nnet . Əkkulluk n iyyan iga fall - as albaraka ən m ̣ an - net . Əntanay a daɣ əganat tawšeten an marawat əd s ̣ anatat n Israyil . Dəffər a di omar maddan - əs , in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Nak əmərədda tilkamat ən təɣrəst in a əhe . As di aba tən ̣ bəlam i ɣur abbatan in daɣ əɣəɣi wa ihan tawagost ta n Efron wa n aw Xet , ta təhat Makfela dagma n am ̣ adal ən Mamre daɣ akal wa n Kanan . Tawagost en da a izzənza Ibrahim ɣur Efron wa n aw Xet fəl ad iqqəl əɣəɣi wa tat ihan edagg ən zəkwan .

text: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife ; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife ; and there I buried Leah .
text2: Denda ad it ̣ awan ̣ bal Ibrahim əd tənt ̣ ut - net Sarata , denda ad it ̣ awan ̣ bal Isxaq əd tənt ̣ ut - net Raqqiyetu , denda tolas ad ən ̣ bala Leyya .

text: The purchase of the field and of the cave that is therein was from the children of Heth .
text2: Tawagost d əɣəɣi wa tat ihan ənzan du ɣur Kəl Xet . »

text: And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons , he gathered up his feet into the bed , and yielded up the ghost , and was gathered unto his people .
text2: As iɣrad Yaqqub ammar ən maddan - əs iqqal serrad - net , təga talɣa nnet , ilkam i marawan - net win aba .

text: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father : and the physicians embalmed Israel .
text2: Dəffər adi omar Yusəf ad əšširədan nasmagalan - net alzanazat ən ši - s , agin as ad ̣ utan əzodnen .

text: And forty days were fulfilled for him ; for so are fulfilled the days of those which are embalmed : and the Egyptians mourned for him threescore and ten days .
text2: Imutag win əkkozat təm ̣ ərwen n əzəl a dər du tagdin . Əgan kəl Masar əs ̣ s ̣ ayat təm ̣ ərwen n əzəl əhallin tu .

text: And when the days of his mourning were past , Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh , saying , If now I have found grace in your eyes , speak , I pray you , in the ears of Pharaoh , saying ,
text2: As okayan ad ̣ an win təweškent iššewal Yusəf y aytedan ən Firɣawna in ̣ n ̣ ' asan : « Kud a tən ̣ n ̣ am taram i təšəššiwədam i əmazal in a dawan z aga əs Firɣawna , tan ̣ n ̣ im as :

text: My father made me swear , saying , Lo , I die : in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan , there shalt thou bury me . Now therefore let me go up , I pray thee , and bury my father , and I will come again .
text2: " Abba nin as ədkala arkawal ɣur tilkamat ən təɣrəst - net as akal wa n Kanan a daq qu zən ̣ bəla daɣ əzəkka wa isammatag i m ̣ an - net . " Tan ̣ n ̣ im as tolas : " Ad id ' akfu turagat n ad agla a t in ən ̣ bəla ad d əqqəla . " »

text: And Pharaoh said , Go up , and bury thy father , according as he made thee swear .
text2: In ̣ n ̣ ' as du Firɣawna : « Aglu tammazala abba nnak tassanda arkawal wa das təge . »

text: And Joseph went up to bury his father : and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh , the elders of his house , and all the elders of the land of Egypt ,
text2: Ig ̣ g ̣ əzzay Yusəf ad in ammazal ši - s . Əddewan dər - əs maššaɣalan ən Firɣawna əd wəššaran ən nəqqima - net əd muzaran kul ən Masar ,

text: And all the house of Joseph , and his brethren , and his father ' s house : only their little ones , and their flocks , and their herds , they left in the land of Goshen .
text2: d aɣaywan ən Yusəf kul əd məqqaran - net d aytedan n abba nnet , wər d ' iqqim dəffər - san daɣ akal wa n Gošen ar bararan nasan əd herwan nasan win mad ̣ rornen əd win zawwarnen .

text: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen : and it was a very great company .
text2: Iddew Yusəf əd win əwannen əggəsan əd win əwannen malankaytan ərkaban əggəsan əntanay da . Im ̣ os šikkəlt təknat iget .

text: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad , which is beyond Jordan , and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation : and he made a mourning for his father seven days .
text2: As din ewadan asabbakkaw wa n Atad dagma ən Yorden əgan as tamazala təknat təzzəwwərt a daɣ sakarayan . Iga Yusəf daɣ adag wen əs ̣ s ̣ a ad ̣ an əm ̣ osnen təweškent y abba nnet .

text: And when the inhabitants of the land , the Canaanites , saw the mourning in the floor of Atad , they said , This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians : wherefore the name of it was called Abel - mizraim , which is beyond Jordan .
text2: As ənayan Kəl Kanan əɣsarnen am ̣ adal a təfiyyawt ta daɣ asabbakkaw wa n Atad ən ̣ n ̣ an : « Iket ən təfiyyawt ən Kəl Masar ! » . Adi da a fəl itawagga y adag wa es ̣ əm Abel - Mitsərayim , edag illan dagma ən Yorden .

text: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them :
text2: Əgan maddanəs ən Yaqub arat w ' as tan omar .

text: For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan , and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah , which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace of Ephron the Hittite , before Mamre .
text2: Ewayan alzanazat - net s akal wa n Kanan ən ̣ balan t ' in daɣ əɣəɣi wa ihan tawagost ta n Makfela , əɣəɣi wa izzənz ' Ibrahim ənta əd tawagost ɣur Efron wa n aw Xet fəl ad iqqəl edagg ən zəkwan dagma n am ̣ adal ən Mamre .

text: And Joseph returned into Egypt , he , and his brethren , and all that went up with him to bury his father , after he had buried his father .
text2: Yusəf dəffər tamazala ən ši - s iqqal akal wa n Mas ̣ ar ənta əd məqqaran - net kul d aytedan kul win əmmozalnen ši - s a dər iddew .

text: And when Joseph ' s brethren saw that their father was dead , they said , Joseph will peradventure hate us , and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did unto him .
text2: As ənayan məqqaran ən Yusəf as abba nnasan za aba tu , ad ətinəmən ̣ n ̣ in : « Ma za nagu kud Yusəf iggaz t ' alham nana , iru a daɣ - na izzəzal ark əmazal wa n ̣ ad a das nəga da ? »

text: And they sent a messenger unto Joseph , saying , Thy father did command before he died , saying ,
text2: Təzzar əzammazalan in sər - əs ən ̣ n ̣ an as in : « Abba nnana harwa wər t ' aba omar ana in ̣ n ̣ a :
